author: {'steamid': '76561198092610416', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1390640649}
review: Retro City Rampage es un homenaje amoroso a los clásicos de los videojuegos y a la cultura pop de los años 80 y 90. Con su estilo visual pixelado y su humor irreverente, te sumerge en un mundo abierto lleno de referencias nostálgicas y parodias ingeniosas. Desde tiroteos frenéticos hasta misiones absurdas, este juego te invita a explorar sus calles caóticas mientras te sumerges en una experiencia de juego divertida y llena de sorpresas. Retro City Rampage captura la esencia de la era retro con un toque moderno, ofreciendo horas de diversión para los amantes de los juegos clásicos y los nuevos jugadores por igual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073828934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 313, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1710480760}
review: It's a pretty fun old school style nod to GTA, though the first 30 minutes are swarmed with some of the most obnoxious pop culture references, almost as if it's key's jangling in your face. Other than that though, it's a pretty fun romp with some decent jokes thrown in, and I enjoyed my time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076807056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1709368979}
review: I remember being really sick as a kid and one shotting this game, it was really fun and enjoyed it a lot! About 8 years later and I one shoted this game again, had a lot of fun again and remember why this is such a good game. It’s witty arcade experience and even though its shorts I think it’s a good buy, this game is usually dirt cheap so give it a shot! Its like an Arcade GTA with a ton of retro references

author: {'steamid': '76561198996576298', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1705919822}
review:
Retro City Rampage é um jogo indie desenvolvido na Unity Engine que combina elementos de ação, aventura e humor em um mundo aberto repleto de referências à cultura pop dos anos 80 e 90.

Essencialmente, você assumirá o controle de um personagem em uma cidade pixelizada e vibrante, onde poderá participar de uma série de missões divertidas e desafiadoras. O jogo oferece uma variedade de mecânicas de jogo, incluindo combate, direção de veículos, exploração e minijogos, tudo apresentado com um estilo visual retrô e uma trilha sonora nostálgica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030685413', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 261, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1710076754}
review: Um jogo divertido e rápido, ás vezes tendo momentos desnecessariamente longos. A história não é lá muito interessante, e se for atrás do 100%, pode chegar em 10h de gameplay. Nele tem alguns desafios que tem o tempo muito curto para pegar a medalha dourada, tendo que ser feito várias vezes até conseguir essa classificação máxima. Recomendo pegar o jogo numa promoção, vale no máximo 15,00 isso.

author: {'steamid': '76561199517935282', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1704495419}
review: Retro City Rampage is an excellent homage to not only classic Grand Theft Auto, but also a plethora of other retro classics and 80's and 90's pop culture. The game plays like your typical top down shooter a kin to the likes of smash tv and has plenty of weapons to rampage with as you explore the city, cause mayhem and complete missions. Theftropolis is a well designed open world with tons of easter eggs and secrets to find and is very vibrant and colourful. The game has excellent 8-bit graphics and a very good soundtrack with some really catchy tunes. The games plot whilst not Shakespeare is definitely a good time and has some really fun moments and some good laughs. I highly recommend!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198402588414', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1701430974}
review:
Retro City Rampage™ DX is centered around a gameplay loop dominated by fetch quests, meta-humor, and gameplay mechanics, such as knockback, which can be frustratingly eccentric. The mechanics, designed in a manner where players can easily find themselves stunlocked or violently flung within seconds, often lead to an abrupt demise and the consequential loss of acquired gear and progress.

This game seems to cater predominantly to a specific demographic – a niche audience of Reddit nostalgics. The heavy reliance on meta-humor and the inclusion of gameplay elements that border on the impractical may deter those seeking a more refined and contemporary gaming experience. Retro City Rampage™ DX appears to prioritize nostalgic appeal over playability, making it a challenging title to recommend to a broader audience looking for a more polished and engaging gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998543056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 623, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1350716400}
review:
[b] > Be me, craving a nostalgic trip through pixelated mayhem 🕹️
> Stumble upon Retro City Rampage DX on Steam 🌐
> Expectations as high as Mario after consuming a super mushroom 🍄

> Boot up the game.exe
> Immediately hit with a wave of retro goodness
> It's like the '80s threw up all over my screen in the best possible way 🌈

> Start the story mode
> Realize the protagonist is basically a pixelated maniac with a mission
> "A hero? A villain? Who cares! I've got pixels to wreck!" 💥

> The references hit harder than my parents' disappointment in my life choices
> I see more pop culture nods than a Family Guy episode on speed
> Half expect to see a pixelated Rick Astley rickrolling me in the background 🎤

> Missions are a rollercoaster of chaos
> From stealing cars to running over pedestrians, it's like GTA's retro cousin
> Police are more trigger-happy than an over-caffeinated Overwatch player ☕🚓

> Weapons are a smorgasbord of insanity
> Baseball bat? Check. Uzi? Check. Lightsaber? Double-check.
> "Luke, I am your pixelated rampage!" ⚾🔫🌠

> The soundtrack slaps harder than my grandma when I forgot to say "please"
> It's an '80s synth wave party, and I'm the uncontested dance champion 🎶💃
> If I could, I'd give the soundtrack a high-five. 🙌

> Graphics are a love letter to the NES era
> Pixel art so sharp it could cut through my expectations like a hot knife through butter 🗡️🎮
> The world is more colorful than a unicorn in a Skittles factory 🦄🌈

> Encounter boss battles that are more epic than a showdown between Chuck Norris and Godzilla
> I swear one boss had more pixels than my last Instagram post
> Beating them feels more satisfying than finding that last piece of the puzzle under the couch 🧩💥

> Finish the game
> Realize I've spent more time causing pixelated chaos than I have on my responsibilities
> 10/10 - Would let pixels wreck my life again
> Retro City Rampage DX: Because sometimes, you just need to pixelate your stress away. [/b]

[i] INT. HUNDRED ACRE WOOD - DAY

The scene opens in the serene Hundred Acre Wood. Winnie the Pooh, Piglet, Tigger, Rabbit, and Eeyore are gathered around a picnic table. Pooh has a game controller in his paw.

WINNIE THE POOH:
Oh, bother. What's this contraption, and why does it have so many buttons?

PIGLET:
Um, I-I think it's called a game controller, Pooh. We're going to play Retro City Rampage DX today.

Tigger bounces excitedly.

TIGGER:
Retro City what-now? Sounds like my kind of bounce!

Eeyore, ever the pessimist, sighs.

EEYORE:
Another game, another opportunity to be disappointed. Let's get on with it.

Pooh presses the start button, and the game begins.

WINNIE THE POOH:
Oh my, this looks rather pixelated, doesn't it? Reminds me of the time I got stuck in a honey jar.

RABBIT:
Pixelated or not, let's focus on the game. What are we supposed to do here?

They navigate through the chaotic retro city, causing mayhem and dodging pixelated police.

PIGLET:
Oh dear! Is it supposed to be this... explosive?

WINNIE THE POOH:
Seems a bit more exciting than my usual honey adventures. I wonder if there's a honey level.

They encounter a boss battle, and Pooh struggles with the controls.

WINNIE THE POOH:
Oh dear, how do I jump? And why is that pixelated person chasing us?

TIGGER:
Just bounce, Pooh! Bounce like you've never bounced before!

Eeyore deadpans.

EEYORE:
I'm not sure bouncing is the solution to every problem, but go ahead.

They defeat the boss, and the victory screen appears.

WINNIE THE POOH:
Well, that was an adventure! Quite different from our usual strolls in the wood.

RABBIT:
I must admit, it was rather exhilarating. I feel like I've aged a hundred years.

TIGGER:
Who needs honey when you can have explosions, am I right?

Eeyore mumbles.

EEYORE:
I suppose it was less disappointing than I expected.

They all share a laugh, and Pooh looks at the game controller.

WINNIE THE POOH:
Perhaps we should stick to honey-related adventures. This game is a bit too energetic for my liking.

They all nod in agreement.

PIGLET:
But it was fun, wasn't it?

TIGGER:
Totally tubular fun! Let's do it again sometime!

As they continue discussing their gaming adventure, the Hundred Acre Wood is filled with laughter and the occasional bounce from Tigger. [/i]

[B] (Parody of "Crazy Train" - Retro City Rampage DX Edition)

All aboard ha ha ha ha ha ha ha 🚂
Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay 🎶
Retro chaos, but that's how it goes
Millions of sprites living as foes
Maybe it's not too late
To learn how to score
And forget how to bore

8-bit wounds not healing
Life's a retro game
I'm going off the streets in a crazy rampage
I'm going off the retro in a crazy DX stage 🎮

Let's go
I've listened to bleepers
I've listened to boops
I've watched all the NPCs
Who make their own loops
One gamer conditioned to jump and roll
The joystick sells it, and you play the role

8-bit wounds still screaming
Driving me retro insane
I'm going off the streets in a crazy rampage
I'm going off the retro in a crazy DX stage 🕹️

I know that things are going wrong for me
You gotta listen to my sprites, yeah 🎤

Heirs of a pixel war
That's what we've become
Inheriting power-ups, I'm virtually numb
Retro madness, I just cannot bear
I'm gaming with something that just isn't fair

8-bit wounds not healing
Who and what's to retro-blame
I'm going off the streets in a crazy rampage
I'm going off the retro in a crazy DX stage 🌐 [/B]

author: {'steamid': '76561198052995192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 37, 'playtime_at_review': 16728, 'last_played': 1711225370}
review:
[b]Too Long, Didn't Read version:[/b]
If you enjoy pixelated action, like open-world gameplay, and don't mind a heavy-dosage of vintage gaming and popular-culture references, you just might enjoy Retro City Rampage!

[b]Too Long, But Gonna Read Anyways version:[/b]
This game has been in my library for years now, and on my radar even longer. I gotta hand it to the developer, even after all this time, it's still a sweet, crunchy pixelated dose of action-packed fun from yesteryear. The cars, the styles, the references, the arcade-style pick-up-and-play challenges, the mini-games, or even the opportunity to just go on a literal Retro City Rampage...

I love it, and definitely have recommended it to many of my friends who share the craving of retro-styled, if not some cheesier-than-pump-cheese-nachos gaming and pop culture references. I'd recommend it to other players as well, as long as they don't take the reference parts too seriously and just enjoy it for the 8-bit-terrific love-letter to the 80's and 90's that it is.

It also has a decent story to tell, so even if it's not something you come back to play frequently, the tale may be fun enough to remember bits and pieces from. Also, Pro-Tip: there's no actual "lives system" in this game, so completing the story at your own pace seems to be welcomed.

As an aside: I remember reading about Brian Provinciano's earlier builds of Retro City Rampage nearly a decade and a half ago on a GTA-related fansite. May even have been Gouranga, perhaps. Back then it was nicknamed things like "Grand Theftendo" and such. Word has it he had been working on it for other platforms before that, but it was an even longer time ago.

Understandably, BriPro decided to make his own thing out of his 8-bit GTA concept, and I couldn't be happier with the result, even all these years later. He's done so much to optimize and perfect his creations, and it often inspires me to do the same with my works as a content creator for games and consoles, as well.

Speaking of creations, I've made a few mod packs for Retro City Rampage that you can find in a guide right here on Steam! You could say I've poured a little bit of my heart and soul into working on this game, just as much as I enjoy playing it, too!

Lastly, I'll admit I might be one of THE major fans of this game, even in the here and now. I've bought lots of really cool merch based on this game, have the soundtrack from the pre-order mix-tape and CD albums, and have even e-mailed to and from the developer a few times over all these years. He's alright, and I look forward to future projects by him and VBlank Entertainment in general.

So... YEAH! Highly recommended. Go give it a shot, and aim to be the best PLAYER you can be!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994135829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1698401910}

author: {'steamid': '76561198143374291', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1701226769}
review:
En resumidas cuentas es un juego de una historia principal de 7 horas y, un par más, si queres completar todos los logros.

[h1]LO DIEZ PUNTOS[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Buena historia, repleta de guiños, cameos y referencias a programas y videojuegos de décadas pasadas (Tortugas Ninjas, Duck Hunter, Los Cazafantasmas, Volver al Futuro -siendo este el más remarcado en todo el juego al ser Doc el personaje al que vas a tener que ayudar en toda la historia-, etcétera.)
    [*] Variedad de armas de fuego como para tirar manteca al techo.
    [*] Una infinidad de cortes de pelo, sombreros, lentes y hasta un lugar donde podes transformar tu personaje en uno de los desarrolladores y/o ciertos personajes del juego mismo.
    [*] Cagado en retos. Desde minijuegos arcade hasta masacres estilo GTA II.
    [*] Estilo retro/8-bit bien logrado.
    [*] Misiones variadas.
[/list]

[h1]LO CHOTO[/h1]
[list]
    [*] El autolock al momento de disparar es una poronga², tosco como la puta madre.
    [*] Si bien las misiones secundarias presentan una cierta variedad como las principales, son MUY POCAS. 
    [*] Que insufrible que es que te atropellen en este juego. Los policías se la pasan chocándote y no siempre vas a tener los reflejos al mango para esquivarlos.
[/list]

[u][b]NOTA FINAL: 8.5/10[/b][/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994002775', 'num_games_owned': 6538, 'num_reviews': 1438, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1683934645}
review:
Not only does the game manage to create a good atmosphere of its own with its retro look, the game also manages to hit with a good comic note, and a lot of randomness.
In addition to the classic GTA-like gameplay, you also experience a lot of fast paced platformer parts in the game where a little more concentration is needed to stay alive.

The game also works great on a steam deck: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QDCt7XkPAfc

You play as the veteran criminal who accidentally ends up in the eighties with a time machine.
The time machine has been destroyed beyond repair and so you are trapped in the city of Theftropolis. The 8-bit world can be explored at your leisure from a top-down perspective, on foot or in stolen cars, just like in the first, second or London GTA. Soon after that you meet an absent-minded doctor with a time-traveling car, No it's not Rick, who can take you back to your own time, provided that after searching and finding the required parts anyway.

There is a lot to do in the 8-bit world of Theftropolis and you can also have a great time if you have had enough of the missions.
Challenges are scattered throughout the city, where you have to destroy as many cars as possible, for example. You can also earn extra money with a side job or pick up customers in your taxi.
You can then spend that money in the many shops, where you can buy a new haircut, weapons or a skateboard. And of course it's always fun to just plow over some innocent passersby and get the police after you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039766073', 'num_games_owned': 1267, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1671547560}
review:
Maybe I am too old for this. I mean nearly every second there is an easter egg in your face. The ideas are great. But the whole  gameplay, it feels like a game for people who needs constant input. There is really no pause or calming section, always on the run with thousands of effects and so much going on on the screen.

If you can get along with this, this maybe a great game for you. For me it is just flashy and annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165419568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1689701417}
review:
Homenaxe a GTA, a Regreso ao Futuro, a Super Mario, aos xogos de coches e motos da era 16bit (Lamborghini Challenge, Super Hang On e semellantes), ás Tartarugas Ninja, a... a todo o que soa a retro, en xeral.
O xogo funciona ben, sendo un sandbox en vista cenital, e entretén sen resultar demasiado complexo nin tampouco orixinal no sistema de xogo. Só se lle pode botar un pouco en falla que a historia funciona regular, pero compénsao con chistes constantes e moita autoconsciencia postmoderna -momentos como o "pintemos este camión de bombeiros e fagamos que a poli non nos descubra" son marabilla do humor sobre o formato, por exemplo. Tamén se agradece que é bastante curtiño e non chega a facerse nada pesado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420284290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1690251030}
review: The original RCR came out when I was around nine or ten and was basically my alternative to GTA. Unfortunately though it appears to have been lost to time and not too many people payed much attention to it's younger brother "Shakedown Hawaii". From the little I have played recently and from what I remember most of the humor is just reference "jokes" which isn't necessarily my kind of humor but the game itself is still enjoyable. This isn't some must play or a hidden groundbreaking masterpiece that should be remember for years to come but it is worth sitting down and playing for a few hours. I certainly enjoyed my time with it back in 2012 and I can thank it for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081961103', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1689671867}
review:
A decent indie parody of Grand Theft Auto, with a Gameboy Color/NES type of flare to it. Gameplay can be hit or miss (the physics engine, focused on being bouncy, can put you into a lot of instant death situations that can be annoying. The shooting mechanics are weird but easy once you get used to them. The jump and stomp were a good addition to the game's combat. The driving could use some work but is generally good enough to get you around and doesn't get 'in the way' of the experience), but I'd say there's more good than bad personally. The customization options are fun, some of the weapons are pretty good ideas (I especially enjoyed the Ghostbusters Proton Pack parody), and there is a decent amount of personality to even the pedestrians that spawn in. Some of the missions are generally better than others, as some tend to get into stage-specific gimmicks. This is likely a riff on the NES titles it borrows from, but I think it inherits a lot of the flaws of those games when it tries to replicate said gimmicks. Likely intentional, but still worth mentioning. 

The writing is okay sometimes as far as parodies go, but if you don't like reference humor I would steer clear as that's pretty much all the game has as jokes which make up the majority of the game's writing. Personally, some of the reference humor landed for me but others were genuinely so bad I wanted to turn the game off. Some of these references are also dated to exactly when the game came out (Epic Meal Time, Phil Fish, Jim Sterling, Destructoid, etc.) and they're by far some of the worst the game has to offer because it takes me right out. The references to other indies (Super Meat Boy, Bit.Trip, Minecraft) are all much less grating if only because those were also games trying to revive genres that were smaller in scope. 

Overall, I'd give it a soft recommendation. Pick it up on sale if you want a quick, small scale open world crime game, or are really into retro video game reference/meta humor. Otherwise, you'd be fine missing out on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984285823', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1807, 'last_played': 1564464184}
review:
Retro City Rampage DX, developed by Vblank Entertainment, is a delightful and action-packed homage to the 8-bit and 16-bit eras of gaming. With its nostalgic pixel art style, infectious humor, and an abundance of retro gaming references, Retro City Rampage DX stands as a true love letter to classic video games.

One of the standout features of Retro City Rampage DX is its charming retro-inspired visuals. The game pays homage to the visual aesthetics of the 8-bit and 16-bit era, with vibrant pixel art, detailed sprites, and a wide variety of retro-themed environments. The attention to detail in the game's art direction is evident, as every pixel exudes nostalgia and captures the essence of classic gaming. From the pixelated explosions to the nods to iconic characters and games, Retro City Rampage DX delivers a visual treat that resonates with players who grew up during the golden age of gaming.

The gameplay in Retro City Rampage DX is a joyful mix of open-world exploration, driving, and action-packed missions. Players assume the role of a protagonist who finds themselves caught in a time-traveling adventure, wreaking havoc and causing chaos in a city filled with parodies of familiar pop culture references. The game seamlessly blends various gameplay styles, from top-down shootouts to high-speed car chases, delivering a diverse and exciting experience. The intuitive controls and responsive gameplay mechanics ensure that every moment in Retro City Rampage DX is filled with retro-inspired thrills and challenges.

Retro City Rampage DX is also a treasure trove of nostalgic gaming references and Easter eggs. The game is packed with clever nods to classic games, movies, and popular culture from the past, bringing smiles to the faces of players who grew up during that era. From subtle nods to iconic characters to full-blown parodies of entire game genres, Retro City Rampage DX is a delightful treasure hunt for gamers seeking a blast from the past.

The humor in Retro City Rampage DX is infectious and perfectly captures the spirit of classic gaming. The game delivers a clever and self-aware storyline, filled with humorous dialogue, witty one-liners, and hilarious situations. The writing is sharp, embracing the tongue-in-cheek nature of the game and infusing every interaction with a playful charm that keeps players engaged and entertained throughout their adventure.

In conclusion, Retro City Rampage DX is a delightful and nostalgia-inducing gaming experience that pays homage to the golden age of video games. Its charming retro-inspired visuals, diverse gameplay, and infectious humor make it a standout title that captures the essence of classic gaming. Whether you're a fan of retro games or simply seeking a gaming experience that celebrates the past, Retro City Rampage DX delivers on all fronts. Prepare to dive into a world of pixelated adventures, pop culture references, and non-stop fun as you embark on a retro-inspired journey like no other.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995124351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1689234766}
review:
I am not a GTA person (in fact GTA bores me)...but I am a big retro fan. And looking at the shots for this game it looked like it would have a lot of variety.

Then I noticed that...nope...it is just boring GTA. Drive around on pizza delivery missions....do something that seems different for like 10 seconds and then back again. I was hoping that with open world I could drive around and see some cool stuff too. But nope...just running over people and evading cops that wouldn't arrest me anyway.

But this game did teach me something new: How to go about requesting a refund for a game. I've never done that on Steam until now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198881118095', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1691472126}
review:
A retro game in the style of Grand Theft Auto where you play as a little pixel dude running around a city with all sorts of weapons. You can steal vehicles and there are tanks, rocket launchers, and all sorts of references to old machines.

The game is a lot of fun to play. It's an easy game as a sandbox (Although some of the story missions are very hard).

THE CHRISTIAN PERSPECTIVE

The game does contain minor dirty language- "Holy Crap" which I encountered.

Some people may also argue that "jeez" is blasphemy. However, "Jeez" or "Geez" (How do you spell it?) is not God's name, it is a replacement expletive for blasphemy, so I don't count it. Doc Choc uses "Gosh" and again I don't think that's blasphemy.

This game does have you play as a bad guy- a criminal. The game mainly revolves around wreaking havoc in the city by blowing stuff up, driving around in cars, etcetera, However it'd be a far stretch to argue that this game glorifies evil. While yes, it is a grand theft auto clone, everything about it is cartoony and intentionally child-friendly. Policemen are not portrayed as evil or bad in the game. Evil is not portrayed as good, nor good as evil. It doesn't really seem to be selling any undermining ideology.

There's no blasphemy or bad language. The story is comedic.

Retro City Rampage has a story which is outwardly similar to that of GTA games- except it's retro media references and inside jokes. This game is not gonna convince anyone that being a criminal is honorable or good in some way.

This is a kid-friendly GTA clone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 602, 'playtime_forever': 1182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1182, 'last_played': 1683841587}
review:
Retro City Rampage is an awesome retro open-world game with lots of memes and references. It is played from a top-down perspective, similar to the original GTA and GTA 2.
The graphics are pixelated but have a lot of charm. They’re close to 8-bit but have some improvements. The soundtrack is neat, and you can even change radio stations in vehicles.
The game also has a decent amount of content. The story is cool but a bit short, as you can beat it in around 4-5 hours. It has short missions grouped by chapters, but they have a lot of variety. Sometimes it even changes genres, for example, to a 2D platformer.
The other major content is challenges, similar to rampages in GTA. They also have leaderboards, although getting really high scores is dependent on luck, specifically on NPC and vehicle spawns. Still, it’s not hard in general to get gold in all of them.
Other than that, there are miscellaneous tasks you can do, like cab driving and arcade mini-games. And of course, just causing mayhem, which is incredibly fun, especially if you buy power-ups, like super speed or straight up invincibility.
Still, I think the game could have a bit more content, like races. During its lifetime, it got updated to a DX and a DX+ version, but the additions were mostly quality-of-life features (which are still appreciated, don’t get me wrong).
I had a lot of fun 100% completing this game and can recommend it on sale. It has a lot of features, and you can see all the passion the devs poured into this, even years after its original release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1391350122}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202524232', 'num_games_owned': 2866, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1673889323}
review:
RCR/Retro City Rampage. What a journey this game went on, and THANKFULLY this was worth the wait. Development time this almost felt like an indie take on Duke Nukem Forever's wait time. But as already mentioned, this is/was well worth the wait. 

Retro City Rampage actually started as a homebrew demake  of GTA 3. For those unaware, a demake is essentially re-making a game for lesser hardware and is 99% of the time fan projects based on other games. Prime examples include a (no joke) Chinese bootleg of Final Fantasy 7 for the NES that was ACTUALLY expanded upon into the full game by fans. Or another example can be a the NES version of Left 4 Dead or Halo 2600 for the Atari 2600

Bear in mind the whole Duke Forever joke has relevance here because this game had been legitimately in development since 2002


But I digress. 

As time went on, Brian Provinciano (the crazy and creative bastard behind this fun as hell title) started added less and less copied GTA content and eventually made the game so ridiculous and over the top that the game's title was eventually changed to Grand Theftendo and then further changed into Retro City Rampage.

What we have here is a clusterfuck of references and parodies all thrown into unique missions (called stages in the game) along with game elements from items and abilities (called powerups) being everything from totally not a 1960's Bat-arang to the "speed kills shoes" which would make a certain hedgehog blush and also maybe want a lawyer, to a job of arming bombs for a certain samurai to take care of some half shell infestation annoyances.



Now all of this is fine and dandy and will make any nerd or nerdette (especially those close to or born in the 80s and 90s) laugh and smile and it adds icing to this chaotic and absurd cake. But that wouldn't matter if the gameplay sucked right?

Well THANKFULLY, the toppings on this pixelated sundae so to speak are just the tip of the iceberg and are wrapped around a top down 8 bit open world chaotic, bright, colorful and vibrant sandbox akin to Grand Theft Auto, precisely GTA 1, GTA 2 and GTA London. Which, for those unaware, were top down birds eye view twin stick games before they took on there 3rd Person brutal roots

Wrap this around a ridiculous story- I won't give a FULL story exposure and will avoid spoilers. But I'll give a basic synopsis

You play as the aptly and tongue-in cheekly named henchman for hire named Player. After doing a bank heist for a totally crazy and over the top circus jester crime boss named the Jester, you steal a time traveling phone booth porta potty hybrid and end up in the year 20XX in the city of Theftropolis. Now with a literal and figruative big vibrant future ahead of you in this ripe for the plucking metropolis. You have to engage into multiple satire filled and slapstick/parody style tasks all while repairing the time machine with Doc Bro-I mean Doc Choc.

Everything from fighting a "Bionicop" and rescuing prisoners with "Major Lee Solid" top down MGS style to taking a cartridge cleaning kit from the clutches of the evil Dr Von Buttnick in a totally not Smash T.V. mission to delivering XXX magazines in the style of paperboy, The Player does anything and anything to make his notoriety, street cred, and wallet as big as possible in this over the top acid trip of 80s and 90s mockery and nostalgia all in the name of crazy good fun.

What makes this work is that the game implements these references and jokes in ways that are more than just "ha ha do you remember this?!" (even though it does that SOMETIMES with dialogue and visual gags, which thankfully isn't overdone) and instead implements them into the GAMEPLAY. Making things flow smoothly and feeling a lot less monotonous than one would think


Add to this a VERY vibrant and catchy soundtrack, some cool cameos from other indie games, and a gameplay that's quite chaotic and over the top just like it's story, and this is what makes RCR a wild and memorable romp.

The best way to put it? What do this, the ACTUAL (big letters=emphasis) Rampage game and Zombies Ate My Neighbors all have in common? 

All of them are vibrant and colorful fast paced games with a big emphasis on comedy, parody, and oozing personality and throwing in slapstick/somewhat crass and tongue in cheek humor while also paying homage to the material that inspired it, but not enough to the point where legal teams would get excited or to where the games feel like shameless rip offs. Instead, all these games feel like big giant homages that still have enough to stand up on their own two legs

And at the end of the day, Retro City Rampage does exactly this for the GTA 1 and 2 formula and any and (almost) everything old school and 80s/90s

Get this game if you wanna carjack the 80s into a wild ride!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047463015', 'num_games_owned': 1244, 'num_reviews': 397, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1681037548}
review:
So, in the story mode, you work for the Doc Brown. 
To think of it, this might be one of the best Back to The Future games, although mainly because most of them are real trash: we have a decent platformer for SNES; the questionable, but bearable BTTF 2&3 for NES; the Telltale adventure game; and then this Retro City Rampage - much more satisfying joke than the rest of BTTF games.

I've ignored this game for the long time, because why play something retro-ish, when there are thousands of actual retro games which will run flawlessly through the emulators? 
But when I finally started playing it, I've enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066707964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1671165961}
review: Me encantaría decir que amo este juego, pero lamentablemente es súper aburrido. Intenté darle varias oportunidades, y en todas me pasaba lo mismo, su jugabilidad es muy aburrida y terminaba jugandolo solo por querer ver las referencias, lo cual me parece que es lo mejor que tiene el juego en si. Es hermoso el estilo artistico, todas las referencias a la cultura pop, cine, y videojuegos de los 80 y 90, pero solo eso me impulsaba a seguir jugandolo, y la verdad me quedé sin ganas ya. Amo todo el retrogaming que referencia este juego, pero no me emociona ni una milesima de lo que si me emocionan jugar otros juegos del estilo 8 bits modernos. Se que es una parodia, pero bueno, una parodia puede ser divertida igual, pero este no es el caso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021078112', 'num_games_owned': 917, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1668714303}
review: С этой игрой всё просто: если вам нужна ударная доза ностальгиюшки по денди, то играть стоит определённо. Если не нужно - смело проходите мимо. Эту попытку в ГТА с видом сверху вытаскивают целиком и полность исключительно отсылочки - как на 8битки, так и на тогдашние игры с newgrounds. Убери это - будет вообще полный пшик, это на первые ГТА совсем не тянет, что показала вышедшая после Shakedown Hawaii. А так - весело бегаешь под чиптюновое музло, беготня разбавляется смешными шутеечками, нестандартными уровнями типа дендигонок с видом сзади или плавания из первых черепашек. Побегал, но настольгировал - и хватит, больше тут делать нечего, но вот конкретно на паразитировании на старье тут душевно, настолько нагло и неприкрыто, что даже не отвратительно.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960496368', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1667502822}
review:
This game is good enough to be your go-to break game for a few days.
Spotting all the reference to popular movies, games and even just gameplay mechanics is very entertaining.
Wouldn't recommend actually listening to the audio after the first session, especially if you play with headphones.
Rather use it as a background activity while you listen to some podcast.
High replayability value after you finish the main story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097454672', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1662272909}
review: Great open world game with a ton of hardware accessibility, and I mean you could play this on a pager. Some parts are a little annoying, but it has so much to do that you can keep playing well after the story. Lots of jokes and pop culture references, collaborations with BIT.Trip, Super Meat Boy, and a lot more. I personally prefer controller but it can be played a lot of different ways. And I can't ignore that this was born from a GTA DE-make, but in spite of that it's a fantastic game for all ages (reading ability recommended).

author: {'steamid': '76561198421311263', 'num_games_owned': 1107, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1207, 'last_played': 1593736416}
review:
An elaborate love letter to '80s (and [i]very[/i] early '90s) gamer and nerdy pop culture in the form of a self-aware 8-bit parody version of Grand Theft Auto, and a genuine masterpiece of the "GTA clone" genre to boot.
A+ for retro aesthetic and pixel graphics
A+ for authentic chiptune sound
A+ for gameplay ("Nintendo-hard" at times, but an absolute blast)
A+ for ridiculous, over-the-top "story"
A+ for bajillions of awesome references and Easter eggs 
Seriously, this game is amazing; if any of those things tickle your fancy, just do yourself a favor and buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199049323669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1673173383}
review:
1 saat kadar oynamış olsam da gayet eğlendim görevlerin zorluğu olsun açık dünya da serbest gezme modu olsun her şey çok eğlenceliydi gtanın ilk oyunu gibi bir havası var. İndirimde alınır can sıkıntısına gider bazen sinirde etse gayet eğlenceli.
 Yanlız tek bir sorunu var bilgisayarınızın görüntü ayarlarıyla oynayabilir oyunu kapattığım gibi ana ekran acayip derecede büyümüştü zorla da olsa düzelttim tabi bu herkeste olmayabilir.
 Onun harici gayet güzel bir pixel arcade tarzı oyun tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138000450', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1661784441}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000642224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1661259913}
review:
I think I waited too long to play this game. It probably would've felt more fresh and fun back in 2013, but now all the nostalgia references are so played out that I didn't laugh at any of em. The game looks decent enough, and the missions give you enough to do, but the world it's set in isn't that fun to play around in, shooting feels lacklustre and sound effects are obnoxiously loud.

I think I may have been a bit nicer to it if I played it 10 years ago, but now I can't really recommend it in 2022. I didn't hate it, but I don't feel compelled to play more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031047150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1660681559}
review:
Admittedly, I only played the beginning of this game, but it was awful. It was 30 minutes of what are basically cut scenes filled with references to other games. They made me play Frogger, but I did not buy this game to play Frogger. 

I absolutely hated the beginning of this game. Guys, pro tip: I'm not here to watch some dumb gamer-culture movie, so just let me play the ****ing game, you cowards! I've owned this game for an eternity, and I finally tried it today because I was interested in buying their other game, Shakedown: Hawaii, but that interest is completely lost now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061481125', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1660338687}
review:
Surreal. El juego de las referencias y los "easter eggs".

Hay muchos otros títulos que meten tributos/guiños a otras sagas míticas del cine o los videojuegos, pero este debe tener el record. Si me pongo a enumerar todas no acabaría NUNCA! Se nota que hay mucho cariño metido aquí, está todo elegido con muchísima gracia y buen gusto.

En principio es un GTA pixelado retro mezclado con Smash TV... pero de repente lo mismo viajas en el tiempo con un DeLorean, que trabajas haciendo misiones para los Cazafantasmas, le mangas el coche a una parodia de Batman, vas al instituto de Salvados por la Campana, te metes en una tubería de Super Mario llegando a una fase de plataformas en 2D, y tropecientas cosas loquísimas más que reconocerá cualquiera que haya crecido en los años 80 y 90.

Además de la historia principal y las quests secundarias también hay un montón de secretos, tiendas, apariencias, vehículos que robar (y tunear) armas, echarte unas partidas en el salón recreativo, cambiar de peinado o incluso tatuarte.
La música es MUY buena, pega totalmente con el estilo gráfico del juego y el ritmo frenético que tiene. Mola.

Muy salvaje, es relajante echarse una partida rápida sembrando el caos total. Ahora que lo he terminado tendré que probar su "secuela" Shakedown Hawaii que tiene pintaza.

Esta ha sido mi reseña y al que no le guste que le den. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199067202097', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1659799606}
review:
Пародийная игра для тех геймеров, которые застали девяностые годы. Основной объект для подражания узнаётся уже по скриншотам - это, конечно, первые части GTA. Но находится место и для других знаковых вещей: как явных (мы успеваем, например, подраться с черепашками ниндзя, или помочь Марио в борьбе со злыми обитателями канализации), так и неявных (прохождение стелс-уровня, прячась в коробке, или биомеханическая рука в качестве оружия). А иногда высмеиваются и сами игры как таковые (герой по имени Player One называет себя в резюме мастером по езде из точки А в точку Б, ругается на очередной подводный уровень, получает от духовного учителя чит-код на режим Бога и т.д.) Вся эта несерьёзность приправлена и сюжетом соответствующим, повествующим о попадании героя в прошлое (починка машины времени требует использования, скажем, жвачки в качестве нужной запчасти). Разумеется, на одной сатире далеко не уедешь, но не подкачали и сами задания - город хоть и сильно уступает своему прототипу из GTA (хотя есть и худо-бедно следящие за порядком копы, и свой аналог "жажды смерти"), но миссии мы получаем и выполняем интересные, разнообразные и непростые, так что скучать не приходится. А когда и они приедаются - игра уже успевает закончиться, не заставляя терпеть устаревший геймплей до посинения.
Игра не для всех. Если новость о том, что в GTA когда-то была двумерная графика, у вас вызывает недоумение, лучше не трогайте, не поймёте ничего. Ну а если при виде скриншотов вы уже успели пустить ностальгическую слезу, то покупайте, вам понравится.

review:
중학생때쯤 사서 정말 재밌게 했던겜인데 지금 다시 하니까 왜 재밌게 한지 알거같음

곁으로 보기엔 그냥 도트 그래픽 GTA긴 한데 그거에 끝나지 않고 고전&인디 게임 패러디가 알차게 들어가서 여러모로 재밌던 겜

14년도 인디 오픈월드인데도 지금해도 게임이 나쁘지않음 말 그대로 오픈월드에 있어야 할건 다 있음

요즘 인디도 오픈월드는 별로 없고 찾아도 부족한점이 많이 보이는 작품이 많은데 그시절 인디가 어떻게 이런 분량의 작품을 만들었는지가 신기할 따름


9년이 넘게 오래된 게임이라 지금 하긴엔 좀 낡은감이 있지만 그래도 고전게임 패러디를 좋아하는 사람들에겐 추천하는 게임

author: {'steamid': '76561198276265207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1483752638}
review: The game itself is not compelling enough to say that it's good on a story or atmosphere level. Lots of references to retro games does not a good story or world make. But this is a visually-retro revival of the older Grand Theft Auto games, so I don't expect those qualities here anyway. Plus, this gets my thumbs up just for the extras. Who ever heard of porting your modern Steam game to Windows 3.1 and DOS?! This developer gets my kudos for sheer technical wizardry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070552717', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1686014810}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043728918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1648954060}
review:
It's like a Family Guy episode, with 8x the 1980's flashback gags. This game's existence is to reference as much from the 80's and 90's as possible.

	Story missions are completely disconnected from one another, serving as vehicles to reference either a game or movie. Mainline Missions side-track at random, or are just random and have barely anything to do with the main story. Events unfold haphazardly, or for no reason other than to reference something. The first 10 minutes of the first mission moves at a frantic pace, fitting in as many random pop-culture references as possible.

	Even the main time-travel plotline is pointless, since the city (including parts you destroyed pre-time travel) remains exactly the same. Even your crime boss--from the past--references the heist you did (in the future) as if you aren't in the past. It's just a vehicle for a Bill and Ted and Back to the Future reference. Why you even time-travelled in the first place is a complete mystery.

	The city is one giant reference. Billboards and store-fronts are callbacks to movies or games. There's the "Did not Finish?" GED advert with a character and font that looks like Duke Nukem (referencing DNFs long development cycle). 'Toadstool Tattoos'. There's even references to random video game websites (Destructoid), with entire missions surrounding this.

	I understand that this isn't supposed to be a serious game with a stringent narrative structure, but the game feels haphazard and barely stitched together. It's like an amalgamation of stuff, rather than a concise package. Because of the barrage of references, some of the parodies have no more depth than "Solid Snake likes boxes". 

If the game relaxed a little, it could create a coherent story (tying its references together) and give some of the jokes more room to breathe. Or at least implement them better than just shoe-horning them into missions half-way through as a cutaway gag. Then again, the blistering pace (and random insertion) is a part of the joke itself, so what do I know. 

	To its credit, some of the comedy did get a chuckle out of me. And the game at least understands how frantic it is, matching its tone with just as quick a pace everywhere else (animations, movement). I wasn't laughing all the way, but I didn't hate it either. Even if the 'all ur base' jokes are [i]extremely[/i] old.

	The good thing is that if you strip away all of this the game itself is solid. Ironically, referencing works to the game's benefit. RCR isn't a long game, with a main mission structure consisting of around 20 missions. Each can be finished in 10 minutes or less (usually). Because RCR has more references than a propsective employee's resume, each mission feels unique. 

	The Batman mission feels nothing like the Metal Gear mission or the SmashTV mission, for obvious reasons. Not only are they thematically different, but the game also works at giving you different toys or powerups to play with. Some missions are just straight copies of old games (Paper Boy mission). Even if the mission isn't entirely a reference, the developer never has you doing the same thing in exactly the same way. For all the criticism you can leverage against the humor, the developer definitely knew to keep things varied. Like darts (and the references), it's throwing a bunch of stuff at the wall.

	Which is good, because there's not a lot of side-content here. RCR has the rampages from GTAIII and VC (can't remember if SA had them), which task you with creating havoc within a time limit using different weapons. Otherwise, there are a few (emphasis on FEW) side-missions, but not much else. There are those 2 mediocre arcade games, I guess. Oh, and gambling. For all the talk of a 2D GTA, there's not a lot of side-content here. Or building interiors, for that matter.

	RCR took over a decade to complete, from 2002 to its release in 2012. Originally beginning as a GTA3 demake for the NES, the inclusion of pop-culture allusions grew so large that it eventually became its own thing. The good thing is that even if you don't care for the (I'm tired of using this da*n word already) references the game is still a fun 2D GTA that can hold its own. It has just enough to do to be enjoyable outside of the main mission structure, and is long enough to provide a modicum of entertainment without overstaying its welcome. Even if you hate its sense of humor, the campaign is fun and varied enough to make up for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198462429094', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1647056677}
review: If you enjoy tons and tons of video game and pop culture references then this game is for you.  Although on the down side that's all this game seems to offer. With no real standalone personality, all and all this game is best reserved for short bursts of play. As when I played this game I would get bored of it fairly quickly and roll my eyes whenever I'd see some subtle reference of something like the super Mario bros or batman. For the record I got this game on sale as I would definitely not pay full price for a game like this, so this does lead to some bias.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079029733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1687969518}
review: Why did it take so long for me to try this game? It's really fun! I will say that you should probably use a controller. First time I went with keyboard controls and it was a bit meh. Once I dusted off the old XBox controller this game played like magic. Seriously awesome experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045648963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1647187650}
review:
In essence, if you remember the original GTA games, this is basically this if it got added DLC content, with a bit more humor/dialogue, and cut-scenes. There is a bit of a mix of Saints Row kind of humor mixed in, but it plays as a top-down game. You do missions, and run open-world style and that's basically the game. Lots of missions to complete, little side challenges, and a bit of a story mode. Not a lot else to it, good fun casual hop into it GAME. I would recommend it on a sale though, imo $15 is a bit much. $5 would be a good price-tag. Definitely has the arcade OG feeling to it, and I love it. I'd say a realistic 30 to 40 hrs you can get out of this if you roamed around and did everything and want to get all achievements. Which compared to other games of this style it offers a lot of content.

TLDR? Run around and go PEW PEW PEW, challenges, and a story mode. Humor similar to Saints Row series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078588334', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1645352302}
review:
It was like if they turned the classic gta games and only added the fun parts. The game is great! The combat is pretty good considering the style of game. The OST is full of bangers, too! I loved this game from start to finish. It was a super enjoyable experience for the story alone! There's plenty to do after the story as well, I think.

Personal Rating: 7.5/10
Difficulty Rating: 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025263721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1644844428}
review:
J'ai persisté plus de deux heures mais non, rien à faire. Le jeu se veut open world mais reste très linéaire comme certains l'ont noté. Les clins d'oeil sont des coups de coude enfoncés bien profondément dans les côtes toutes les 2 minutes. J'avais passé beaucoup de temps à l'époque sur Gryzor, GTA ou Paperboy. Mais j'ai pas envie d'y rejouer, même sous la forme de mini-jeux, aujourd'hui. D'ailleurs, le jeu se vanne lui-même quand il fait référence à Mega Man 2. Ça n'arrache même pas un sourire tant on a l'impression d'être déjà gavé comme une oie.

Au final, ce qui aurait pu être un jeu à l'humour un peu "lourd" et appuyé mais au gameplay passable m'a vite gavé à cause du rythme frénétique et de quelques mini-jeux ou on "meurt" en boucle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962298096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1635644589}
review:
Pretty pixel graphics but entirely unfun. It's References: the Video Game. The control scheme must heavily favor a gamepad... if you play on PC, even with WASD and a mouse, nothing in the game feels very enjoyable to play. There are awkward cover mechanics in this everything-is-tiny pixel game, and if you're expecting vehicles to handle as smoothly as they do in GTA1 or 2... they don't.

I bought this ages ago and hated it. I tried playing it again and nope, can't do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198873765452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1652346679}
review:
本来在7723下了个盗版，结果玩起来感觉不错，就过来入正了。
俄区30元买了这个仅有19M还没有中文的游戏，感觉挺值的。
操作简单，而且画面音效很还原当年小时候的fc，设置里甚至还有几十种像素滤镜。
可能新一代的玩家体会不到这游戏点在哪，我只能说这个在gta1的基础上把FC玩明白了。
仅仅是玩了几分钟，就在里面看到的能说出名字的就有马里奥忍者神龟魂斗罗绿色兵团赤色要塞合金装备炸弹人电梯大战打鸭子等一大堆FC游戏。
去掉FC彩蛋也是很值这个价格的，虽然没中文但任务只要游戏玩得多就都可以大概猜出来要做什么，任务动作也和坎公骑冠剑一样做的很生动，没事的话也可以开车在这个小地方转悠~
对了，这个游戏有作弊码的。找了半天。。。。算了吧，没找到。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198000829019', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1863, 'last_played': 1574790234}
review:
Got this back when it came out and it's always a comfort game for me.

The 8bit aesthetic is just perfect, the soundtrack charming, the games controls just fit like a glove not to mention the story is completely bonkers and I just love it.

I feel retro city rampage may get overshadowed by it's sequel but I feel this title stands out on it's own and it's charm will draw you in, if it's your kind of bag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160171732', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1734, 'last_played': 1691131814}
review: Boy oh boy, what a great game. I thoroughly enjoyed every minute of this game. I actually turned around and bought it on my 3DS as well, just to have it on the go. The 8-bit art style is great. The open world is well laid out and is pretty easy to stick to memory and know where you are on the map at all times. All the weapons are great, the little touches all in this game are fantastic as well. The humor and references often go hand in hand but they make actual jokes out of the references, so that's awesome too. The controls are perfect, which is good because the game play is pure chaos.I love the running and gunning this game has but boy are you going to be bouncing around at times trying to avoid bullets. To be fair, when you do dodge all the bullets and take out the bad guys it feels awesome. This game is just great all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085640332', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1627406616}
review: Парадокс в том что игра является пародией на GTA, но при этом в разы увлекательнее и интереснее чем GTA, в ней прям хочется проходить сюжетку. Исполнение графики и музыки просто на высоте. Она есть у меня не только в стиме, но и на PS3, PS4, PS Vita (можно играть сидя на горшке или в дали от компуктера или плойки). Эта игра зайдет большинству тех, кто балдеет от музыки на NES/Famicom/Dendy и от пиксельной графики. Это очень качественная индюшатина, сделанная с любовью, и она не суперхардкорна как The Binding Of Isaac, она достаточно дружелюбна к игроку.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393352348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1681332391}
review: Possibly a premature review but 16 mins in - looks like the original Old School Grand Theft Auto e.g. Pre 3. Couldn't get to my hideout (first mission), got half the cities police on me, accidentally wandered into a side mission whilst trying not to get arrested with someone that resembled a Joker character. In the course of this got multiple weapons, robbed someone that came out of the sewer looking like the turtles with guns, robbed a casino, sank bus with casino cash in it, jumped in Bill and Ted’s phone both, got into the Back to the Future Delorean, got into another car chase, had a wicked dream where I just seemingly went round killing everything at which point I decided that was a bit much for 16 mins and I should leave it there for now. Might need to revisit this but would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220615124', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1508164609}
review:
Uzun zamandır hiç bir oyunda bu kadar eğlenmedim, harikaydı. Oyun bana harika vakit geçirmemi sağladı. Retro tarzında olmasını çok sevdim insan gerçekten eski oyunların özlemini çekiyor.

Oyunda oldukça fazla göndermeler var oyunu oynarken gönderme bombardımanına maruz kalabilirsiniz. Her anında, her karesinde, her saniyesinde gönderme var. Oyun dünyasıyla ne kadar haşır neşirseniz o kadar çok keyfe gelirsiniz. Arada kim bilir neler kaçırdım diye düşünerek strese bile girebilirsiniz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192254428', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1621305324}
review: Retro City Rampage DX es un videojuego absurdo, lleno de referencias y de acción pura. Si eres fan de juegos retro esta oda te encantará. Si bien tiene muchos minijuegos y sidequests, el modo historia se siente corto, aunque siempre podrás encontrar algo que hacer en este juego sandbox estilo GTA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026461767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1619660046}
review:
Despite the hours I put into this game, I will say that this game is not for everyone. I don't want to gatekeep, but it can be charmingly difficult to the adventurous. Oftentimes, I felt frustrated at the difficulty found through the blockiness of combat, the repetitive soundtrack, and all of the things you like to see or think about when it comes to an 8-bit game. I love to see the aesthetic, but to play it is something else entirely. 

If you do not enjoy copious 80s references, 8-bit stylized combat akin to GTA 1&2, and the inherent limitations of a top down beat-em-up or shoot-em-down style of play, you won't get your money's worth out of it. You might even hate it. The story itself really leans on its off-brand references to 80s culture and games around the SNES era. The dialogue is great and the references are relentless, but it wasn't enough to keep me going through a playthrough. 

Only recommended for die-hard retro fans. You'll know in well under the 2 hour return window.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964735295', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1429925914}
review:
True to the original name by which this game was going to be known - "Grand Theftendo" - this game is in many ways a reworking of the Grand Theft Auto formula with the graphics of a game from the Nintendo Entertainment System. It's the greatest Nintendo game that never was, a sprawling open-world action arena with chip-tunes that'll make your ears bleed pixels. 

It's too bad I can't give ratings, though, because "recommending" the game doesn't really reveal how average it is. The game isn't breaking much new ground, and while it's an excellent send-up to the Nintendo, it's ONLY a send-up...it's a game that remixes other, better games and the wink-and-nod is a bit much at times. It's hard to imagine that kids too young to have played the NES will be checking this one out years from now; this game isn't a classic in its own right. It just trades on the nostalgia for other classics, and if you haven't played those, this one might not be your thing.

review: Uma bela homenagem à "Era de Ouro" dos videogames, com muitas referências, fan service e destruição gratuita como gostamos em todo videogame nesse estilo. Uma pena ser um pouco curto e a história não interessar muito, apesar de render algumas risadas se você tirar um tempo para ler tudo. Recomendado em uma promoçãozinha pelo tempo curto e pela simplicidade, mas é um título que garante uma boa tarde de jogatina

review: A gameplay se assemelha a um saints row 2d, com seus controles responsivos e várias maneiras diferentes de sair destruindo tudo. O jogo possui uma história aleatória e engraçada. Algumas missões são meio básicas más são divertidas. O mapa é bem feito, apesar de não haver muito o que ser feito além de missões e colecionáveis. Existe também um grande números de chapéis pra customização. Apesar de não ser um open world ambicioso ele trabalha muito bem com que tem, com um universo bem interessante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043905366', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1599337433}
review:
Retro City Rampage is an 80s love letter with a GTA as it's backbone. You can count on a lot of references to be found here from running into the Turtle Van from TMNT to finding a shop that mocks Bimmy and Jimmy, to BTTF and many more. You can really tell the developers went out of their way to cram as much nostalgia as possible in a package. But unless you don't really get the gist of it, a lot of it could go over your head so the nostalgia may have a limited appeal depending on which representative generation you're from.

I remembered having a blast with this game for the first handful of hours and it's got quite a lot of charm. I'm only 45% of the game done with 44 missions out of 60 completed. I will warn you that things will start easy, just to get you into the swing of the game, however the missions later become quite a grind to deal with. The kind of missions that punishes you for every minor error pulled, no mistakes allowed.

A couple missions come to mind like doing the beer tap barrel throw mission, where you're required to throw barrels at bar tables. You have a small amount of time to complete the mission and it's incredibly easy to mess up with how you could throw a barrel and it doesn't count so you scatter to make up for it until you die or fail. Then there's the other one where you're the grim reaper for a temporary period, so you go around and kill civilians in a set time. You're to follow the colored dots and you're allowed to kill anyone in the proximity of the area. However, this can get finicky as I've just experienced trying to kill some civilians, only for it to not count because I wasn't *precisely* where the dot was on the map. There's just a bit of inconsistency there.

That is just a bit of fair warning of what you could get yourself into within this game. Though I'm pretty sure if choking up is not your problem, you'll do fine. I do recommend playing this game through controller, because it's comfortable, responsive and just easier to do everything with.

Some reviewers and people claim that this game 'doesn't know what it wants to do' because of it's gameplay. I have to say - it's GTA related. In GTA, you're also set on numerous side missions that may or may not make sense in the overall story. This game isn't any different and borrows from GTA like this. Yes, everything is going to be everywhere, but I'd chalk that up to you probably not getting the references. That's okay and I know the references can appear overstuffed, but what did you expect out of a game that's designed to be retro-related?

If you love GTA, love the 80s, love retro gaming and more. You'll find numerous things to like about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125101235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1597369416}
review:
Le jeu est bourré de références sympa aux jeux vidéos, films et séries connus, c'est malheureusement sa seule et unique force.
Le gameplay est pauvre, la difficulté extrêmement mal dosée (exemple avec les niveaux aquatiques, juste un enfer) et elle s'intensifie d'ailleurs rapidement, le délai pour respawn lorsqu'on est mort (et ça arrive très souvent) devient plus long que le temps de jeu à tel point que cela en devient ridicule.
Une énorme déception pour un jeu qui avait toutes les bonnes idées et intentions du monde, dommage...

author: {'steamid': '76561197993982756', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1545033954}
review:
I love Retro City Rampage. I really do. It's definitely a lot like playing Grand Theft Auto for the NES, riddled with all sorts of pop culture references from the 1980s, and is a rad game overall. The retroness of it is timeless. I've played it on 3DS, on PC, even played it on a friend's Wii console at one time.

So why I am I giving RCRDX+ a thumbs down?

Because the developer/publisher of this game has committed a bait-and-switch method by releasing their next game, Shakedown: Hawaii, onto Epic Games, practically leaving Steam users like myself in the dark. It is what I'd call an "Anti-Steam Exclusive Title," where a game would be released on every current-day game console (or in this company's case, past-generation consoles too) as well as multiple PC game client services that support them, except Steam, for some bizarrely unknown reason. While it is officially released on PC, it is still an Epic Games Store Exclusive as of this writing and update. It's been well over a year plus now at this point. Unless you're willing to buy a console to play Shakedown Hawaii onto, or (god forbid) sell your soul to EGS, don't expect Shakedown Hawaii to be released onto Steam anytime soon.

In short: Retro City Rampage DX+ is a really great game, but I strongly recommend boycotting Vblank for their bait-and-switch methods. Don't buy this game; don't support Vblank.

Update, Oct. 29th: Shakedown: Hawaii is now on Steam, released on Oct. 20th. However, as Vblank had pulled this greasy move where it became an Anti-Steam Exclusive Title up until that point, my recommendation against supporting Vblank's future endeavours remains very much the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043985291', 'num_games_owned': 1490, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1593638552}
review:
A decent top down retro style game thats very similar to the old school GTA's. The game is literally all references, be them to classic NES/SNES era games, movies, the 80's or anything really. The insane amount of references is awesome at first but after a while will feel almost exhausting, as if you are just wishing to see something original. Neatest part is the HUB world is based off of Vancouver and despite being in a 8bit style the landscapes as well as the street names are very recognizable if you know the city.

Overall a fun & charming game to feed your retro nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054674251', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 337, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1590694352}
review:
This game is a great lot of fun. The gameplay is forgiving, which is nice as well. You have a lot of weapons and maneuverability to keep yourself alive through even the toughest of challenges. 

Some people are complaining about the abundance of references, but even as someone who typically abhors nostalgia porn, I think that this game does a good enough job of making fun of old stuff in a new way that even if it does get old for some people, it's not a painful bludgeon. I quite liked the choices made by the game developers, actually. 

Another great thing about this game is that it mixes a lot of old-school gameplay styles, so you get a good chance to play improved & rehashed NES games, basically. 

I suppose if you don't like NES-style games, this might not be for you, but I'd recommend this game to anyone interested in the title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090754618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1612253378}
review:
its a game with a lot of potential. i liked the look and sound of the game and the shooting was fun (as long as you change the controls to move with wasd amd shoot with up,down,left and right) and i liked the endless amount of refrences to older games and movies but the driving feels a bit unresponsive and a lot of the missions are timed or  timed driving with are really bad because you have to do everything exatly right or you dont have enoug time and you fail. there are also 2 underwater sections (one of with is timed ofcourse) that have clunky and just bad controls. there are also a couple of times where the game takes away your weapons and doesnt give them back at the end of the mission witch i thought was frustrating.

summary:if you want a 2d gta get this when it cost 10 euro or less but not at its base price. 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197964641301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1589169787}
review:
The first time I played this game was back in 2013. I've seen the trailers and all the announcements and was a bit thrilled about it. The price was also very affordable, as I happened to get it during a sale.

Ok, so the first time I've played it, I didn't really enjoy that much (or I simply found some other title that happened to be more exciting during the sale). Anyway, I believe that it was the gameplay that set me back, but we'll get to that in just a moment.

So, what's the story of the game? You take the role of a criminal who works for a parody of the joker, and for whatever reason, you're sent back to the past. Your mission is to assemble all the parts of a time machine in order to be able to return to your time and place.

As for the background itself, it's basically a whole combination of different parodies of games from the 80's and 90's, which the player can get to catch the references every now and then. Back to the gameplay, I advise to use a gamepad, because I don't think that playing on the keyboard is all that great. While the main concept seems to be based on the classic GTA game, through the combination of different moves and power-ups, it kinda gives a refreshing look to the genre (kinda like a Saints Row 8-Bits version).

The graphics are ok, the soundtrack is decent and the sound effects can be annoying sometimes (especially when there're lots of cops on your tail). There're also some trading cards and achievements to get, but some of these are kinda hard to unlock, so it's definitely not one of those titles that I wanted to get them all.

Overall,  I couldn't let to think that if this game would be released back in the golden years of NES, it'd be either the game of the year, or simply banned before getting into the stores. If you have some nostalgia for the 8-bit era and you're looking for some crazy adventure that can keep you busy for a few hours, go for it; I believe that you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001408368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 3385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3385, 'last_played': 1585933765}
review:
This game gets flake for being an example of the "RETRO 8BIT!!11!!1" fad, but I feel it's an exception that proves the rule.

It's full of references and memes, many of them dated and revolving around old games, but, instead of just going "IT'S DANGEROUS TO GO ALONE!11 FUNNEH JOKE! GIMME MONIEZ please" like say Castle In The Darkness

This is a full-on world of its own, all these jokes and references aren't just there just to be there... they make this world that runs off video game logic. It's hard to describe without actually sitting down and playing it.

You don't just have "LOL DOC LOUIS STEAL BIKE!", you have a Doc Louis running a boxing coalition with a bike stealing business on the side that funnels his porn delivery. You don't just have some guy going "I Feel Asleep", you have a military base that you can visit at any time running off of Metal Gear logic.

It took all these memes and references, and built a coherent world that ties together out of it and made it run on video game logic. It's GTA on the surface, but they use coins and sections of the world require platforming because it's a video game world.

I feel like I'm not explaining it properly, but, trust me, you want this game, and if you play it for five minutes, you'll see what I mean. It's crazy and an underrated gem that simply doesn't get enough praise.

Yeah, 8bit Retro is old hat and played out, this game knows that, and says to itself "Well if you're going through with a bad idea, there's no reason to half-ass it."

I mean.. at the very least.. at least it's not as shitty as GTA Online

author: {'steamid': '76561198073640466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1584415040}
review:
Es un juego sencillamente buenísimo. El juego es una parodia de la saga Grand Theft Auto pero en estilo de 8 bits. La historia no es trascendental, pero esta llena de referencia a películas y videojuegos de los años ochenta. Quizás lo más divertido del juego es poder recorrer una bella ciudad en 2D con una simpática banda sonora de videojuego antiguo.

La historia es de un antihéroe que viaja al futuro y debe llevar a cabo todo tipo de misiones para arreglar la máquina del tiempo en la que llegó para volver al pasado. Se ven referencias a Nintendo, Sega, Los Cazafantasmas, Las Tortugas Ninja, etc.

Lo jugué tanto en Linux como en Windows y no noté ninguna diferencia en rendimiento. Quizás la única diferencia es que en Linux mi gamepad genérico es reconocido como un control de Xbox mientras en Windows se reconoce como un control de PS3.
