author: {'steamid': '76561198030288689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1526174304}
review:
It's like someone ate all my old NES and C-64 games, chased it down with a tall glass of GTA 1, and then drunkenly threw it up on my living room floor.  

Although I can appreciate the half-chewed bits of nostalgia in it, when I take it in as a whole, it just feels like an incoherent mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077153956', 'num_games_owned': 4286, 'num_reviews': 475, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1581240521}
review: Попытка выехать на ретро и пасхалках всегда хождение по грани. Культурные отсылки могут полностью похоронить проект особенно если слаба первооснова. К счастью, Retro City Rampage DX миновала столь неприятная участь. Всего в игре более 100 заданий и все в той или иной степени связаны с культурными феноменами 80-х и 90-х. Вообще, происходящее мне напомнило первые части ГТА, когда они были с видом сверху и не чурались дурашливого безумия. Хорошо, что в Retro City открытый мир, а песочница реально способна развлечь. Отдельно выделю саундтрек, музыка очень хороша. Из минусов, маленький размер карты и сумбур в происходящем, порой слишком часто меняются условия, не успеваешь насладиться моментом. Ещё лично мне совсем не нравится пиксельная графика, надоело, но это конечно вкусовщина. Ну и есть претензия к порту для PC, почему-то именно в этой версии наиболее недобное управление. В итоге поставлю 7.5. Пользователи других платформ смело могут накидывать полбала. Ну и ждём продолжение от канадской Vblank Entertainment, теперь на Гавайях.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049309242', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1579704429}
review:
Ретро Сити...очень интересный проект для тех, чьё детство было связано с игровыми приставками Денди и Сега. Игра своего рода микс всего, что осело в памяти о беззаботном времени перед телевизором, и благодаря которой можно вновь ощутить приятное чувство ностальгии.

Игра нас практически сразу подкупает веселым, незамысловатым геймплеем. В стиле 16-битной графики скрывается огромный потенциал, и Ретро Сити нам это доказывает. Играть, не смотря на своего рода заезженную ГТА-систему, очень весело и интересно, благодаря хорошей подачи сюжета, множеству испытаний, просто космическому количеству пасхалок-отсылок , и естественно, добротному количеству оружия для уничтожения врагов. Повидать вы можете во время своего путешествия много кого: будет и червячок Джим, будут и черепашки ниндзя, будет даже и сам Шредер, а также отсылки к Контре, собаке из Duck Hunt и многому-многому другому!

Музыкальное сопровождение...оно просто прекрасно! Оно словно по щелчку пальцев переносит вас в мир детства и боли от того, что не получается пройти надоедливый уровень в игре. В общем, музыку можно слушать часами!

Если вы игрок со стажем, застали классические игры на приставках, то игра обязательно вам понравится и доставит так, что мало не покажется...А теперь, нам пора, Док! Поехали обратно! Назад, в будущее...вернее в прошлое.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011512081', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1578548308}
review:
Lo pase y les puedo decir que es insufrible.

El juego comienza bien siendo una emulacion de un gta 1 con ciertos guiños a series de tv y otros juegos.
Fuera de eso hay niveles que son basura tuve que alternar entre joystick, teclado y mouse para pasar ciertas partes.
El modo historia lo alargan demasiado haciendolo insoportable y te dan ganas de romper el monitor. (Para peor te ofrecen misiones alternativas las cual no pienso hacerlas ya que decidi desinstalarlo)
Si bien en los juegos antiguos no se podia salvar, la dificultad que pretende ofrecer este juego es frustrante, tediosa y te dan ganas de borrarlo.
E momento me puse a buscar cheats para facilitar el juego como no los logre activar, tuve que tomar la decision de dejarlo inconcluso o de intentar pasarlo, asi que termine jugandolo hasta el final. El que llego a la final se dara cuenta que hay niveles que son insoportables como el del tipo pelado que salta, como el nivel de las bazokas, como la final y como otros que mi mente decidio borrar.
Nadie con amor propio volveria a jugarlo. Es un juego para lanzarlo por la ventana una vez terminado o darselo a tu peor enemigo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198451245573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1568, 'last_played': 1635730578}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993846813', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1577464217}
review:
NOTE! The game announces immediately "Common sense warning, This game is a parody", so it is clear that the game does not take itself seriously, and that has been taken into account. I will still give my two cents about what I think of this game as a piece of entertainment.

Retro City Rampage DX is a small "open world" top down action game similar in style to the original Grand Theft Auto. Gameplay consists mostly of causing general chaos and completing simple rapid fire quests one after another. As expected from a "parody", more or less all gameplay mechanics are heavily inspired or mirrored from various popular games. Retro City Rampage does not however execute any of these mechanics as well as its predecessors, which leaves the player with a somewhat bland experience (in my personal opinion).

From start to finish the game is full of references to movies, tv shows, games etc. Every once in a while a joke is cleverly set up, but for the most part the quips and references are simply excessive, which in turn leads to saturation. 

I do have to give credit to the developer/s for coming up with a decent amount of fun quests that heavily tie into the above-mentioned references. I would be lying if I said I didn't enjoy flying a jetpack at supersonic speed while Goomba stomping civilians. I did not encounter any bugs/glitches either which is commendable.

If you are really into popular movies and games from the 80-90s, you might get a kick out of this game. 
Personally I recommend just playing the original games this game is referencing to (such as GTA, Hotline Miami), as they are a much more complete and well thought out experience.

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198024451265', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1577258220}
review:

+ Tons of fun just running around causing mayhem, particularly when playing through Free Roam
+ Can be very funny & always at least entertaining

- Missions can feel a bit tedious after a while
- Not enough checkpoints to my mind

author: {'steamid': '76561198058711723', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1605886274}
review:
This game's pretty much what you'd expect from a person that's a fan of both Grand Theft Auto and oldschool gaming. It surprisingly mashes together perfectly and ends up making a very enjoyable experience. If you like the really oldschool GTA games, and want an NES taste to it, this is perfect for you. Oh and of course, it has a great sense of humor and a possibly even greater idea of parodies.

EDIT: I almost forgot to say, this game is incredibly easy on even really low-end hardware. Ran it with an Intel G33/G34 Family Chipset, STILL ran flawlessly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990453351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 973, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1563999583}
review: Retro City Rampage. It's a retro-looking GTA 1 (even more retro than gta itself). I didn't understand anything in the 5 first minutes of the game. Everything is very small and the constant flow of gaming parodies in the dialog, missions, buildings, cars (everywhere!) can be rather overwhelming. Things move on quickly and you may roam the city free or do the main questline that consists of fetch this and fetch that quests although breaking this grind momentarily by offering new toys to play with. The problem I had was that I didn't immerse to the "story" at all, the countless parodies make dialog and the story confusing and irrelevant. It was fun to throw people their mail and notice it was a parody of Paperboy (the game). What if you never heard of? It's just a mini-game. How about the other problems: driving is boring and different cars (making no sound when driving full speed!?) offer you nothing unique, weapons all feel pretty much the same except for explosives that get yourself killed easily and the often mentioned Meatboy minigame (as are the others) is just a distraction from the main game and only for the completionists. Only thing above average this game can offer you is a fantastic mini-game 'spot the reference'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043909081', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1469164447}
review:
Retro City Rampage is a game on paper I should love but the execution is just so backwards and unfun I can't recommend it at all. 
For all it's throwback humor and tried and true "Nintendo Hard" gameplay I have to wonder if the developers really knew what those things meant in the grand scheme of the game.
All this "tude" does not a stellar game make.

The game opens with "The Player", a thug for hire, chillin in the grand city of Theftopolis. He's soon after hired by The Jester (translation: the Joker but we don't want DC to slam us up the butt with a CND) to join his crime organization. Time zips three years ahead, the Player is caught in the crossfire of a Heist gone wrong. After dodging the cops, he finds a Time Traveling Telephone booth (real subtle) and is flung some years into the future, into the year 20XX.
The Player understandably wants to get back and enlists the help of Dr. Emmett Brown (in this: Doc Choc for .. reasons?) to do just that and then the game starts fully. 

First off your gonna quickly notice that the gameplay is very much inspired by Grand Theft Auto, but in a top-down 8-bit style. Playing this with a keyboard and mouse is absolute suffering, even with a controller your accuracy is gonna be shot and driving vehicles at any high speeds is suicide. 
Second thing is is that this game wears it's inspirations on it's sleeves but it's all haphazard and just amount to 'REMEMBER THE THING? I REMEMBER THE THING GOD WHAT GLORIOUS TIMES THOSE WERE' without really doing anything with that. It pays tribute to 80s games and movies and culture at large, you can toss a dart and see a throwback to Batman, or Back to the Future or games like Mario or Zelda or Contra. It's just there to BE there and not do anything else. 

Quickly the game's difficulty goes right out the window with any respect towards your time or patience. Levels and missions will randomly change style on a whim to inspire some kind of attempt to keep the game from getting stale but random horrid stealth missions or missions requiring intense levels of accuracy are just tests in total frustration. Nothing in this was polished or had a reason to be there other than to just 'be'. Nintendo Hard is hard and memorable when it's fun. Ninja Gaiden kicking my ass as a kid was memorable cause I was able to eventually beat it, but doing horribly controlling races and missions evoking PaperBoy were enough to make me push this game right back onto the shelf like an NES game I didn't research fully. Quickly the game becomes repetitive and frustrating instead of whacky and fun. Reminding me of crapsack NES games ins't a way to inspire me to continue when I get nabbed by a rocket launcher squad like the Snipers in Dick Tracy sorry to say. This could've easily been alleviated by more polish and a WAY more forgiving Checkpoint system. 

Which sucks, cause the game looks fucking stellar in terms of being an 8-bit title and the music kicks some serious ass. The intro theme in particular basically sounding like 8-bit Megadeth. 

But on the whole Retro City Rampage is a throwback that shows us why the hell nobody gives a damn about most 8-bit games anymore that weren't the mainstays. Not recommended under sale or otherwise, it's just a frustrating 'REMEMBER' fest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027894996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1451880174}
review:
The game is fun, despite there being moments where the developer being at times 'un hinged'. I had something to say about the development at one time and, at least someone from V BLANK that I assumed be the one sole dev as I heard it was a one man job more or less, type at me how I was just a troll. I went as far even to apologize that I didn't mean to come off that way. Granted I never heard anything ever again.

That aside though, the game is a love letter to gaming past based off of his GTA re creation project on actual Nintendo hardware, a project that then simply jumped ahead to more modern hardware while still holding the vibe and feel. Even games like Skate Or Die get a slight nod here as well as more famous IP's remembered to this day such as Metal Gear. 

The controls aren't perfect, but so much better than many games of long ago, so it strikes a very fair balance.

By now almost everyone has it, and by now if for some reason you don't have it, then grab it on sale sometime. The references are great.

The one thing I will mention again though however is that the DEV might come off rough if you talk to him, and some of his life choices, like pulling the new game from STEAM to take EPIC STORE's monopoly money pay off to keep his game over there for at least a year, sadly isn't that much of a surprise. For that, just wait the year for the bugs to be ironed out anyway or on the one of several other chunks of hardware you may own if you want it sooner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210724719', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1595086394}
review:
Something of a love letter to the original GTA, 80's movies and indy classics.

A fun and at times VERY challenging mash up of top down GTA 1 style action and various styles of mobile or retro games. The story is genuinely funny and packed with enough pop culture references to keep anyone entertained for the playthrough.

It's not the longest game, and it is easily beatable in an afternoon, but you will enjoy every second,

author: {'steamid': '76561197998142626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1562022792}
review: This game is a real gem. It's one big 1980s parody. i recognized soo many nes titles from the side missions and even main missions. Iconic characters like Doc (back to the future movies),  Solid snake (metal gear games), the teenage mutant ninja turtles and  even Bill and Ted ( from Bill and Ted Excellent adventures movies). Point is this game was clearly a labour of love. it even copies the intro from the Dark knight movie, the famous Joker bank robbery scene.  the game is really well paced and filled with mini games.  if you dont mind the old school graphics and know alot about pop culture this is definitely for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039960381', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1594, 'last_played': 1593273725}
review:
Rating: 3/5 
But Steam doesn't allow ratings and gamers have to look at % of average reviews ( 89% positive at time of  this post which i feel is too high ). Hence i give this an overall negative review.


Pros
- Faithful depiction of 8-bit NES era graphics and detailed artwork.
- World is not too big but very detailed and clearly a work of love. Littered with 90s and 80s gaming references. Humour is there too but average.
-Achievements are decent : not too many, not too easy, not too hard and sufficiently motivating for me.  In fact that is probably the main thing that kept me going. I picked up about 50-60% of them on the course of regular gameplay which motivated me to try and 100% them. 
- About 20- 25 hrs+ hours if you go for the campaigns, side-missions, collection quests  without using any guides and exploring the map at a leisurely pace. 

Cons
- Although the art style is well done and accurate, it is not one i particularly care for. Maybe thats just me.
- Story is meh and not the focus of the game.
- The gameplay is the weakest thing for me. None of it really jumps out. Whether it is the gunplay, driving, boss fights, campaigns most of it is lacklustre. I played GTA2 as a kid, and this doesn't feel as fun as that.  Getting gold at many of the arcade challenges was fun enough but others were tedious. As of writing i am at 93% progress having finished main campaign, gotten gold at all but one of the arcade challenges and collected all but one of the hidden items. Coming from games like SuperHexagon  and Supermeatboy, the game isn't particularly difficult - most of it is smooth if bland sailing. But at times when it gets hard gets annoying in the sense that  it feels tedious and annoying but not particularly rewarding (The last boss fight is a good example of this). This generally lacklustre gameplay is something i felt again and again. 
- Some annoying UI choices multiplies this frustration. For example having to jam the enter key for a second or two death screen, No hotkey for map and other annoyances.
- The final thing that really pissed me off   was the arcade sidemission (8-bit boy or whatever its called). This is moderately difficult (compared to supermeatboy) but what really makes this frustrating is that you have to finish this in 1 go. The player is given no warning about this or told how many stages are there. You can't pause the game (except after completing a stage). Halfway through the seventh stage, i got up for like 30 second to go attend a doorbell and when i came back the game had exited. This shows great disrespect for the users time and effort. Also if you are going to make a hard-as-nails platformer (ala Supermeatboy) then every aspect of your game has to be unimpeachable (including ui, stage restarting) and you better make sure that your mechanics are pixel perfect  and millisecond precise. This decidedly isn't. This level typifies all the things that irked me about Retro City Rampage DX. 

Maybe if you stick to main missions, use guides and not try to take side stuff too seriously this won't be as big an issue for you. YMMV

author: {'steamid': '76561197998568769', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 818, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1552847576}
review:
5/10

I picked up Retro City Rampage DX after looking for well-received top-down games on Steam. I tend to enjoy playing games with this perspective, as they tend to be streamlined and provide players with a lot of environmental information. This title seems to me to be a parody of Grand Theft Auto 1 & 2, with a lot of fan service and pop culture references thrown in.

While I'll admit that certain aspects of the game were amusing, the ratio between gameplay sections that I found tedious vs. those I found enjoyable was about 2:1. Even simply watching the game's trailer, I'm reminded of:

*Throwing dead bodies at the "Hearsitar," the Go-Go Busters vehicle, while inexplicably dodging firebombs.
*Sneaking by guards in a cardboard box at the prison when it was unclear when I was out of sight.
*Timing my "sweat bombs" to platform through a factory with a very small margin for error.
*Clumsily swinging myself back and forth to feed crocodiles with henchmen as "Biffman" the superhero.
*Ramming into mailboxes repeatedly on a poorly-controlling bicycle.

This isn't even touching on the game's obnoxious, interminable final boss fight, where you dodge a wrecking ball that instantly kills you by throwing you into grinding gears, pilot a poorly-controlling hoverbike from a perspective that you didn't use during the game, and dodge bombs during a Pole Position-esque chase in which your depth perception is challenged.

Perhaps if your tolerance for parody and referential humor is higher than mine, you'll have fun with this one. However, whatever humor I found couldn't offset the poor overall feel of the gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990079112', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1553112756}
review: Aggressively unfunny. I feel like I'm playing a game written by someone heavily influenced by Deadpool, Ready Player One, and crack cocaine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198882722570', 'num_games_owned': 11, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1681917733}
review:
Одна из  лучших игр с открытым миром в которые я играл! Замечательно тут почти всё : отличный  саундтрек, яркая пиксельная графика, юмор и взрывной,сумасшедший сюжет!
Геймплей в данной игре тоже великолепен своим разнообразием: здесь можно выполнять побочные миссии (Которые , кстати , не уступают основным), а основные миссии в духе - раскачайся на верёвке к которой привязан , дотянись до большой красной кнопки чтобы из отверстия в потолке посыпались болванчики , а потом хватай их и кидай в бассейн с крокодилами , чтобы те наелись и не захотели поедать главного героя точно не дадут вам заскучать! Открытый мир здесь тоже играет не последнюю роль : тут вам и челленджи , и убойные поездки по городу , побег от полицейских и многое другое!
В заключении можно сказать , что Retro City Rampage DX вдохнула в себя всё самое лучшее из ретро-игр и преподнесла в драйвовом экшене , который к тому же  и стоит недорого , а соответственно рекомендован игрокам всех возрастов!
Единственный минус - нет русского языка , из за чего можно не понять многие отсылки и шутки.
Моя итоговая оценка - 9,5 кислотных Марио из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006804578', 'num_games_owned': 1944, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1551736621}
review:
Игра, действительно, понравилась. Единственное только... Жутко болят глаза. Особенно в конце было тяжело. Но, все-таки, осилил и прошел Х). 
Интересный сюжет, с интересной механикой. Это вам не обычный какой-нибудь ГТА1\2. Внесли так же и некоторые свои секретики и многие дополнения. 
В любом случае. Было интересно,весело и со вкусом Х). Рекомендую )
p.s. и да, честно говоря, для таких игр, где-нибудь делал предупреждения для "Эпилептиков". Т.к. у самого данная гадость. И не мог бросить прохождение игры. Уж очень было интересно )

author: {'steamid': '76561198169103954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1505577017}
review:
なんかのパロディとなんかのパロディ、そしてなんかのパロディ。英語がもっと分かれば没入できたんだけど、残念ながら言語の壁を超えることはできませんでした。操作方法とかならともかく、ギャグはね‥‥。

ゲーム自体は、他のレビューと同様で、昔のGTAと言われてて、確かにそれですね。操作性は悪いわけではないけど思い通りに自由自在、というほどでもありませんでした。サンプルムービーで見るほど無双もできてませんでしたし、１時間くらいで辞めてしまって以後、起動してませんね‥。

author: {'steamid': '76561197990913342', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1549427216}
review:
About four hours of Grand Theft Auto 2/Retro with charming humor and "Remember the NES?", Retro City Rampage does its core design well. Running around and fighting feels good, most of the missions are on point and entertaining, none of the story bits are grating considering how often the joke is a nostalgia reference. RCR is a decent ride even with zero knowledge of the reference materials. Exploring the city and popping new missions like chips is fast and fun.

The story can be cleared in a few hours and that leaves you with a few more at best to full clear the island, grind gold medals on sprees and free roam, and none of those will really take unless you fall in love with the game. RCR suffers the most when it strays too far from its core game play or tries to push the limited combat system. This becomes very clear in the last several stages which feel like pulling teeth. They're presented well. They're fun at times. The polish is admirable including the 3D glasses mode. It's just a chore punctuated by rockets and an unfortunate nod to no-mistake motorcycle play, an homage best left buried with Battletoads because mere mortals can't enjoy it. Introducing the power ups and not working them into the main mission stages and boss fights feels like a large missed opportunity.

There's a lot of good work here so I can't call it a bad game. The kind of enjoyable quick ride that feels like a good pick up on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966533518', 'num_games_owned': 1246, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1549178674}
review: Grand Theft Auto but in an NES style. Super fast pace. Tons of silliness. References to countless other games and movies. Tight, easy controls. I wasn't a big fan of the sprite style but it works. A lot of the sound effects could have been reworked, as they can be pretty obnoxious. Just minor gripes though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030589833', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1549038559}
review:
Retro City Rampage DX is basically Grand Theft Auto as it would have looked, sounded and played on an NES. Which is to say it's an enjoyable but pretty basic game. 

It's fun enough to play. A big, well populated open world, lots of top down driving, twin stick shooting, a variety of weapons, and a number of mini-games that ape the popular game styles of the era. Overall though, I found the experience somewhat repetitive and not particularly addictive. I certainly had my fill by the end of the campaign. The difficulty is variable, but the game is forgiving in the number of tries you are allowed for each stage.  It's nice to play in short stints, but not sure it will hook you in. 

Steeped in references from the 8 bit gaming era and from 80s movies, it will be most entertaining for those who grew up in the era.  As far as I can tell the graphics and sound are faithful to what is possible on the NES. A true 8 bit audio-visual experience.

I liked it. Frustrating at times, perhaps a little samey, but fun in short stints. It will be most appealing to those who have fond memories playing on an NES.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164749691', 'num_games_owned': 1126, 'num_reviews': 420, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1635279556}
review:
Retro City Rampage™ DX kupiłem specjalnie by mieć w jakimś sensie oryginał i szczerze nie przeszedłem teraz tej gry, ale gdy przeszedłem RCR za pierwszym razem jakiś czas temu to bawiłem się strasznie dobrze!

RCR prezentuje poziom parodii, który uwielbiam czyli na każdym kroku rozpoznajemy coś, kogoś lub jakieś miejsce, które już wcześniej widzieliśmy w innej grze, a szczególnie lokacje, które są perfekcyjne dodane do miasta lub dołączone do misji i czasami nawet łatwo to pominąć niestety więc polecam, każde miejsce dokładnie obejrzeć i zastanowić się gdzie to już widziałem.

Polecam Retro City Rampage DX z całego serca jest to zdecydowanie pozycja obowiązkowa dla fanów retro jak i tych, którzy ogrywali retro jak i po prostu starsze gierki dzięki temu będzie zdecydowanie więcej frajdy z przechodzenia gry i zwiedzania pięknego miasta!

[h1][5!/5][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198113717677', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 6662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5609, 'last_played': 1709978934}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034291737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1546807924}
review:
Вообще я эту игру прошёл на взломанной Sony PSP, а в Стиме купил лишь затем, чтобы поставить авторам лайк и занести денег. Это, конечно, ни в коем случае не ранние GTA (и уж тем более не Chinatown Wars), но в целом очень динамичная и увлекательная игра, которая ощущается вполне себе как классические платформеры и стрелялки на NES — только тут ещё и открытый мир завезли и добавили множество отсылок к играм и фильмам конца прошлого века. Иногда они даже действительно смешные.
Что хорошо — игра не затянута и заканчивается примерно тогда, когда бегать, прыгать, носиться на машинах и уничтожать городскую собственность уже несколько надоедает. Хотя и после этого на карте ещё остаётся немало побочных миссий и магазинов, в которых можно себе оформить новую шляпу или очередное странное оружие. А для тех, кому не хочется особо погружаться в сюжет, есть режим открытой игры с бесконечными жизнями, доступный с самого начала.

review: Прекрасная игра для старичков, играя в нее я получил много удовольствия. Сюжет наполнен многими отсылками на geek культуру, а геймплей напоминает gta2. Графика навивает ламповые воспаминания. Одним словом ГОДНОТА. Если хотите вспомнить былое, то обязательно берите не думая.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963358821', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1316, 'last_played': 1542846304}
review:
A good game overall, but far from perfect.  The technical execution is mostly excellent.  The art, music and sound are great.  I played the game on Linux with absolutely no issues that I'm aware of, except that sometimes my controller input would just kind of stop and I would have to let go of all the buttons before it would start working again.  I don't know if this was related to Linux or what. 

The difficulty sometimes jumps between easy and insanely difficult.  Partly that may be caused by sections of the game that play completely different to other sections.  The worst offending sections are the crocodile pit, the sweat bomber, and the final boss "fight".  Of those, the crocodile pit felt like it might be broken some how.  Mostly either I couldn't grab the bodies or my controls would stop responding correctly.
The characters were generally unlikable and some of the humor was kind of gross.  There are lots of references and memes.  Most of them I knew, some I probably missed.  A lot of the gameplay and scenarios are homages to other games.  Overall it's an impressive undertaking.  Especially for such a small development team. 

If you skip all the side stuff, you can probably beat the main campaign in around 6 to 8 hours, but some sections are controller breaking difficult, so one long session is ill advised.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148732270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1573867357}
review:
Hola bueno Retro city rampage comenzó a desarrollarse en el 2002, donde el desarrollador principal, Brian Provinciano buscaba crear GTA 3 en 8 bits gracias a un kit de desarrollo de nes. Pasando los años, ganó más ambición, transformándose en un juego completamente independiente a la saga de rockstar, ganando además referencias a la cultura popular de videojuegos y cine, especialmente de los ochenta.

--------------------------------- Historia --------------------------------

Retro city rampage nos pone en la piel del....jugador, un personaje con aspecto de matón ochentero, el cual trabaja en una organización criminal. Desafortunadamente, termina viajando en el tiempo al entrar en una cabina telefónica, llegando al año 20XX. Aquí conoce al doc ''choc'' (adivinen a que personaje del cine representa), que cree que es un heroe en el tiempo y está dispuesto a ayudarlo, pese a que nuestra heroe tenga que hacer un montón de cituaciones locas ycrímenes sin sentido.
Personalmente, creo que la historia es el punto más fuerte de retro city rampage; es bastante estúpida y no tiene sentido en muchos casos, pero realmente esto es genial, pues no se toma para nada en serio y está llena de parodias, algunas simples y otras muy geniales e inteligentes que nos sacarán más de una risa. En resumen, la historia de retro city es una parodia de principio a fin, y una bastante bien hecha.

----------------------------------- Jugabilidad ----------------------------

Retro city rampage, notablemente por imitar a GTA, es un sandobx, es decir, nos pone en un mapa abierto, enel cual puedes explorar a placer, además de resolver misiones principales y secundarias de la historia. El mapa en sí no es muy grande en comparación con un sandbox actual por obvias razones, pero si tiene bastantes detalles y logra cumplir su objetivo a la perfección, es decir, poner este tipo de gameplay en 8 bits, sin tantas pretensiones. Nosotros nos vemos en una vista cenital, al igual que los primeros juegos de GTA (que jamás he jugado así que no señalare sus similitudes) y tenemos la capacidad de ganar diversas armas, algunas estándares y otras muy locas o sacadas de otros géneros, aunque hay que cuidarlas bien, pues si nos matan en el modo de historia las perderemos. Además de esto, podemos robar autos....los cuales tienen un control muy tosco y torpe que si bien es posible llegar a dominar, nunca dejará de hacer chocar contra lo que sea involuntariamente, y si hacemos con esto si nos ve la policia, nos perseguirán, lo cual es bastante molesto en este caso (involuntariamente, pues en sí es bastante genial que nos persiga la policía), pese a que podamos evitarla al pasar por ciertos puntos del mapa. También podemos hacer cosas como jugar pequeños minijuegos de arcade (juego dentro del juego) y que tienen el plus de ser de otros juegos indie, como meat boy o beat trip, así como minijuegos de azar. Nada muy complejo, pero si nos quitará unos minutos o hasta horas.
Por último nos queda hablar del punto principal del juego, las misiones, las que debo decir tienen el punto positivo de ser todas diferentes y en muchos casos basarse, tanto parcial como completamente, en juegos clásicos, pero agregando elementos de violencia o sátira bastante notables. Hay alguna misión que imita a paper boy al hacernos entregar periódicos, pero esta vez con trampas mortales, por dar un pequeño ejemplo; para no spoilear, diré simplemente que encontraremos misiones que referencian a juegos como smash tv, el primer juego de las tortuga ninja en nes (el cowa-fucking piece of dog shit), frogger, los dos primeros metal gear, entre varios otros, lo cual es realmente agradable.......desafortunadamente estas caen en una notable falta de complejidad, pues los controles de estas no son exactamente buenos y, por decirlo de alguna forma, se llegan a sentir casi como las versiones pobres de lo que intentan imitar; para resumir esto, puedo decir que las misiones de retro city rampage son una colección de minijuegos que en un par de ocasiones ni siquiera son divertidos.....afortunadamente, la historia y el ver que parodia nos deparará próximamente pueden hacer que pasemos esto por alto y sigamos adelante.
Al final, pese a esta falta de complejidad, retro city rampage, en efecto, es un juego entretenido que logra destacarse dentro del mundo independiente por su historia y su variedad.

----------------------------------------- ¿DX? --------------------------------

Como verán en el título, estoy reseñando retro city rampage dx, una versión extendida lanzada para nintendo 3ds, auque con el pasar de los meses llegó al resto de sistemas. DX nos permite jugar sin unos marcos que tenía el juego original, posee una mejora gráfica en los sprites de los personajes (aunque es posible también jugar con los originales), una dificultad más balanceada que el original y se adapta a los controles de la portátil de nintendo. 

----------------------------------------- Gráficos -------------------------------

En cuanto al apartado gráfico, retro city rampage utiliza un estilo pixel art, el cual, en lineas generales, es bastante sencillo,en especial porque el escenario se mantiene estático la mayor parte del tiempo. No obstante, rcr tiene que ser uno de los juegos con más estilo y personalidad propia que he jugado, pues toda la ciudad esta llena de referencias a otros juegos, tanto en paisajes como en carteles o nombres de locales, los que algunas veces llegan a ser muy imaginativos y hasta graciosos. 
Desafortunadamene, el juego es completamente incompatible con el efecto 3d, que es una de las principales virtudes de juegos 8 bits en 3ds.
---------------------------------------- Sonido ---------------------------------

Lo más destacable que tiene rcr en este apartado es la ENOOOOOOOOOOOOORME cantidad de temas originales de estilo chip tune que se han compuesto para él, decenas y decenas de estos, por lo que a variedad musical se refiere no hay queja, Jake Kaufman, Leonard Paul y Mad Creamer se merecen un aplauso. Fuera de esto, he de decir que entre la marejada de temas del título, la mayoría son bastante.....genéricos y olvidables, en especial en comparación con otros trabajos de los compositores (sobre todo del señor Jake)......pero bueno, es solo un detalle que a mí en lo personal me dejo con ganas de más.

-------------------------------------- Conclusión -----------------------------

Retro city rampage es un juego más que notable dentro de la escena indie, con una propuesta más que notable, gran cantidad de parodias que llegan aser muy inteligentes en muchos casos, así como una duración más que decente (entre 5 y 10 horas) me hace recomendarlo sin ningún problema, especialmente porque su precio es bastante bajo en todas sus platafomas (especialmente en pc). Es cierto de que tiene defectos muy marcados por el tipo de propuesta que es (tampoco esperaba que con tantos tipos de misiones distintas, todas se jugaran increíblemente bien), pero en fin, simplemente puedo terminar diciendo que, lo recomiendo.

Lo mejor
+ La gran cantidad de parodias.
+ Todos los detalles que hay en la ciudad.
+ La gran variedad de misiones.
+ Cross overs con otros juegos indies.
+ Precio más que ajustado.
+ Muchísimos temas musicales.
Lo peor
- Las misiones tienen una seria falta de profundidad, al punto de que no todas son divertidas (en mi opinión claro).
- La mayoría de los temas musicales dejan que desear en cuanto a composición.
- Incompatible con el efecto 3d.
 
https://youtu.be/bF7iXlgXROk

Espero que hayan disfrutado del análisis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274484258', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1543118876}
review: Este juego es original y realmente es recomendable para los que les guste la acción  de esquiva y disparo estrepitoso, es un mundo abierto  donde encarnas a un villano que desea acabar con los heroes, destruir, matar y divertirse. El concepto por si mismo es bueno. Tiene referencias de los 80 y 90, heroes y  villanos aparecen, situaciones locas y originales. Lo bueno es que si te gustan este tipo de juegos la pasaras bien, lo malo, en mi concepto, que el sistema de juego tarda en ser entendido. Ahora edito esta reseña porque creo que hay que ser justos con el juego.  Me quejaba de no entender el juego y la mecanica pero me di cuenta que  me habia perdido  de ciertos tutoriales y guias que se dan en las misiones posteriores al viaje en el tiempo y luego, de seguir estas guias EL JUEGO MOLA MUCHO. Ahora, todavía hay aspectos que no entiendo como la puntuación y las medallas, pero aún así a pesar de que pensé que no cuadraba conmigo me he sorprendido disfrutandolo. Ahora bien, que los tutoriales tarden en aparecer es un punto a revisar, pero una vez le coges el tiro gusta mucho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000609056', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 384, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1480437817}
review:
I want to like this game, I really do. It just didnt hit the mark with me. It's more of a game for my collection than one I would actually play. Sure the humor is kind of entertaining and it really is retro, like they built the game to be retro it's not just sprites on a unity game. I have to give them credit for that, they are the real deal, the devs. Why a thumbs down then if I have so much respect for the devs? It wasnt easy actually, but I just ended up not playing this game much. That is why I can't recommend it. It's too GTA for me or something, whatever it is I just feel like the game missed the mark slightly with me.
It's a good game, well made in that sense, if you are interested buy it on sale. For me though this is one that will never actually get finished, it will just kind of sit there, unplayed in my game list.

review: It's very... mediocre, to be blunt. It's a 2D GTA clone, but with even more obnoxious writing (HEY GUYS. THE 80S AND 90S EXISTED. DUNNO IF YOU KNEW THAT, BECAUSE THIS GAME'S SO SUBTLE ABOUT IT), missions that basically yoink you into subpar Zelda dungeons instead of capitalizing on the open world nature of GTA clones, and just generally feels like more time was spent pandering to nostalgia instead of actually doing anything with it's various concepts. You can get better GTA-style games for 15 USD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079966144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1532318811}
review:
Me ha gustado este videojuego llamado Retro City Rampage, que de forma resumida, es un Grand Theft Auto versión "Retro". 

Si eres un "Jugador" de la vieja escuela, entederas mucho de que se trata este juego con su humor negro, la historia se te hara divertida, mirando las diferentes parodias a juegos clasicos como: Super Mario Bros, Super Mario Bros 3, Paperboy, Duck Hunt, Excitebike, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Bomberman, The Legend of Zelda, Adventure Island, Metal Gear, etc., a películas como Back to the Future y Rambo, tambien te permite disfrutar de mini juegos de Super Mear Boy, Bit.Trip Runner.

Retro City Rampage es un sandbox en un pequeño mapa con un impecable Pixel Art, repletos de armas, vehiculos, personajes, tiendas, secretos, etc. El sonido y la larga lista de musicas en chiptune. Una cantidad de personajes bien personificados.

La historia es muy corta, no me llevo mas de 4 horas en terminarlo, pero me entretuvo y me hizo sentir nostalgico, sobre todo porque soy un amante del vintage, la decada de los 80, el pixel art y el 8-bit.

Contiene una gran cantidad de configuraciones, por si quieres emular algo mas al estilo del FAMICOM o el Virtual Boy (sientes como el rojo quema tus ojos). Puedes cambiar las emisoras, la HUD, customizar tu personaje. Dispone de varios idiomas, aunque en Español, no se, si es parte de la parodia, pero en algunos dialogos no carga ciertos nombres, aparece la variable vacia "NULL" o falta la fotografia del protagonista.

La intensidad y la forma en la que se lleva la historia, puede apartarte de querer jugarlo, como me sucedio la primera vez, pero luego le di una segunda oportunidad y vaya que me arrepiento por no haberlo jugado mas desde la primera vez. Un punto negativo, es la paleta de colores original y algunos de ellos, tiene colores muy intenso que te hace fatigar la vision muy rapido.

Lo recomiendo intensamente, y mas, si dispones de un gamepad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002560104', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1531688746}

author: {'steamid': '76561198212291063', 'num_games_owned': 1222, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1543094513}
review:
CONGLATURATION!!! A winner is You!

Вы выбрали, или были выбраны в счастливые круги обитателей весёлого городка Retro City Rampage! Теперь вам осталось лишь пройти несколько тестов!

1. Первый. Ваше тело должно состоять из пикселей. Если же оно не состоит из пикселей (см. мелкие квадратики) – можем посоветовать утрамбовать тело с помощью кувалды, музыки Григория Лепса (от него вы просто будете пытаться спрятаться как можно ниже в землю, трамбуя свой организм), а также с помощью вагона метро.
2. Второй тест – на слух. Вам, как потенциальному гражданину, надлежит слушать всё в формате 8-бит. Пение птиц, сигналы проезжающих машин, окрики людей – всё это будет в формате “пик-пик” и “пиииииик”, иногда меняющееся в зависимости от гаммы и тональности. Настоятельно советуем вам практиковаться дома, так как окончанием теста будет демонстрация того, как вы будете читать сочинения Маяковского наизусть восьмибитным голосом.
3. И последний, третий тест гражданства – на знание всемирной истории. Преподаватель, в большинстве случаев, будет ветеран утиной охоты – рыжий спаниель. Он очень любит показывать на вас пальцем и ухмыляться, но вы должны всячески противоборствовать любому желанию застрелить это существо (поверьте – пытались все, ни у кого не получилось!). Примерные вопросы будут включать биографию Билли и Джимми, начертание лабиринтов замка Gauntlet, типичные горловые крики Sinistar, методику разбивания кирпичных блоков снизу, и многое другое. 

Готовьтесь тщательно! Получив гражданство вы не только встретитесь с Джоном Ромеро (у нас для него особый храм), но и испробуете на себе роль Мрачного Жнеца, будете угонять миллионы машин, сможете носиться по нашему замечательному городу с клюшкой от гольфа и шлемом викинга одновременно, получать от старцев в пещерах меч и щит (ну вы поняли – “It is dangerous to go alone, take this!”), посидите в Делориане!

Всегда ваши, разработчики в количестве 5 штук.
All your base are belong to us.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348915171', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1669590136}

review: Honestly, a hidden gem. It's a crime that this game isn't more well known, because it's a masterpiece. Imagine if Grand Theft Auto was made for the NES. THAT, is this game. Now excuse me while I go on a tank rampage, blowing everything up in sight!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072218805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1523751444}
review:
Good game, but definitely feels like it was intended for people who grew up in the '80s. Players who weren't born in that decade will probably still enjoy RCR--up to a point--but they'll be missing a lot of context. Couple that with some of the difficulty spikes later on, and I don’t expect many people to finish this one.

Obligatory video plug: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=twosm87VHZM

author: {'steamid': '76561198263311223', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1655049023}
review:
Após ter jogado e finalmente ter zerado esse jogo, finalmente posso dizer que foi uma das melhores compras que já fiz.
Muitas pessoas possívelmente só conhecem este jogo por ser baseado nos primeiros jogos da série Grand Theft Auto (GTA) cujo o jogo usa como base para a gameplay. Mas ele tem muito mais do que isso: São várias referências a cultura pop do fim dos anos 80 e boa parte dos anos 90, uma soundtack excelente, de tempos em tempos até ouço ela inteira no Spotify, missões bem estruturadas e algumas até bem desafiadoras, variedade de armas bem grande e entre várias outras coisas.
Se você gosta bastante dos jogos de vista de cima como GTA 1 e 2 ou só quer um jogo com bastante referências, essa pode ser uma ótima escolha!

author: {'steamid': '76561198401176159', 'num_games_owned': 2313, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1531150444}
review: Best game for 3DS and Wii now PC Steam release, I played this originally on 3DS. I love this top down look for games since Super C and/or Contra had a top-down level, then fast forward to 1998 GTA and GTA 2 for Playstation 1. This game parodies many things about the 1980s and popular culture. I've yet to beat this on 3DS but it's much easier on Steam as I have first second gen 3DS from the second year they made them. So I like this game as others games which came later are more disappoint but growing up with a Nintendo NES, this brings me memories of those years playing Metal Gear or Mega Man on NES. I love retro games, 10 out of 10 stars for this release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046743901', 'num_games_owned': 2670, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1516052281}
review:
[h1]TL;DR at Bottom[/h1]
[b]Let me know what you thought of this review in the comments below![/b]

[h1]Verdict :[/h1]
[b][i]Ham-fisted references and horribly designed gameplay; Not Worth the Money[/i][/b]

[h1]Gone to Waste[/h1]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1270856549
Imagine Grand Theft Auto, but without the beautiful landscapes, wealth of content, and fun. In essence, that’s exactly what Retro City Rampage is: a poor attempt at bringing back the nostalgia of classic GTA. It brings back the top-down camera and open world, but it fails to do much more than shamelessly shill for your nostalgia, while completely ignoring the things which made older games great. That’s my biggest grievance with Retro City Rampage: it’s so busy shamelessly whoring itself out for your nostalgia that it not only forgets that which made older games great, but seems to forget to be a game as well. It’s always welcome to spice up your game with references, for humor or whatever other reason, but what isn’t welcome is shoving them down the players throat in such a ham-fisted way.I’m not going to pretend that there aren’t any good aspects to RCR, but I’m also not going to pretend like this is a good game just because they tossed some NES references in there. There may be good aspects, but they’re obscured to such an insane degree by all the bad ones that they may as well not even be there, and quite frankly I find myself disappointed. I chose the word disappointed for a reason, and it’s because when I first saw Retro City Rampage I was so excited to actually play a game similar to the original GTA, but instead of seeing an extraordinary open-world game I found a disappointing mess. They had such a fantastic idea here, they could have brought back the glory days of classic open-world games, but instead all they succeeded in creating was a miscarriage of those same games. I desperately wanted to like RCR, even to the point that I was willing to overlook some of its flaws early on, but looking back on my experience I just can’t. There’s simply too many flaws and they’re too egregious for my to ignore, and as such I can’t recommend the purchase of this game.

[h1]Not All Bad[/h1]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1270856827
I’ll start off by going into some detail as to what parts of the game I actually did like, however few of them there may be. The biggest and most obvious one is the graphics, the art style, it’s perfectly managed to recreate the feeling that those classic 8-bit games had without sacrificing for quality. It makes me feel like I’m downtown playing games at the arcade, instead of at home on my computer. That does nothing but make the game up and further elevate this incredible classic atmosphere to which they seem to have dedicated their game. Not only are the graphics incredible, but the audio and soundtrack are both fantastic as well, doing for your ears that which the beautiful graphics do for your eyes. That however is where my compliments end and the complaints begin, and boy are there a lot of things to complain about here. First off, the game is filled with more nostalgia-bait references than it is actual gameplay, forcing obnoxious and heavy-handed references down your throat like a pill that’s just too big to swallow. The references always seemed to be out of place, on top of already being frustrating to being with, pointlessly crashing into your gameplay just when you wanted it least. Just as the references are obnoxious, so too is the combat. I have one big problem with the combat, and when I say big I mean absolutely massive: it’s completely based on your movement, which is important because you’re going to have to be constantly dodging both enemies and projectiles. Normally this wouldn’t be a problem, in some cases It could have been something I applauded for being different, but here it’s a serious issue. It’s an issue the movement is unpredictable and unresponsive, and there were multiple occasions where I would press a key and have to wait for almost a second for my action to actually happen, like playing CS;GO with 400 ping. In a game that makes you constantly dodge bullets, it’s extremely frustrating that this happens at all, let alone as frequently as it does. I know it sounds like I’m making a lot out of what’s essentially just a single problem, but when the problem is as big as this, it cripples the entire game. It’s Retro City Rampage’s Achilles Heel, and it makes the combat not only unreliable, but generally just absurdly frustrating to play. 

[h1]The Good Ol' Days[/h1]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1270856646
I imagine that you thought I was done complaining, but I still have more to discuss so buckle up. Retro City Rampage is a game that should take about two, maybe three hours to complete, and instead it took me a little over five, and that isn’t because I’m just incompetent. The game doesn’t value your time, not even in the slightest bit, constantly forcing you to go back and forth across the entire map, which is rather pathetic for an open-world game. This isn’t something you just do once in a while, but every single mission, and boy does it get old incredibly fast. You feel like a dog being told to go fetch, and then right as you reach your objective, you have to go all the way back again. Not only does the game artificially lengthen its difficulty, but it also artificially increases its difficulty, and in more places than one. There’s a reason that we don’t make games like this anymore, and that reason is that they just aren’t as good and they contain outdated mechanics which have no place in modern gaming. Back in the day when you bought a game, you weren’t guaranteed to actually see the end of it, but that usually wasn’t because it put you through a rigorous test of skill, but because it was probably made poorly. Forcing you to play through entire games with only but a handful of lives, or to endure some absurdly difficult stage with obstacles you couldn’t hope to overcome. Gaming has evolved past that because those are terrible ideas that have no place in modern gaming, or in gaming period. I think it’s despicable that these devs are able to get away with creating such a poorly cobbled together mess of a game just because “that’s how they used to be”. That’s 

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
A poorly-made "throwback" to classic games that seems to have forgotten that there's a reason we don't make games that way anymore.

[h1]If you found this review helpful or entertaining then feel free to leave a comment and join my Steam Curator Group at  [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9577715-Mudkips-Gaming/]Mudkips Gaming![/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197991845568', 'num_games_owned': 2233, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1515776725}
review:
Matter over substance.
All of the references, jokes mix together well enough and writing is pretty clever at times. Shining example that is hilarious to me is the fact that the game makes fun of today hated (like people woke up from a long, loooooong dream) microtransactions. And this game is from 2014 and even then you could call it late to the party!
But anyway, graphics are meh, it's not bad, nor good, won't make you jolly but won't make you blind either. OST is pretty good, but sound effects suck. Death Race pitch was shocking in the 70s, but it wasn't as annoying as this.
Gameplay is where this game fails, really. Game makes fun of errand and escort missions, but at the same time it is boring errand and escort missions, with some few exception here and there. Controls can get pretty bad, with driving actually being worse than in any GTA entry, which in my opinion is quite of accomplishment. Shooting can also be annoying, mostly because the game nicely shows you tutorial of just holding down the button so you can circle strafe the enemy, but later you will find out it actually doesn't work, because you must face the direction of the enemy and be in range of auto-aim first, and with enemies having rocket launchers and shotguns later in the game, you're better off using right stick instead.
Also, game constantly spams you about stomping, but problem with that is it doesn't matter for the most part if you will jump or stomp on the enemy, because it will do damage anyway. Stomping is only useful nearly by the end of the game, when you get super stomp.
It took me something around 5 hours to complete main quest and side missions with challenges left, so you could say the game is pretty short on content, especially for the price, however, believe it or not, 5 hours with this game is really long. It is one of those games that will make you tired after playing more than hour or two.
What makes you push through is humor, which means game is not for everyone and some references feel rather random, like Toxic Avenger or just thrown in last minute to be there, like Light Gun. Gameplay leaves a lot to be desired and it is more of a endurance game rather than something really engaging, although you might find it fun to wreck havoc in city.
Game ends with really, really crappy boss fight that feels uninspired, cheap and all about twitch reflexes at times. There is no satisfaction when you beat him or watch credits roll.

Game is not bad, but it is not great either. It is meh on the scale of 10 and it is only saved by the jokes and writing. 
If you have nothing to play and just want to have a laugh, go for it, but not for full price. Either wait for the bundle or when it drops to 2-3 euro. You could play worse.

review: ¿Alguien dijo nostalgia? Un juego que basándose en los primeros GTA  en plan homenaje a los años 80s , 90s,  crea amor por el juego, es cierto que si no se vivió esta época el jugador no entenderá demasiadas cosas,  que pasan en este gran juego; misiones muy variados y para nada repetitivas,  me encanta que se pueda jugar con filtros de sistemas antiguos como por ejemplo: Commodore 64, NES ,Amiga o Virtual boy ( Nintendo), la duración depende... author: {'steamid': '76561198017200784', 'num_games_owned': 856, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1464871565}
review:
2D GTA with pop culture

Retro City Rampage is a side-down GTA game devloped by Vblank Entertainment Inc. You play as henchman who is hired by a criminal called the Jester. During a heist, things go wrong and the henchman escapes by using a telephone booth which send him into the future. The player is must then collect items to repaire the time machine so you can go back to your timeline.

The Good
- Colourful 2D Graphics
- Good sound and music which gives the old 80's feel
- Plenty of easter eggs and references such as mario, sonic and teenage mutant ninja tutles
- Plenty of vehicles to drive
- Lots of weapons and power ups to use
- Side quests available
- Good amount of playtime
- Boss fights
- Humour

The Bad
- The controls aren't great becasue they are based on old 80's style games, so you may find targeting enemies with your guns tricky.

Overall, a solid game for people who like old school GTA or just want to reminise old games released back in the 80's.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043159492', 'num_games_owned': 1818, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1513573308}
review: I recommend this game only if you played video games in the 80s. This game is chock full of references to those games and other popular movies and shows from the era, so if you didn't grow up with them, you probably won't enjoy it as much. Gameplay and pacing are incredibly quick and all over the place as well, if that's your cup of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133508899', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1640394217}
review:
[h1] El mejor SANDBOX en 8Bits Compralo!	[/h1]

[b] -Referencias a la cultura popular y a los 80"
-Mucha diversion en especial las primeras horas
-Sandbox en 2D con muchos toques y referencia a GTA
-Muchas horas de Gameplay
-Un juego lleno de acción muy frenetico
-Muchos minijuegos y modos de juego
-Muchas posibilidades de rejugabilidad
-Pixel Art muy bien trabajado
-Muchas formas de estilo visual como cambio de paletas, margenes, filtros,etc... [/b]

[b] los controles son agradables para este estilo de juego en 8bits. el soundtrack no es la gran cosa, pero da en el punto y es agradable.	[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198132275562', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1510770403}
review:
Very enjoyable game, it is like 2D GTA, plus there are lots of humor and funny moments, the storyline is well constructed and the soundtrack is good. However, there are some negative points.
First negative point of this game for me is driving section. I had hard times to control the car I drive and I believe car mechanics should have been designed better. 
Second negative point for me is references. It would be good to see some 80s characters or some hidden references sometimes while in the missions or while free roaming, but they were everywhere and that disturbed me a lot. I think references is used too much in this game. 
Overall, I recommend this game if you like to have fun GTA style or if you are pixel art fan like me :)

7.5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198237830524', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1703534418}
review: Retro City Rampage DX is just fantastic. I always liked the GTA series, but I am just OBSESSED with the 8-bit NES tributes. Mixing the two together brings this game into something amazing. In the first ten minutes, you see the Duck Hunt Dog, the Ninja Turtles, and Doc Brown from Back to the Future. Anyone who likes the NES will just enjoy this game. There is so much you can do in this game, even customizing "The Player" how you want. But for anyone who really enjoys to play on the Super Nintendo, Shakedown Hawaii is something coming out soon. It's the 16-bit sequel to the suscessor of this masterpiece. I would like to talk more about Shakedown: Hawaii, but I need to get back to the review. If you don't enjoy Retro City Rampage DX, I totally respect your opinion. There is a fair amount of things that this game can't do that GTA has, but it is always a fun game to play. Vblank Entertainment always impresses me, and will most likely be VERY suscessul. Overall, this is a title recommended, and I just can't wait fof the future of Vblank. Long live the 8-bits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083592270', 'num_games_owned': 1344, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1486120681}
review:
Znáte takové ty filmové parodie na různé filmy, hry, knihy atd. Tak tady máte jednu videoherní. Tato hra paroduje opravdu veliké množství filmů a her. Já sám jsem během hraní poznal jenom některé, ale myslím si, že je jich tam o mnoho víc. Např. Batman a Joker, Lovci duchů, cesta do budoucnosti atd. 

Hra je především parodií na hru Grand Theft Auto, protože zde máte otevřené celé město a pohled zhora v 8bitech. Město je docela velké, ale především se mil líbí, že je zde hodně otevřených budov, do kterých můžete vstoupit např. videoherna, kasino, holičství, bar atd. 

Hlavní postava se jmenuje The Player a přidá se ke zločinci jménem Joker. Jenomže jejich společná akce se trochu zvrtne a vy se v Toi Toice teleportujete do roku 20XX. Zde se seznámíte s profesorem, který bude chtít tento teleport opravit, a vy máte sehnat chybějící součástky. 

Zde přichází systém misí, který je rozdělený na fáze, které naskakují bez přerušení a ani si toho příliš všímat nebudete, protože vám v danou chvíli bude jedno, jestli jste při misi ve fázi 1 nebo 3. Mise jsou různorodé, většinou jde o to, že vymlátíte všechny kolem, ale jsou zde i mise závodní a skákací. Mise nejsou nijak obtížné (pokud nepočítám ty ke konci), a tak budete bez větších zádrhelů pokračovat dále. 

Pokud v misi zemřete, nemusíte ji celou opakovat od začátku, ale vrátíte se na začátek poslední fáze nebo nějaký checkpoint. Pokud zemřete obnoví se vám zdraví na maximum a započítá se vám jeden minusový bod, který vůbec nic neznamená. 

Grafika je v 8bitech, ale vypadá docela dobře a vůbec se v ní neztratíte. Ze začátku může někomu dělat problém ovládání, než si zvykne (především při řízení auta). 

Zvuky jsou takové 8bitové, stejně tak hudba. Celé to dokresluje atmosféru hry a nijak ji to nezhoršuje. 

PS: děkuji Krezovi, díky kterému jsem si tuto hru mohl zahrát.

Pro: město, volnost, mise, charaktery, zvuky, grafika
Proti: stereotypnost některých misí

author: {'steamid': '76561198030574635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1465385601}
review:
I have this game for 4 different systems. I have it for the PC, xbox360, Switch, and PS4. I finally beat it on the switch the other night, but the game does not change based on the system. I could tell that the person who made this put alot of time and effort into the game, but it still is not a good game. I would say the game is 30 percent good and 70 percent bad. The developer stretches varying gameplay mechanics too thin by trying to introduce a bunch. Many of these are halfbaked however. The driving mechanics and shooting are good, but the rest of them, like trying to build a bridge out of enemy corpses are terrible.

The game tries to introduce different enemy types but really they are just reskins that run at you and shoot. There are some references to other games and popculture like lulzninjaturtles. The lulzninjaturtles are nothing special and do the same exact thing that every other enemy does to you during the game - run directly at you with their weapon. I want to keep going, but the more i think about it, the sicker i get. I ended up spending 60 dollars for a game on 4 systems that i beat in about 3-4 hours. 

With all of that said, the next game looks promising and i look forward to buying that on a SINGLE systme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260089360', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1499099648}
review:
Retro City, is, in its core, everything the reviewers will say it is. A sweet mixture of GTA and pop culture. Is that a bad thing?Well, the answer to that is subjective. I personally loved this game. It was action packed and difficult, which are two factors in gaming that are the secret formula to solid gameplay. The story was maybe a bit flawed and even a little over-the-top, but its not supposed to be a serious game. The gameplay is basically the primitive top-down GTA games getting a makeover. You have an array of weapons and you can steal vehicles. One last nice thing about the game is that it features something most games don't bother with. The game has the option to run at either 60 fps or 30. Though this alone isn't ground-breaking, if the game detects a constant drop in frames when you're running at the preferable 60 fps, the game will kick you down to 30 fps so you keep the consistent frame rate either way. Kind of irrelevant, but a nice touch either way. 
The game eventually will feel repetitive towards the end, and for good reason. The game itself is simillar missions over and over again with bits of story inbetween. When I wasn't tired of it, I enjoyed it more than anyone else in my friends list did. By the time it does get monotonous, you'll be near the end anyway. Also, the final boss is surprisingly well done. Not spoiling it though
Overall, I'd give this game a solid 7.5. I'd suggest trying it out, but not if you don't have a USB controller. If you play this with a keyboard, you'll have a bad time

review:
A beautiful and highly playable love letter to the '80s and all of that time game memes and tropes.

As a game it's a mix of GTA 2 style top down view and different styles of games like Contra and Zelda although those are single missions.

Graphics are well, pixelart, music is ok but I think that beyond that it's forgettable.

Overall I had a blast playing this game. It's really fun and playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273968677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1470784149}
review:
Like most of the games and mini-games.  This game has a GTA feel and open world feel, which is both a strength and weakness. Most of the time the games do not have anything to the main story. The overhead 3/4 view has some getting used to since it is used alot-alot. Gameplay control is alright, and there is variety. 

I liked the exploration part of the game more than the timed challenges, which could be annoying-head stomping is really hard on a tilted overhead view, when the enemies or stompees are so small and moving around. 

I think the retro part of the game was restricted by copyright issues. I am still playing this game so I have yet to see parts I really like, for now I think the game is average. Rampaging gets old after a while, without more detailed enemies-other than faceless citizens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297935826', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1505258186}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970761123', 'num_games_owned': 2953, 'num_reviews': 896, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1504067678}
review:
Retro City Rampage DX is a huge love letter from the developer to the industry and the fans of the video game industry.  And that's one of it's best and perhaps worst issues. 

The core idea of Retro City Rampage is to basically create a top down GTA style video game.  That's GTA as in the original GTA, which used a very similar but simplistic version of this game.    However they are vastly different games.  Where GTA is just a crime simulator, Retro City Rampage instead adds a huge sprawling story, tons of buildings you can enter, great unique experiences, and references to other games. 

That last part is what I was saying is the best and perhaps worst issue.  This game just nails the nostalgia for long times fans of the industry, and I do mean long times.  There's a part of the world that is clearly based off of Mario Bros. (Again not the super mario bros), and it's brilliant and subtle.  There's a ton of these references most of the time quite subtle, such as four turtles jumping out of a sewer, the bike shop owner is recognizable from a certain boxing game.  The opening of the game is clearly a remake of a great movie with a clowned prince.  And so on. 

But there's a problem here.  If you never played Mario Bros, but you played the rest, will you recognize them?  Not in this form unless you know this specific layout.     There's references to Metal Gear (the original again.. wow I'm saying that a lot), Contra, Sonic, and a ton of movies and tv shows. 

The thing is much of this is hit or miss, there's a few characters which clearly are references to something but I didn't know what it was referring too, and that kind of sucked.  There's also a bunch of indie darlings such as Phil Fish and Billy Campbell, who again unless you REALLY know your stuff you'll kind of ask "Who's that?" 

The problem is most of the game references though come from the original games in series, we're talking you're probably going to want 30 years of gaming history under your belt to really get these reference, and that's ok, but at the same time newer players will miss a great deal of these, and they are a big part of why I enjoyed the game, without them... I'm not sure I'd enjoy this game nearly as much. 

However the gameplay in this game is mostly short levels, usually only a few screens long or a few minutes.  There's over 60 missions in the game, and they are mostly great (with a few controller breaking hard ones, looking at you splosion man knock off).  

What really works though is almost every quest giver will tell a specific storyline/reference.  There's as I mentioned metal gear, but there's also the game genie, and a FANTASTIC Saved by the bell reference.  That one alone is a scream. 

The controls in the game are also great, while I do have a problem with the stomp move being inaccurate, everything else feels really tight and gives the player a proper amount of control. 

The one big complaint I have might seem odd but the achievements in this game feel all wrong.  20 achievements might have been enough, but it still feels like this game should have at least 30, if not 50.  There's so many little missions that could have gotten an achievement but beyond that, the game gives very odd achievements.  There's not even one for beating the whole game, and there's only a few that are really hard.  

However the game does give good rewards in game for the entire playthrough, it's just that the achievements feel off in some odd way.  

Overall though I will say I liked this game a lot.   But there's a few flaws, and a few frustrations.  However I really got along with the nostalgic references, if you knew half of them, I think you'd be more than fine, however if you really don't get nostalgia references or you miss the majority of them, I would say this game might not be as fun to play.   And that's be a real shame, but it would be the deciding factor to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212639239', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1527766961}
review: GTA에 레트로 느낌을 잘 넣은 게임

author: {'steamid': '76561198050412953', 'num_games_owned': 2075, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1503862044}
review:
Retro city rampage aims to emulate the old school feel of GTA 1 and 2 while keeping a more light hearted tone with more 8-bit references sprinkled about.

Pros[list]
[*] Alright music.
[*] Get's the old school aesthetic right on.
[*] Has a fairly lengthy campaign and a lot of side missions.
[/list]
Cons[list]
[*] Filled with a lot of busy work and doesn't provide a lot of fun activities to do.
[*] Arcade mini games are complete and utter garabage, with flashing and otherwise obnoxious color pallets and unfun gameplay.
[*] Campaign missions and most side missions are unnecessarily difficult and require a lot of trial and error.
[*] Boring gameplay and uninteresting weapons.
[*] Combat is terribly done and feels like an absolute chore to do.
[*] Relies entierly on references and has little to no original humor. So if you're knowledgable in pop culture, then you'll most likely predict every joke before they manage to say it.
[/list]

This was a boring and unfun trip into the bad side of retro-like games that tries too hard to emulate the old school nature of games, without making the game engaging or actually fun to play.

I gave up after getting bored with the campaign and getting annoyed with the terribly designed mini games.

If you want a game that emulates retro gaming but provides fun gameplay to back up the aesthetic. I highly recommend playing the 16-bit era homage [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/248310/Freedom_Planet/]Freedom Planet[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198306338985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1547, 'last_played': 1476562379}
review:
ver wonder what games of the concept of Grand Theft Auto would have been like in the 1980s? 

Wonder no more! Retro City Rampage offers all the fun of Grand Theft Auto in an interface fresh out of 1980s console games!

All it's missing is a hyperbolic article blaming it for chidren's bad behavior, and calls for it to be banned in several countries!

Retro City Rampage is an incredibly fun game.

It isn't one of the greatest games out there, and won't be ranked among the likes of Terrarria and Minecraft in the indie gaming community, but it is certainly fun, and will give you more than your money's worth of entertainment.

Pros: 
Fun. 
decent humor (if you lived through the 80s)
lots of 80s pop culture and gaming geek jokes (warning: some of these will go over the heads of all by the geekiest among you)
achievements, and leaderboards,
variety of weapons and vehicles. 
Good solid fun game.
on sale almost every major sale event. 

Cons: 
Finicky controls, 
keyboard controls are limited, 
works best with a dual d-pad gamepad not that those are easy to find these days. 
It not the absolute best game out there for this price, even if it's a good solid fun game.

Other notes: 
Difficulty gets rather high towards the end. You may have to forego some of the achievements and cheat to win. (There are cheats provided in-game for this.) You can always try again on a second run.

All in all, it's a good game, and probably worth the full price tag, but it's probably going to be one of those games you will get on sale or in a bundle. You will certainly enjoy the game, even if it's not going to be one of those games you spend thousands of hours playing and fall completely head over heels in love with.
