author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 5966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1501682964}
review:
Retro City Rampage could be considered a blast from the past. It does play like GTA 1 on steroids with an added mix of Hotline Miami, Crazy Taxi and 90's flair. Yes you read that right, all of the above.

The only downside actually consists in the fact that it not only resembles but also partially plays like a title back from the nineties: The controls and especially aiming are sometimes off, grenades and rocket launchers are your own worst enemy, you can dodge literally any kind of damage except explosions by jumping (hello GTA 2) and you definitely should not expect the story to make even an ounce of sense whatsoever.

All those things aside, the sheer amount of content is surprisingly huge and it is fun for quite a while to go on murder spree after murder spree. Definitely recommendable to fans of the genre or people simply wanting to feel some true nostalgia by playing a brand new game that could just as well have been released 20 years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081877429', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1924, 'last_played': 1634779344}

review: This is a fun little retro game, a throwback to the nineties. It's like GTA 1 and 2, from a birds eye view, with so much destruction it's unbelievable. It's charming, and my favorite part was the arcade. 8.5/10, you should get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176194585', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1493288344}
review:
Vous aimez la culture cinematographique, ce jeu est fait pour VOUS ! L'histoire raconte un voyage dans le temps avec une delorean mise au point par un savant fou. Au cours de l'histoire vous allait redécouvrir les classics, Rambo, Robocop et bien d'autres. Tout cela sur la base d'un jeu 2D, avec ses couleurs en 8 Bits, et une ville à la GTA.

✔ Jeu ultra-original.
✔ Excelente histoire.
✔ Une musique comme avant.
✔ Un temps de jeu très long (10 h pour l'histoire principale) + des tonnes de defis.
✔ Utilistion manette possible (et recommandé)
✔ Difficulté croissante.

✘ Controle difficile à prendre en main.
✘ Certaine missions longues.

Conclusion : 
Le prix est raisonnable par rapport à un bon nombres de jeux équivalents, si vous aimez l'univers retro, fonçez vite, vous allez adoré. Sinon, je vous le conseil quand même vivement ! Il n'y a rien à redire sur le prix que je trouve honnête même sans les promos.

review: Fun NES style shoot em up with parodies at every turn. I laughed at the mispelt dialogue during the MGS style sneaking stage. Only thing I disliked was the lock on targetting, would've preferred seperate controls for movement and shooting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194763051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1499363128}
review:
Retro City Rampage DX is an indie game that clearly took inspiration from the early grand theft auto games (you could argue more than that) as it's a sandbox game with an overhead view with various things to do. The amount of content is staggering for an indie game, and I still have plenty to do despite my hours into the game. The strenghs are as follows:

+Nice retro look and sound. 
+Lots of easter eggs to find. Like refrences to older games and such.
+Lots of variation with missions. None of them feel the same. You could blow things up one minute and the next you may be doing something like paperboy.

That isn't to say it's perfect. The missions with racing can be unfair due to limited view(as it's over head) and this can lead to stoping dead on a fence or wall. You have an arrow pointing the way so you don't get lost but it can't show things in the way. Just know you may find these missions infuriating. Also while the humor can be funny(You get a manson by changing the name of the owner on the deed...and this works) but it can be too reliant on your knowledge of games for it's humor and that can be confusing and miss the mark.

At the end of the day I think it's one of the best indie games i've played. It doesn't take itself too seriously. Has alot to do and above all, it's fun.  8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198010169603', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1498981858}
review: I bought this game in 2012, and I finally beat it. It's just really bad and boring. The open world environment is interesting enough, but the combat is simplistic and the lock-on is very finicky. The main problem with the game is that it doesn't sprinkle references here and there, but instead relies entirely on them. Every single mission and thing in the game relies on references, and just fail to be memorable on its own merits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025823574', 'num_games_owned': 3338, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1495929570}
review:
I've seen people people calling this game funny, but I had my doubts, then I started playing it. It just goes full bonkers. Your name is Player who's in the [strike]Joker's[/strike] Jester's band committing bank robbery.  But later, when you escape with the school bus you can't take a turn out of the bank,  because of how many school buses are out there (even a dead Frogger on the street) - so the solution is: blow up a fe to reduce traffic! Then later escape on foot, going into the sewers while the TMN Turtles attack you, and this is the game's first few minutes.
Later the game uses the GTA formula: open world with cars, customization stores, weapon stores  (food/drink heals, coffee speeds up) and with rampage / challenge points, main and side missions. The whole game is just awesome - almost every quest has references to movies/games or even reflections about game industry and trends, the world is jam-packed with jokes and funny characters and events. There are some general difference though: missions are slightly longer and often happen through multiple locations (There are checkpoint between them!) and the police is way less annoying - every cop has about 10-15% chance to drop a police cloaking device that will remove your wanted rating. I think this is a great change, as you won't need to spend half of the gameplay time to drive to spray paint garages.
What else the game has?  Good music, multiple gameplay modes during the story, slightly casualized but more streamlined open-world gameplay, original and interesting storyline where something always happens, I loved it so, so much!   Also just a mention, but it's kind of weird how hard the final levels of the game are compared to the whole. Anyway, a super strong recommendation for the lovers of retro games and eighties movie's style, because you'll be in for a treat - I think you can count on more than 10 hours of gameplay just by messing around and doing the quests, without trying much for challenges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093916297', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1544337286}
review:
Despues de completar el juego puedo dar mis impresiones
Positivo:
-Referencias a la cultura popular y a los 80"
-Mucha diversion en especial las primeras horas
-Sandbox en 2D con muchos toques y referencia a GTA
-Muchas horas de Gameplay
-Un juego lleno de acción muy frenetico
-Muchos minijuegos y modos de juego
-Muchas posibilidades de rejugabilidad
-Pixel Art muy bien trabajado
-Muchas formas de estilo visual como cambio de paletas, margenes, filtros,etc...

Meehhh:
-Soundtrack
-Controles

Negativo:
-Si bien la historia no debe importar, debo decir que la falta de ella hace que se pierda el interes muchas veces.
-Falta de variedad, la mayoria son de estilo Smash TV por lo que canza.
-En ocasiones la dificultad se eleva demasiado. 

En general el juego recibe un 7.5/10 ojala Shakedown Hawaii mejore con respecto a este que la verdad tiene el potencial de ser un pezo pezado en la categoria Indie.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960931103', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1494733444}
review:
Retro City Rampage is a fun, open world pixel graphic game that mostly resembles old school Grand Theft Auto 1. Retro City offers up a good amount of content, including single player story mode. 

I played a little bit of this game, enough to get the idea and mess around a bit. Reason being…I got this in a bundle and I’m not a huge fan of pixel graphics or open world games in general. However, this is a good game and I can recognize that. Gameplay is solid, controls are tight. Controller support is excellent. The story is nothing special and the same goes with the characters. I found after a few missions it was becoming pretty repetitive.

The first bit of the game is a very nice tutorial section. After that, the game leaves you to choose what to do. Continue the story or explore, do challenges, etc. 

I’m impressed with the game but it’s just not a genre I truly enjoy. I won’t give this a final score but if you’re interested in this type of genre, it’s definitely worth buying. 

[b]Pros[/b]
+60fps
+Story based single player mode
+Tight controls
+Solid gameplay
+Multiple visual filters and HUD’s
+Good amount of content
+Frequent parody and pop culture / video game references 

[b]Cons[/b]
+Repetitiveness sets in early
+Music volume kept resetting itself each time the game was launched

author: {'steamid': '76561198122076649', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1673815658}
review: This game is basically a top down, pixelated GTA. It's also full of references. It's extremely fun and it has quite a few things to do, but it's also challenging at times. I recommend this game if you like open world games and games that like to break the fourth wall.

review: Excelente juego. Lo resumiría como un GTA en arte de 8 bits pero sería quearme demasiado corto. Lleno de sorpresas, momentos divertidos, comedia involuntaria, alguna que otra crítica a la industria indie de los videojuegos, excelente música, pero sobre todo, extremadamente divertido. ¿Qué esperas? Vale la pena cada centavo invertido en una joya como Retro City Rampage. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198201219735', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 1212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1544464338}
review:
[h1] Yaratıcılık ve Mükkemmellik Bir Arada  [/h1]

Uzun zamandır hiç bir oyunda bu kadar eğlenmedim, harikaydı. Oyun bana harika vakit geçirmemi sağladı. Retro tarzında olmasını çok sevdim insan gerçekten eski oyunların özlemini çekiyor.

Oyunda oldukça fazla göndermeler var oyunu oynarken gönderme bombardımanına maruz kalabilirsiniz. Her anında, her karesinde, her saniyesinde gönderme var. Oyun dünyasıyla ne kadar haşır neşirseniz o kadar çok keyfe gelirsiniz. Arada kim bilir neler kaçırdım diye düşünerek strese bile girebilirsiniz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016203926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1491859734}
review:
RDRDX is a mess, basically a set of games from the NES, SNES and PS1, scattered across the different stages of the "story" line, an Arcade where you travel in a GTA 1 like world and pick from the offered games.

I can only recommend this game for a person who lived in the NES era, and have fond memories of that time and want to relive it again.

Props for the music, the SFX and the rest are just plain boring.

review: Awesome. This gamefelt like a GTA flashback, i damn near played it all the way through on the first go. The meta jokes and callbacks to gaming history had me inthralled right out of the gates. Very well made and well paced, it had me hooked. i would love to see more of it in the workshop and cant wait for the sequel.

review:
Checkpointing system sucks and its "comedy" is only nostalgia and HEY YOU REMEMBER THIS!?!?!? Type of jokes and its not even funny. Its just stupid and annoying. I would rather play Jackal or a good NES game instead of whatever this is.

Graphics are also really blurry and shitty looking. NES games actually do look better especially on modern emulators. Plus theres just to much stuff happening and to much reading, I found myself not caring about any of it and being annoyed with way to much text.

review:
It's an awesome game, full of easter eggs and nostalgia towards classic games and old tv references. 

Only thing I would want in this game is a dlc, the developer focused in another project similar to this, but retro city is by far way better. Would love a dlc for this game that would expand the map to absurd proportions, include multiplayer with different game modes and new weapons / faces / clothes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994050089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1430621919}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970106610', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1459279539}
review: J'y ai joué un peu, mais bon, c'est pas vraiment fun ; linéaire, et tu peux pas faire un bon jeu avec un ton et des dialogues 'troll' uniquement - ou en le bourrant de références à pleins de films et personnages d'une culture... aussi contemporaine qu'elle soit... author: {'steamid': '76561198016227517', 'num_games_owned': 1026, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1489811777}
review:
[h1]Si naciste entre los 80 y 90 Este es tu juego[/h1]
[i]Puede llegar frustrante cerca del final[/i]
Un pequeño mundo abierto, al estilo GT2 con mucho humor, y haciendo menciones a peliculas, juegos y series de los 80. El equipo A, Las tortugas Ninja, Super Mario, MetalGuear, Batman, y unos cuantos mas.
Puede resultar un poco pesado las misiones finales, pero se ciñe a los juegos de antes. En que tienes que aprender los movimientos del enemigo ;-).
Exactamente lo que su nombre Indica Retro.

[b]Lo mejor:[/b]
Las historias paranoicas de los personajes.

[b]Lo peor:[/b]
Para mi la música.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328497391', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1553931414}
review:
One of the best indie retro games I have played so far. 

Though shortly after completing the action-packed story mode I start to run out of things to do :(
Free Roam gets old quick and hunting down lootbags and invisible walls are such a chore.

I have an idea! The cabbie minigame is a great nod to taxi mode in GTA. How about you add a vigilante mode with a police car (or with the Biffman suit) where in you hunt down criminals in a limited time! Or maybe you can add more enemy units if you increase your threat level like choppers or robots! itBut if you can not add all that I shall appreciate it if you add more sidequests or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327670715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3477, 'last_played': 1682021382}
review:
En una palabra: VICIANTE
Con una nota: 8/10
En más palabras y notas....
Gráficos: 10/10 (han usado muy bien el estilo, las referencias se captan bien pese a ser un juego pixel art)
Música: 6/10 (reconozco que no es su punto fuerte, pero igual no es lo mejor, aunque no se podría pedir más de una estética 8-bit, algunas buenas y otras no tanto)
Historia: 10/10 (llena de referencias de los 80 y 90, aún no he completado el juego, pero dudo que vaya a cambiar)
Jugabilidad: 10/10 (es un juego cómodo de jugar)
Mapa: 7/10 (pequeño, pero con la cantidad de referencias tiene algo de sentido)
Misiones: 7/10 (pueden ser difíciles, pero al par de game overs acabas consiguiendolo)

Habiendo nacido en el año 1999, pese a eso tengo un gran interés por lo retro.
PD: Me morí de risa al ver que el filtro que se asimilaba a la Game Boy se llamaba "Ladrillo Portátil", ahora dudo si está el de ladrillófono.

PD2: La dificultad puede ser a veces frustrante, ya llevo 301 visitas al veterinario y pido que no suban como un viral en Youtube. xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198008549789', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1616793612}
review:
Sincèrement, je n'ai pas vraiment apprécié ce jeu et j'ai grandi avec GTA 2 (ça semble être une chose à devoir dire)
Ce jeu n'a aucune consistance, et n'est apparemment qu'un prétexte pour balancer blagues sur blague avec des références sur la culture populaire des JV et du cinéma des 90's
ex: duck hunt / retour vers le futur / Super Mario / doctor Who / etc.
Mais si on enlève ça, est ce que Retro City Rampage DX est un bon jeu ? Non. C'est juste une vague blague de mecs qui souhaitent juste surfer sur le côté nostalgique. Il n'a aucune histoire, le gameplay est pourri, et même les blagues sont un peu à chier.
Comment dire ? Vous souhaitez acheter un jeu pour des soirées bangs avec vos pôtes au lieu de vous mater bill and ted excellent adventure ? C'est le jeu qu'il vous faut.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074787550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1494104988}
review: This "game" survives as nothing but a hodgepodge of references. They're cute and all, but much like the book Ready Player One, as a standalone piece of media, it's pretty boring and poorly developed. Seriously, game portion of this is fully lackluster, poorly designed, and uninteresting. It's seriously just a series of references tied together with the most boring OR frustrating gameplay you could think of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059962841', 'num_games_owned': 1412, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1482625385}
review:
Jogo incrível, cheio de referências de filmes, jogos antigos, contadas em forma de humor na maioria delas. Garante horas de diversão para quem curte o gênero 8-bit.

As missões do jogo são bem legais e bem feitas, as vezes com uns puzzles mas todos bem tranquilos e engraçados. O jogo tem uma dinâmica estilo GTA 1, um mundo aberto para você zoar a cidade toda, e muito melhor, você ganha pontos pelo quanto de caos você produz na cidade, para quem gosta de jogar GTA matando geral na rua, esse é o seu game. Não tive problemas com bugs, crashs e algo do tipo. 

Além de tudo que há de bom no game quando você completa o game libera outros modos para você jogar mais ainda, caso você não queira se desfazer do jogo. Super recomendo, jogo divertido, simples e engraçado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027163572', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1483979330}
review:
Retro City Rampage (DX) is a 8-bit GTA but alot more over the top with tons of 80's and early 90's pop-culture references. For example references to Paperboy, Mario, Metal Gear Solid and alot more. The main story of Retro City Rampage is on the short side and will probably take you around 6-8 hours. Luckely there's enough content to keep you entertained after you're done with the main missions.

The main missions are quite versatile, and the game has a great sence of humor. The city of Theftopolis you play in has a decent size with a good amount of content next to the main missions. For example things like: side missions, customization, buying weapons and gadgets, going to the arcade to play games and more. The sound in this game is a joy to listen to and the controls in this game are great and well designed. 

This game is definitely underrated and deserves alot more attention. It's great, over the top, has some really cool pop-culture references and great humor. I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074818415', 'num_games_owned': 1550, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1483875983}
review:
This is just a disappointment, especially since I was following this project from back when it was being made for the NES.

The first impression is good, like the GTA1 in eight bits... but when you delve into it, it becomes really annoying really quickly. The controls are clunky, driving is incredibly imprecise, combat is just unfun. Any mission that requires dealing with multiple enemies is a huge pain. Graphics don't stand out in any way among the other retro titles. Music is okay, but... just okay. It's pretty forgettable, I didn't find a tune that would stick with me.

As for the positives, I really liked all of the nods to classic games and movies from the 80's/90's, but that's not nearly enough to save this title. Overall, IMHO there's very little enjoyment to be had. A lot of effort definitely went into making this game and I appreciate that, but it just doesn't work as a whole.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173748162', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1573510073}
review:
Como buen amante de lo retro que soy,es mi deber analizar juegos como este,
en fin retro city rampage es un juego que parodia varios juegos y peliculas de los 80s* y lo hace de manera bastante comica
osea cada vez que lo prendi terminaba muerto de la risa...
ademas es bastante entretenido y tiene un monton de easter eggs y desafios que alargan el titulo,
en fin es buenismo asi que te recomiendo comprarlo,
y esta es la version pa los de vocabulario mas vulgar:Esta wea eh entera de brigida ermanooh,cachai que la wea pixileada es entera de brigida po logooo,
ok ok ahora si yo si lo recomiendo ya que lo abriras y lo cerraras cagado de risa...
9/10
-SBZ

author: {'steamid': '76561198123367565', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1456248646}
review:
abi oyun efsane ya oynanır olum bu oyun çok ciddiyim ben bu oyunu çok düşük bir miktara aldım ve oynarken eglendigim oyunlardan biri çok süper bir oyun tavsiye edilir .

oyun aynı gta gibi bişi ama 2d lisi kuş bakışlı bir oyun ancak böyle bir oyun olmasından dolayı almamazlık yapmayın . LÜTFEN 2D VE KUŞ BAKIŞLI OYUNLARA DA OYUN GİBİ BAKIN.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333010227', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1618120722}
review:
In the beginning was the NES, then about 12 years later the PSone and the game GTA.
Now here's an amazing mix of the distant past, the even more distant past combined into a brilliant GTA (the first two) parody.

Normally I think references are bad writing, but less so the more well known classic (ninja turtles, bill & ted, back to the future) 80's references which often just make enough of an apperance to keep things moving quickly. And considering it states right at the begining that it's a parody, it works in a beautifully ( parody is fair use under copyright law: ) cheeky manner.

RCR's gameplay absolutely thrashes the original GTA (and all the GTA's in my opinion, but I may be alone in that) that it is so closely based on. Especially the handling of the vehicles which is a joy and easier to both run down lots of pedestrians, and drive safely with traffic.

I've kept this review relatively short for the short amount of time I've actually played it, but I've played enough to know that I love it.[spoiler]Oh, and the grim reaper mission just has me completely beat. I just can't kill them all fast enough.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198038776903', 'num_games_owned': 7187, 'num_reviews': 3757, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1670080270}
review:
这游戏有点儿神！玩梗狂魔！！

在这游戏中我发现的梗（彩蛋）：
GTA 赤色要塞 超级马里奥 大金刚 魂斗罗 刺猬索尼克  赤影战士 合金装备 马里奥医生 正当防卫 热血物语

以下几个不确定：
送报小子？
阿拉蕾？（路人带的翅膀帽子）
冰激凌车（黑道圣徒？）

author: {'steamid': '76561198126468530', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1665106503}
review:
Where to start :
Pro's ;
If you like me grew up in the age of the mega drive and the SNES then this game is what you wished you could of played, orignally a lovingly crafted demake of a certain open world game (GTA) after a legal case the name was changed and portions of the game were to however this detracts nothing from the game it's self.
Packed full of missions and challanges
A great retro sounding soundtrack ( what else do you expect ) 
Also you get an MS DOS prototype version and the orignal SNES rom with the purchase of this game
fully compatable with game pads.

Con's 
None that i can think of

author: {'steamid': '76561197978063014', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1480038870}
review: If you enjoy the classic 8 bit games of the mid 80s to mid 90s, chances are good that you'll enjoy this game. It really plays well, and the attention to detail is incredible. Within the first 5 minutes, there are tons of references, which might turn off some, but I really enjoyed that, and the gameplay itself is very well polished. Highly recommended.

review: This is without a doubt my favourite 2D game on Steam. Great easter eggs, references, and more! You'll always discover new stuff. And the most fun part is rushing through the city with a rocket launcher causing lots of destruction!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027847057', 'num_games_owned': 2534, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1671569780}
review:
Gioco che si ispira ai primi due GTA.
Se amate il genere e gli anni '80 è un titolo consigliatissimo!
Graficamente pulito e divertente, ricco di citazioni a giochi e film, riesce nel suo piccolo a stupire con missioni tutto sommato diverse tra loro, da classiche sfide a tempo in auto, a massacri e minigiochi vari.
Storia semplice ma carina, si fa giocare tranquillamente fino alla fine senza annoiare troppo.
Consigliato a tutti!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197996627259', 'num_games_owned': 1878, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1478176873}
review:
This game has a lot of great stuff going for it.

First off, the gameplay is really fun and can get challenging in spots. However, it all stays fair and I never once felt like any of my deaths were cheap or unavoidable. It was always something I could've gotten myself out of if I had simply played better. The feel of the controls helps in this regard, as they're very tight & responsive, just as you would expect from a game of this style. One negative of the gameplay is... driving is a bit of a hassle, as you would expect from a top-down game like this, since you can't really see what's going to be in front of you and unless you have the city layout entirely memorized, you might end up crashing into a wall or two.

The graphics achieve the nice retro NES look that they were going for, and even when the novelty of it wears off, they let you choose from a lot of different graphics filters, many of which emulate the look of different retro game hardware. It's a really nice touch and allows you to keep the game looking new & interesting throughout the duration of the story mode.

The music is also very good. It's a bunch of catchy & memorable chiptunes made very much in the style of NES sound hardware, while not strictly adhering to it's limitations. It fits the game very well, and will likely get stuck in your head later on.

There are some challenge modes with online leaderboard support as well, which you can either find in the world (much like the "killing sprees" in GTA) or access from the main menu. These manage to be pretty fun if you're looking to compete with your friends. They even include replays for these challenges that you can watch for players on the leaderboards, or which you can save & share with your friends.

The story is probably the weakest part of the game, essentially being a string of retro game & movie parodies, which are cute at first but end up getting a bit tiring about halfway through the game's 8-or-so hour length. Still, the gameplay is fun enough that it's easy to overlook the annoyance of the parodies after a while and just enjoy the game for what it is: A fun throwback to the classic 2D top-down GTA games which has a really cool, retro style, good controls, and a nice slate of features which will keep you coming back to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024973923', 'num_games_owned': 3816, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2065, 'last_played': 1706740606}
review:
Retro City Rampage is pretty much what I'd hold up as the ideal that all indie games should aspire to be like. Some parts are much better than others, but most of it is really awesome.

The one major drawback I see with it is it's free roam mode. This mode feels limited in what you can do. You can do things to get money but there's ultimately nothing to buy. Structuring this mode a little differently could have made it more engaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305382893', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1670562992}
review: A retro pop-culture smörgåsbord thrill-ride! With exciting gameplay, brilliant writing, jamming music, fun visuals, and well thought-out design, Retro City Rampage is one of the greatest indie game experiences you could have. You might be surprised that I'm giving it such a glowing review with just under 13 hours of playtime, but that's because I started playing it on my 3DS back in 2014 where I racked up over 100 hours of playtime! This will always be one of my all-time favorite gaming experiences and Brian Provinciano is pretty much a hero of mine for deciding to use his creative talents to their full potential, giving us this masterpiece!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064940716', 'num_games_owned': 2411, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1471764789}
review:
这个游戏是一次把gta世界放在像素风格平面世界的一次很有意义的尝试，可惜未能做到更好，突破怀旧玩家的小群体。

很多人都提了缺乏深度的问题，的确，这游戏虽然看起来元素丰富，但实际上缺乏让玩家沉浸其中的目标，玩家不做主线，想跟gta一样游荡的话很快就丧失了乐趣。
我认为其实并不是这个游戏作者的失误，而是gta初代本来的游戏性就不够，gta的前2作的游戏性远不及其第3作（更不需要谈画质了）。gta系列从3代开始才有了如今的地位，Retro City Rampage视图做的核心gameplay从一开始就感觉没选对模型。
我认为这个游戏的核心问题在于：视图在2维平面上复刻在3维世界才有乐趣的玩法，后面的开车手感不好等显而易见的问题都出自这里。本来可以做的更好的双摇杆射击部分可能局限于像素风格没能做好，但是有改进希望，但开车部分从本质上就是无解的。

除开本质性的问题不谈，Retro City Rampage依旧是个好游戏，但只是针对少数人而言。开发组非常努力地塞进去了很多梗，可以说整个游戏的任务就是由梗串联起来的，几乎每个任务都有对应的恶搞（或者说致敬）的对象，而且细节安插的很棒（印象比较深的有某关逃亡路过下水道里跳上几个忍者神龟）。
游戏剧情以搞笑为主，当然由于语言的问题可能有些玩家觉得无趣，这只能说是遗憾了。

总体来说，我只能推荐给还怀念NES时代的老玩家们或是喜欢像素风格的玩家们（当然包括我自己XD），其他的同学还是等等看这个开发组的新作品吧，应该更好玩一些。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027372201', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1474216648}
review:
After four hours of Retro City Rampage there are two things to say:

1. Technically superb, well playable.

2. This game is fucking obnoxious as shit. References, references, references and humor from preschool.
   The WAY it is designed, the sounds, the "story" the lack of concentration on one theme, gamemode, level, whatever is so hyperactive that it just bursts my nerves and in the end ends up beeing nothing but busywork. 

Result: Competently made, grossly obnoxious busywork that you have to be REALLY into to stand for very long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319568141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1474777332}
review:
Welcome to the jungle we got fun and Retro City Rampage
Its got everything you want honey, if you loved the 80's
Its got the parodies and mindless killing and all the violence need
If you got the money honey Retro City Rampage has your disease...

In Retro City, welcome to Retro city
Watch it bring the Turtles and the A-Team to their knees 
Its got what you need

Retro City Rampage pays homage while parodying so many things from the 80's, and some things from the 90's and now, that its easy to lose track at just how many films, comics, cartoons, etc, that are poked fun at.  To add to the whole 80's retro theme the game is an 8 bit throw back to the NES days which may make it unlikable to those who are extremely obsessed with the latest and greatest graphics but for those who prioritize gameplay over graphics and are total children of the 80's and gratitious but very cartoon violence, they'll love this game.  Gameplay wise, it isn't unlike G2A 2, you go around doing missions and side quests, stealing cars, gunning down people, etc, and so on but what gives it an edge over GTA 2 is the games sense of humor.  I also recommed this title to those who are into the humor in Duke Nukem and Postal games, the Player (that's the lc's name) isn't as rauncy but it has a fair share of non pc humor.  

For the record, the the last review was written with my old account (Devianza97) which I no longer have access to and need to get Steam to delete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055687643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1473729485}
review:
Here's a simple way of describing this Fantastic Game:

o  Grand Theft Auto + "Ready Player One" by Ernest Cline + Old School Graphics
    = Retro City Rampage

author: {'steamid': '76561198067923465', 'num_games_owned': 962, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1473121447}
review:
Une ode à la jeunesse de ceux qui n'ont plus vingt ans depuis déjà longtemps, RCR se place comme un hommage et une parodie de ces vieux jeux qui ont égayés les salons des années 80-90, mais remis à la sauce moderne dans un cocktail de défis funs qui s'enchaînent à une vitesse folle.
J'imagine que c'est fait exprès, mais la version française traduite, avec toutes ses fautes d'orthographes et ses raccourcis, et à mourir de rire. L'histoire est déjantée sans prendre de place importante et le jeu regorge de secrets, de clins d'oeils, de caméos en tout genre.
Je regrette cependant une difficultée trop inégale et parfois trop élevée pour certains passages qui cassent le rythme du jeu; on enchaîne trois missions funs où on défonce tout le monde en leur piétinant le visage puis on arrive dans un niveau labyrinthique ennuyeux où on se fait tuer en deux coups et on recommence tout. On passe trop vite du "ha, c'est court, c'est fun !" au "pff, c'est long et chiant..."

Bon, le jeu se finit en une petite poignée d'heures donc ça passe quand même. C'est quand même dommage que le dosage soit aussi inégal. La difficultée dans ce genre de jeu n'est pas forcément nécessaire et justifiée, ça m'aurait très bien allé d'avoir un perso surcheaté qui passe le jeu entier à latter tout le monde. Malheureusement, ce n'est trop rarement le cas.

Je recommande le jeu quand même parce que pour même pas 10 balles c'est une aventure assez folle et une bouffée d'air frais au milieu de tous ces jeux en 3D 1080p 60fps qu'on nous sert à toutes les sauces, aussi bon soit-ils !

author: {'steamid': '76561198067279231', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 575, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1711228102}
review:
Player is not a name! That's all about that game. Funny joke indeed but game is unplayable and not fun at all.
A lot of cheap death because you've 1sec too react before dying. Great!
Also let's not talk about the "little" challenge that heavily relies on RNG. Need to kill 100 people in 45sec. Guess what? Only 3 people just spawn next to you. Guess you will have to restart the challenge AGAIN!
It happens a lot and is unfun. Also, i don't who made the difficulity of each challenge but some gold medals are laughable. One try -> one success -> one gold medal. Not even trying to do play the objective.
When some other challenges are way too hard and annoying.

I can't recommend such a terrible game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970616873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1472437371}
review:
I completed the game and it was tedious. The nostalgia humour is relentless and the gameplay is as incoherent and frantic as the narrative. Only a handful of missions required some skill and were rewarding; the majority of the game is: drive somewhere, receive joke, complete trivial action.

Music is very good, and the art style is cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086345363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1710, 'last_played': 1683126931}
review:
Retro City Rampage oder Back to the 80s


Herzlich Willkommen in Theftropolis im Jahr 1985.

RCR verkörpert Nostalgie pur, ein Spiel wie eine Zeitreise vollgestopft mit Erinnerungen und Anspielungen an die Popkultur der 80er und frühen 90er Jahre, angefangen bei Batman ,Ninja Turtles oder den Back to the Future Filmen bis zu Games wie Paperboy, Mega Man, Frogger ist alles dabei, um nur einige zu nennen.

Das Spiel wird wie sein Vorbild GTA 1 aus der Vogelperspektive gespielt, das alles in 8-Bit Grafik "Schönheit" unterlegt mit zeitgemäßen 80er Jahre Chiptune Sound.

Die Stadt Theftropolis ist Open-World typisch frei erkundbar mittels Zweirad, PKW, LKW, Bus, Panzer, Monster-Truck oder zu Fuss. Das Stadtgebiet ist im Vergleich zum Vorbild GTA 1 sehr klein.

Das Gameplay ist angelehnt an die ersten beiden GTA Teile, Aufträge und Missionen werden durch Personen oder über Münzfernsprecher erteilt, man kann der Missionstruktur der Kampagne folgen oder zahlreiche Nebenmissionen abarbeiten. Aufträge und Missionen sind sehr vielfältig gestaltet und abwechslungsreich. Seiner Zerstörungswut kann man freien Lauf lassen in dem man wahlos Passanten überrollt. Autos zu Schrott fährt und mittels vielfältigen Schlag und Schusswaffenarsenal einen Straßenkrieg anfängt. Was natürlich die Polizei und mit steigenden Fahndunglevel die Armee auf den Plan ruft. Seinen HIGHSCORE kann man durch das erledigen von Missionen oder in dem man sein Unwesen in der Stadt treibt stetig in die Höhe treiben.

Für mich ist RCR eine schöne Reise in meine Jugend gewesen, die durch das Fernsehen und das spielen am Heimcomputer mitprägt wurden.
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad steigert sich im Spielverlauf von moderat bis extrem schwierig (letzte Missionen der Kampagne), und passt zu den anspruchsvollen Schwierigkeitsgraden den die Spiele dieser Zeit noch hatten.

Retro City Rampage ist ein Spiel mit besonderem Retro Charme, insbesondere für eine Generation, mich eingeschlossen, die in die Jahre gekommen ist aber immer noch Spaß an guten Spielen hat.

Abschließend  Retro City Rampage ist ein schönes Retro Open -World Action Game im Sinne von GTA 1.

10 von 10 Punkte

author: {'steamid': '76561198154175378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1502741663}
review: A parody, a clone, and a Demake all in one. So how come I have more fun with this than GTA 3 or my personal favorite of the series, Vice City? Because it's a great game, with much to do. You may only get about ten hours out of the story if you fuck around, and possibly sixteen hours to 100% the game, but you'll have fun the entire way, and for ten bucks, that's pretty good. ALSO; YOU CAN ACTUALLY AIM! Finally!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005576643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1680540851}
review:
This game is nuts. Completely. I love it.

If it was released back in the days on Commodore64, people would still keep that ancient 8-bit machine for playing this crazy one. The other way, it is a really dense tribute to the whole history of gaming, including so many elements that I'd rather skip listing.

If you have anything coded in your DNA that makes you feel itchy (in a good mean) about raw retro and wicked stuff, just go for it. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278119203', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1348, 'last_played': 1690021634}
review:
[h1] Лучшее, из того во что я играл [/h1]
Retro City Rampage это чертовски хороший клон игр серий гта, времен вида сверху. И я имею в виду [b]чертовски хорош. [/b]Эта игра была первой из купленных игр мной в стиме. Я провел в этой игре тысячи часов на своем смартфоне, и нисколько от нее не отвык. Возможно, тут играет свою роль ностальгия, но давайте разберем все по частям.

Графика
Графика тут восьмибитная, в стиле игр на NES, но это не мешает выглядеть игре по своему красиво. Игра красочная, спрайты лиц, машин и текстуры улиц сделаны очень добротно.

Саундтрек
Черт возьми, в эту игру стоит поиграть хотя бы ради саундтрека. Восьмибитные запилы от Norrin Radd, virt и Freaky DNA каждый раз заставляют меня трепетать[spoiler] virt - Try ВАН ЛАВ!!1![/spoiler].

Геймплей
Очень динамичный, никогда не устанешь заходить в свободный режим и подрывать машины в танке. Что касается сюжетки, то здесь вы найдете для себя 64 увлекательных миссии и кучу карикатур и отсылок к массовой культуре. Относительно багов, я нашел только один графический. Игра очень добротно сделана и играется без проблем. Также, если вам надоело крушить автомобили и убивать горожан, можно сыграть в мини игры и демо порт RCR для NES в аркадном зале, или пройти специальные игровые челленджи.

Replay Value: OVER 9000

С выходом Shakedown Hawaii, второй игры от тех же разработчиков и похожей атмосферой, RCR получила небольшую графическую планировку, были добавлены небольшие анимации в катсценах и диалогах. Что касается SH, то я также настоятельно рекомендую попробовать и его. RCR сама по себе не дорогая, а на распродаже и вообще копейки.

[b]10/10[/b], жалко что нет полного саундтрека на стриминговых сервисах.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000564560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1470997608}

author: {'steamid': '76561198084985452', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1478431626}
review:
Retro City Rampage — отличная игра, один из лучших инди-релизов года и невероятный атракцион для тех, чье детство прошло за Dendy и Mega Drive. Ее закрома неистощимы, и она с первой до последней минуты буквально бомбардирует вас новыми ощущениями, черпая их в вашем же собственном прошлом. Если вам кажется, что это неинтересно, то мы явно говорим на разных языках.
При желании у игры можно найти много недостатков: некоторые автомобили ездят слишком медленно, интерфейс далёк от совершенства, к графике и звуку надо привыкнуть. Но Retro City Rampage — это шанс погрузиться в объятия ностальгии, в те времена, когда только-только начиналось знакомство с играми. Подборка уморительных пародий и выворачивание на изнанку современных жанров не дают заскучать. В свою очередь, зубодробительные схватки с боссами и прочие сцены «с приветом из прошлого» держат в напряжении. Превосходная возможность заглянуть в альтернативную игровую реальность.

Достоинства:	
`Отличные штуки на самые разные темы
`Неожиданные образы популярных героев
`Мастерски переделанные моменты из известных игр
`Сложные моменты в духе старых игр
`Секреты, испытания и дополнительные режимы
`Замечательный визуальный стиль и музыкальное сопровождение

Недостатки: 
`Хватает затянутых сражений
`Некоторые контрольные точки расставлены далеко друг от друга
`Не представляет особого интереса для тех, кто плохо знаком с классикой времён NES и определенными фильмами
`Ряд мелких недоработок

Оценка - 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030335690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1469371742}
review: Un must have per i fans degli anni 80, sprizza edonismo da tutti i pori.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020705409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1469201952}
review:
Mundo abierto estilo GTA 2 con estilo 8 bits.
El juego es una ensalada de homenajes a series, películas y juegos de los 80´s: Robocop, Regreso al futuro, Cazafantasmas, Tortugas Ninja, Metal Gear, Equipo A y un largo etc.
Los que ya tenemos una edad, disfrutaremos, sobre todo de la primera hora de juego, pero después va perdiendo fuelle. Es demasiado sencillo, a excepción de 2 o 3 picos de dificultad exagerada. La historia es absurda y divertida, pero quizás abusa de chistes, tópicos y gags, que acaban por perder la gracia.
El pixel art es horrible en comparación con otros juegos retro y a veces se vuelve caótico mientras intentas leer las instrucciones en pantalla y estás en un tiroteo o en una persecución.
En resumen, su razón de ser son los homenajes a épocas pasadas y vivir de la nostalgia, pero creo que es bastante pobre en muchas otras cosas y existen propuestas similares mucho mejores en casi todos los sentidos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990463215', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1468998654}
review:
Seemed enjoyable at first, but it is unplayable to me on a normal PC.
I ride around town for a while. Get lots of guns. Get upgraded car. Unlock plenty of new outfits. Then I SAVE my game and start STORY MISSION 1.

Game hangs during the bank cutscene. Unfixable.
I load my saved game, and all my unlocked stuff is gone. My guns are gone. My score is gone. My car is gone.

Searching online reveals the game has a history of bugs and driver issues : ( All hope lost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272188005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1494955354}
review:
Зараз ігрова індустрія налічує незліченну кількість різноманітних шедеврів, починаючи представниками з далеких 70-тих і закінчуючи 2010-тими роками, та поміж цього відрізка у півстоліття просто неможливо не відзначити середину вісімдесятих, на яку припадає розквіт ігрової індустрії. Можливо, багато хто скаже, що ігри на той момент були не самі продвинуті, та, на мою думку, розробники у прямому сенсі вкладали в свої творіння щіпотку душі та шматочок свого серця. 

     Тож не дивно, що ця гра відкриває нам дорогу "НАЗАД В... '80-е". Можна навіть жартома назвати RCR:DX королем шедеврів, хоча в деякій мірі так і є. Ну ось де, як не тут ви побачите стільки різноманітних відсилок і "теплих" карикатур до культових ігор уже з перших хвилин? - Звісно, що ніде, а особливо на такому рівні гармонійності. Щоправда, окрім відсилок до фільму "Назад у майбутнє" і до "TMNT" більш нічого не назву - не знаю інших назв, бо, на жаль, ніколи не відчував ніякого великого захоплення до проектів того часу :)

     А тепер настав час розповісти вам мої враження щодо гри - насамперед, мені сподобалось те, що гемплейно гра нагадує перші дві частини із серії ігор про найвидатнішого крадія машин, а саме: GTA: London 1961 та GTA II. Стилістика гри теж захоплююча, ніби дійсно "назад до вісімдесятих". Це ж можна сказати й про музикальний супровід, що дуже канонічно підходить для гри з ії "характером". Також я був приємно здивований, коли збагнув, що гра схожа на Saints Row 3, одну з моїх улюблених ігор, і навіть присвоїв грі кумедний титул "почесного другого місця за найкращу гру у ігровому всесвіті святих": навіть сюжет просто на стільки "бомбезний" і "скажений", що далі уже нікуди. А у вільний час від сюжетний місій можна відточити свої уміння у великій кількості міні-ігор, чи просто влаштувати прочуханки всьому місту ... арсеналу тут досить, починаючи з простого пістолету й закінчуючи неприступним танком, вогнеметом та ракетницею. 

     Загалом, мені гра дуже сподобалась, а тому рекомендую ії вам. Вона різнобарвна, різноманітна, цікава, подекуди кумедна, захоплююча, позитивна і просто гармонійна, з приємними музичними композиціями і візуальною стилістикою. А ще гра має веселі іконки досягнень, що не може не радувати, адже ними можна неабияк прикрасити профіль. Щодо недоліків, то слід зазначити, що гра трішки коротка: годинок так 6-8. Коли ви хочете гарно провести час, раджу обов'язково спробувати за першої ж нагоди, якщо допоки не було такої можливості. Дякую за увагу!

     Написано для НКО: Незалежний Клуб Оглядавів. Детальніше про спільноту можна дізнатися пройшовши через посилання головної групи у профілі. Посилання до профілю автора огляду: http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198272188005/

author: {'steamid': '76561198313778791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1469161572}
review:
Take me down to murder and mayhem city.. where the 80's are alive and the girls are all.. 8 bitty...

Saints Row 2-4 and GTA: Vice City have nothing on this game when it comes to paying homage to the 80's and murder and mayhem, but they do have better graphics, better soundtracks, and far more t&a but who needs t&a when you can kill the Turtles, the A-Team, and the Hoff? At least I think I ran over the Hoff. This game is just everything I wanted in a NES game in the 80's but never got, and I love the 80's.

In short, if you're a child of the 80's and you aren't a graphics junkie and can appreciate 8 bit.. graphics', this game is calling your name.... really.. really loudly. 

And its dirt cheap so it isn't like you'll have buyers remorse even if you don't care for it.

Did I mention it runs under Dos, Windows, and that your cat can play it?

author: {'steamid': '76561198072182182', 'num_games_owned': 2868, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1466210308}
review:
In this Mad Magazine-esque GTA spoof, you send a pompadoured maniac crashing through countless references to 1980's pop culture.  The flimsy icons of your childhood will be mocked, your reflexes will be tested, and your funny bone will be tickled even if you are too green to get the allusions.  

With its awesomely stupid sense of humor and its ever-changing gameplay, this grab bag of ridiculous delights is sure to please!

(Make sure to check out the arcade!  There's this awesome eating competition minigame that you just [i]have[/i] to see!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997331817', 'num_games_owned': 1539, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1497130169}
review:
Un homenaje a la era de los 8 bits. Parodias, humor negro, y sarcasmo... no hay más qué decir. Si eres de la Generación X que creció con el NES y los heroes de acción de 80's y 90's es un juego que debes tener en tu colección.

PD. No menciono los juegos de NES a los que parodia porque no me gusta promover spoilers. Son una bonita sorpresa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044065980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1469395431}
review:
Retro city Rampage es un juego que lo disfruté con las horas jugadas que lleve.
 Puede que la historia sea una parodia que contiene literalmente referencias, referencias y más referencias de juegos y películas 80's y 90's con un toque retro.

Pero lo importante es que su jugabilidad sea atrapante y divertida. Y lo consigue perfectamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189002714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1474417780}
review:
This game techinically takes only a few hours to beat. However, the proper way to play is not simply to beat the game here. Nay, the true goal is to take as much tiime between missions as possible, thus increasing the playtime by at least twofold. That being said, other than the actual arcade-style games-within-a-game, the only game I've been able to come up with for this is "See How Long You Can Survive the Police". The story missions are quite enjoyable and provide the variety I cannot, although there really should have been more of them (especially the non-story missions). The endgame somehow manages to take away both the titular city and rampage, instead opting to throw in a tonne of combat. And then you reach the final boss. While I personally found it a pain to beat, I can only imagine the difficulty one would have with it if they hadn't played one of the aformentioned games-within-a-game. Have fun if you miss one of your incredibly specifically-timed attack opportunities!

In short Retro City Rampage is a fun game, as long as you don't put too much effort into beating it. It's fun, but doesn't have too much depth.

7/10

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197985302505', 'num_games_owned': 1746, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1466089783}
review: После апгрейда до DX издания игра стала определенно заслуживать внимания. Главная вещь, которую исправили - это управление машиной, которое чуть ли не убило все желание играть. Нет смысла описывать пародийный сюжет, тонны отсылочек, юмор - это все на уровне. Отмечу лишь поразительное проникновение атмосферой 8-битных игр. Ключевая заслуга здесь, как я считаю, кроется в драйвовом 8-битном саундтреке. Т.е. это каноничный NESовский саунд, а не дешевый чиптьюн (простите за каламбур).

author: {'steamid': '76561198043135631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2248, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1443562581}
review:
The younger generation won't like this.
It is basically a love letter towards NES.
There's plenty of nods towards classics.
And everything just feels very nostalgic.
Its core is similar to the first GTA game.
But the main gameplay is very different.
I grew up with NES, so I love this game.
And: I liked almost all of the references.
This whole experience was very unique.
It almost felt like reliving the childhood.
Retro City Rampage was just wonderful.
And I have to give it my positive review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008200355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1539308542}
review:
Эта игра 8-битное чудо....максимум взято от игр серии GTA...разумеется с оглядкой внешний вид и возможности игры.
Несомненной порадовала куча пасхалок в игре....если быть внимательным то много чего знакомого можно увидеть из той замечательной эпохи игр Сега и Денди.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163375483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1492267303}
review:
The game is amazing to say the least.  

The graphics are good.  The game play is funny.  The references are fun for gamers.  It was one of my personal favorites for a long time.  I loved this game so much that I bought it for my 3ds, computer, iphone, and several friends computers.  It still is one of the best games ever!  

The controls are terrible though so I would recomend rebinding some of the buttons.

11/10 AMAZING!

review: Excelente la temática sandbox en un juego de diseño en 8 bits a lo vieja escuela. Gran banda sonora, jugabilidad, colores, filtros, etc. Como los juegos de antaño pero mejorado!! Recomendado al 100% para jugar una agradable historia bajo mecánicas simples y diversión brutal o simplemente pasar el rato matando gente mientras escuchas tus melodias favoritas y te absorbes por el mundo de Retro City Rampage DX.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157827650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1470121562}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010906861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1675447917}
review:
This is the pinnacle of indi game done well to me: Not only the game is good (lot of references to other games, good story, lot of stuff to do, good OST), but the game is constantly updated, even 2 years after it's release, which really show how much the devs care about it.
I highly recommend it to you love old GTA (1, London and 2) and if you love retro games.

review: Honestly, love this game right now. Only 8 hours of game time so far, but many more to come. Graphics like a classic NES, game like GTA. Amazing references, 20+ years, TMNT, Back to the Future, Mario, and more. Cards, Achievements, Perfect Controller Support. The Sprees in game will keep you busy trying to Gold Medal all of them. The Story Stages are increasing in difficulty, with a decent plot. I bought this from HRK Games for $1.95, and SO worth it. One of my favorite games right now added to my Library for all the content this game has to offer. Recommend it to all gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052610539', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1461896630}
review:
I want to like this game, because it's right in the wheelhouse of a bunch of thngs that should be fun, but it's totally insufferable and that's sad. Literally all the writing in this game is REMEMBER THAT VIDEO GAME YOU LOVED IN THE OLDEN DAYS HEY HEY GUYS REMEMBER HEY GUYS REMEMBER THAT TIME THE THING HAPPENED HEY WE ARE REMAKING THAT SEQUENCE HERE HEY HEY GUYS HEY THIS IS SO FUNNY HEY GUYS LOL.

It's too bad. There's actually the basis of a real interesting game here, but this is the video game equivilant of that guy you know that is about one one-hundredth as funny as he think he is, and it kills the whole thing dead.

Also, no remapable controls is an inexcusable PC programming sin at the best of times 15 years ago, never mind now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302223949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1463652195}
review:
While this isn't a game that's based on an 80's franchise, I still highly recommend it to 80's retro junkies.  There are so many 80's elements in this game and while the game pays homage to those 80's franchises, its done in a parody like way.  The TMNT parody stuff is highly amusing, and then the A-Tem show up, and you'll come across the Burton verison of Batman which at the same time pays homage to the old campy tv series, and there are even some 90's elements like the moments where the game mocks Saved by the Bell.  As for the main bad guy, the developer seemed to base him off the corrupt boss in Warrant's old music videos from their Dirty Rotten era.  But like I said, there are a lot of 80's elements and Back to the Future is one o fthe big ones.

In short, this game has retro NES graphics, and plays like one of the original GTA games but is chock full of 80's and some 90's satire and tht makes it totally worth getting if one is an 80's/90's junkie.  Th elead character, despite being an 8 bit character, is also pretty amusing.

In short, I highly recommend this game to my fellow gen x'ers who grew up watching all of those 80's films and are into violent games that are violent in an amusing way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065263281', 'num_games_owned': 2174, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1527292942}
review:
[b]NOTE: Though my time on this game says 0.1. hours, I played this game on the 3DS to completion. This may affect some of the comments on controls, but everything else is accurate to pretty much any version[/b]

Retro City Rampage [i]ostensibly[/i] is an 80s homage/NES recreation of Grand Theft Auto. However, getting into the game, one will quickly realize that it's a dumping ground for pop culture references, with a game that cannot decide what the hell it wants to be. 


[b]Graphics/Art[/b]
Usually, faux-retro graphics is a kiss of death for indie games. Far too many developers use 8-bit homage as an excuse to make lazy pixel art. I am willing to excuse it in this instance considering that RCR was originally supposed to be an actual NES conversion of Grand Theft Auto. The character portraits are about what you'd expect from a higher-budget NES game, with the in-game art being fairly small

[b]Sound Design[/b]
The music is good, but that's to be expected from Jake Kaufman. That said, he's done far better work for far better games (Check Shovel Knight, one of the few truly great retro throwbacks.) Not that you'd be able to hear the music unless you muted the sound effects, which is a very smart move because Retro City Rampage has some of the most ear-grating sound effects I've ever heard in a game. Every few seconds, there's digitized screeching, what's supposed to be sirens and constant white noise that is supposed to be gunshots.

[b]Story/Character-World Building/Dialogue[/b]
Once upon a time in the 2000s, there were two directors named Aaron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg. After being part of the staff for the popular Scary Movie series, they set out to make their own comedies, such as Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans and Disaster Movie. Everyone [b]hated[/b] these movies, and deservedly so, because in lieu of making jokes about pop-culture, they would just reference the fact that it exists. Seltzer and Friedberg are now pariahs in Hollywood, because everyone hates them. 

What does this have to do with Retro City Rampage, you ask? Because I'm convinced that this game's writers' only comedic reference were Selzter and Friedberg movies. The game does not tell jokes. The game tells references. Technically, the whole plot of the game is an *ahem* "parody" of Back to the Future. The tone of the game is set right at the beginning, where within the span of about six minutes, the game references Mega Man 2, Duck Hunt, The Dark Knight, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, The A-Team, Contra, Mario Bros, Frogger, and Bill and Ted (or maybe it's Doctor Who.) See, the joke is that you probably recognize these things and they are there. The villain is literally Dr. Robotnik from Sonic the Hedgehog, except his name is Buttnick. There's a level where you go to a factory. The joke is that the robot is the Destructoid robot.  [b]H I L A R I O U S.[/b] 

[b]Gameplay[/b]
The story mode will showcase several problems with the game
1. There are several missions where you are faced with a ton of enemies, which showcases how bad the lock-on aiming is. It's inconsistent with when it wants to actually lock on. 
2. The game has knockback when you are damaged, which [i]will[/i] frequently kill you in later stages
3. The game will force you into random diversions, usually to show off another "parody." Want to ride a slow bike that can barely turn? No? Too bad! The developer remembered that Paperboy existed. Want to throw barrels at a wall and have to constantly douse yourself when you catch fire? It's a good thing that Tapper was a thing the developer knew about. How about having an automatic runner stage featuring a guy who can propel himself with his sweat? Don't know what the homage it, but you get it anyways! Then comes the last two stages. Now, in most video games, you would need to use all the skills you've learned in the game so far to the test but- hold the phone. The developer decided that for the final stages, the player should throw all their skills away and play freaking Outrun. I could excuse the arcade minigames because those were optional, but here, you are forced to play Outrun, while Dr. Robotnik fires missiles at you that are timed to hit you right when it's impossible to avoid them.



[b]Grade: D[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198082690442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1490114550}
review:
Prositives:

* More 80's refrences than any peice of media constructed in the past 20 years, brillliantly weaved together.
* Good NES music, thats available digitally and on limited vinyll.
* Comes with a in-game instruction manual that's just a joke.
* Free roam, with an emphasis on killing sprees. Basically, what GTA is built for.
* Chris Hoffman himself is a cosmetic in this game.
* A emphasis on retro graphics and style-you can even change the TV border (or turn it off)
* DX mode makes it easier than what you've heard (and is toggleable)...

Connatatives:

*...but it's still hard. Expect a lot of deaths and some frustrating levels.
* Once you finish the story, you're really only left with Leaderboarded-Challanges and Collectibles
* The story is about 16 hours. A little lackluster.
* If you're not familiar or from the 80s, the game's humor won't make any sense.

SUMMARY:
     A radical jet-fueled love-letter to all things from modern gaming's birth, It's a satisfying yet challenging game for those who's hearts and minds are still with their NES. Anyone else, though, may simply be too young to get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049183341', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1495360584}
review:
Retro City Rampage DX es un frenético sandbox retro de visión isométrica [b]llenito de referencias a la cultura popular de los años 80 y 90.[/b]

En él, nuestro protagonista, Jugador, se apunta a una organización criminal. Tres años más tarde, durante el fallido robo a un banco, roba una cabina telefónica que viaja por el tiempo y viaja al año 20XX. Al llegar a tal año, la cabina se rompe y se encuentra con Doc Choc (el cual le considera el héroe del tiempo). Nuestro deber será [b]recuperar las partes necesarias para arreglar la cabina[/b] mientras exploramos toda Theftrópolis evitando todo tipo de grupos y corporaciones que quieren hacerse con ella.

El juego es [b]pixel-art de 8 bits puro y duro[/b], tanto los escenarios como los personajes y escenas de la historia, [b]están hechos con mucho cariño[/b]. Encima, en las opciones gráficas, [b]podemos aplicarle filtros[/b] para que se vea como si lo estuviésemos jugando en una televisión antigua, una recreativa, una Game Boy, en MS-DOS, etc... Un detallito que aunque no afecte a la jugabilidad en sí, dice mucho del cariño que han puesto los desarrolladores en el juego, haciéndolo lo más retro posible a gusto de todos. (Y si eso no te es suficiente para demostrarte el cariño por lo retro que tienen sus desarrolladores, en la página web del juego [b]puedes hasta comprarlo en floppy disk.[/b])

Su banda sonora es [b]sencillamente genial[/b]. Geniales temas de 8 bits [b]muy pegadizos y que encajan a la perfección con la situación[/b]. Le pillarás mucho cariño.

Su jugabilidad es [b]rápida, frenética y sus controles bastante buenos[/b]. El juego tiene [b]todo tipo de situaciones muy variopintas[/b] dónde esta cambiará (hay niveles de plataformeo, conducción, etc...). [b]No dejará de sorprendernos hasta el final[/b].

Empieza facilito, pero al final se puede hacer [b]algo difícil y desesperante[/b]. ¡¿Pero no somos unos casuals, no?!

[b]Está completamente traducido al español[/b], enterito. Además, su traducción es excelente y te echarás unas buenas risas o te invadirá la nostalgia en según qué partes.

El único punto negativo que le sacaría, sería [b]su duración[/b]. [b]Te lo fundes en unas 6-7 horas[/b]. Afortunadamente, la ciudad está [b]llena de contenido, misiones y cosillas que hacer[/b] además de que siempre te puedes entretener en sacarte los [b]logros[/b].

En resumen, no puedo evitar recomendar enormemente este juego [b]si te gustan aunque sea un mínimo los años 80-90[/b]. De oferta lo puedes pillar a [b]unos ricos 1,99€[/b].

author: {'steamid': '76561198014234116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1496610963}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997031234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1462586132}
review:
Retro City Rampage is what you get when you combine a modern open world game with retro 8 bit gameplay and style. Oh, and with loads of pop culture and video game references. This combination of different gameplay and style works well, playing out like an 8 bit version of GTA and similar games with plenty of humor and parodies going on.

The story revolves around Player, the main character of the game, who is a henchman. After stealing a time traveling phone booth that takes him into the year 20XX, Player must work with Doc Choc to fix the time machine and also interact with other characters in Theftopolis to get the needed parts. In the game, the story is driven through missions and cutscenes. Along with the main missions for the story are optional side missions that provide extra narrative based on the main plot.
The game uses a lot of parodies and references throughout as seen with the characters and scenery, to name a few. With the sheer amount of references going left and right, it’s easy to be overwhelmed, but the parodies are a good laugh with a focus on video games and 80s and 90s pop culture. The references range from mainstream to obscure and subtle to blunt, and it’s a great experience keeping with the game’s theme and setting. The majority of the references lie in Story Mode, which really drives not just the parodies but also the overall style of the game.

Retro City Rampage plays much like a cross between open world games like Grand Theft Auto with some gameplay style from NES games. Like in most open world games, there is a big city to explore and missions pointing you to certain locations. The majority of missions focus on getting to a certain spot on the map and doing a certain task. There’s a great variety of different tasks to do, making the Story Mode missions interesting with different gameplay goals to complete. In addition to the structured missions that show each objective to be done, there are also arcade style missions with the goal being to get a high score. These arcade missions are quite fun in their own right, focusing instead on pure mayhem and causing as much destruction in the city.
As the gameplay borrows from GTA, there are some common elements in Retro City Rampage. Cars can be stolen, pedestrians can be attacked, police will attack upon seeing a crime, and there are a variety of weapons to use.  The game does deviate from typical open world games by bringing its own twist based on games from the 8 bit era. Jumping is performed like in platforming games with the intent to jump over obstacles and to jump on people’s heads. This jump attack can kill people and is a powerful unarmed attack. Objects and people can be picked up and thrown in a manner similar to beat em up games, where any object is carried over the head and thrown forward. Powerups can bestow different effects. These powerups must be bought unless a mission gives one that must be used, and they give a huge amount of power in a limited time.
In addition, the game is quite fair when it comes to trying to complete missions. After dying in a mission a few times, the game will offer some useful tips pertaining to that mission. If the game feels that the mission is quite tough for the person playing based on the many deaths that occurred, the game may change things around by giving a handicap to help complete the mission. This function of making the missions a tad bit easier is not in every mission, so some particularly tough missions must be completed at the default difficulty. Anyhow, it’s clear to see the inspiration from open world games, but there’s also a great combination with gameplay from NES games that works well as a game that is fun to play.

This game employs an 8 bit pixel style, with a very sincere approach in imitating the style of actual games from that era. The graphics are quite blocky and low resolution in the overworld, as if the game were on the NES. Character portraits are also similar in style, along with capturing the original character or person’s features from the parody. Only a few modern graphical liberties are used, one of which is the wavy screen distortion effect. In addition to its 8 bit style, there are various screen borders that slightly affect the presentation of the game, either by placing high resolution graphical borders that fit the game’s theme to even changing the colors of the game. With the 8 bit NES art style, the game treats the graphics quite well. It’s the same way that the parodies are treated with respect toward the original material, and the game goes great lengths into accurately portraying visuals as if it were an actual NES game with great results.

The music in the soundtrack is chiptune like the style of the game. There are some nice tunes played throughout, with the soundtrack being done by various video game musicians. Each of the songs work very well with the tone and style of the game, with a few parodies too based on some popular NES tunes. Overall, the soundtrack is quite catchy and stays true to the general theme quite well.
Of note is the sound design, which is done like the sounds of the NES. All the sounds are not realistic and instead go for the beepy electronic noises that were a mainstay of games in the 80s. This design choice perfectly matches what the game was going for, with almost every aspect of the game being lifted from an NES game from its original time. There are only a few unique things seen in modern games that this game uses, but Retro City Rampage does so well in staying true to the original retro video game style.

Retro City Rampage is in essence, an 8 bit version of open world games like GTA with lots of parodies here and there. The story is quite straightforward with the majority of parodies going there for a good laugh. The gameplay draws from GTA the most but throws in some gameplay style from NES games too. To top it off, both the art and music stay close to the style of the NES and holds its origins in high regard. Retro City Rampage is a fun game to play and oozes with respect for retro video games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109883351', 'num_games_owned': 1814, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1461743385}
review:
Hold Enter button simulator.

I love the retro sound and graphics.. really feels like an 8bit game but where it fails for me is in the bitty broken up nature of the gameplay. Everytime the action gets going it comes to a halt for the story.

Yes if it wasn't for the story it would be too close to GTA 1 but it does feel like there should have been short elegant segways into the plot instead of the classic mistake of coming to a dead stop to explain stuff. You are a bad guy.. you hurt innocent people while doing bad things.. got it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068101069', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1461202758}
review: So yeah, this is a parody of GTA that relies on the unsurmountable amount of pop culture references to make you think it's doing something intelligent when it's not. The plot is completely neglectable, as it simply doesn't make sense. It's repetitive and so are the missions and dialogues, that try to be really clever with the most teen and buttdick humour ever. I was enjoying the sillines of it all until I realised that the dialogues were skippable and not funny, and that everywhere I went it was a hassle because the police was, well, hassling you everywhere. Not only that, but towards mission 40, the combat spikes up so much that it's frustratingly difficult and unfair - particularly for such a basic and not-thought-through system. It's simply not funny or engaging, and too frustrating. As a whole, yes, it's a mildly clever statement "videogame plots never make sense and are over-the-top self-aggrandising rampages!!!". But you can do exactly that with a much cleverer writing, humour and mechanics. Also, this game should have lasted two hours top, and it goes on and on and on and on unnecesarily. Man this is the first game that has made me rage quit and outright uninstall the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135422328', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1514134818}
review:
Я следил за этой игрой, но не ожидал, что эмоции окажутся настолько сильными.
ОГРАБИТЬ БАНК, ГРОХНУТЬ СВОЙ АВТОБУС, ГРАБАНУТЬ ЕЩЕ ОДИН МАГАЗИН И УЛЕПЕТЫВАТЬ НА СВОИХ ДВОИХ, СНОСЯ ВСЕХ СЛОВНО СОНИК? ЗАПРОСТО!
ГРОХНУТЬ ЧЕРЕПАШЕК-НИНДЗЯ, ПОПУТНО ЗАПРЫГНУВ В МАШИНУ К ДОКУ? ДА КАК НЕХ ДЕЛАТЬ!
БОЖЕ, ЭТА ИГРА ПРОСТО НЕ ПОЗВОЛЯЕТ ПИСАТЬ НЕ КАПСОМ, ПОТОМУ ЧТО ОТ ЕЕ КРУТИЗНЫ ВЗРЫВАЮТСЯ ЯЙЦА И ХОЧЕТСЯ ОРАТЬ В ГОЛОС С ТОГО, ЧТО ПРОИСХОДИТ!
10/10 по эмоциям, конечно же (Логвинов)
8/10 по трезвому анализу (не всегда бывает удобно пользоваться укрытиями и вождение лажает), но на самом деле это не важно, ведь можно ПРОСТО ТВОРИТЬ БЕЗУМИЕ И ЖИТЬ В КАЙФ

review: This game is most assuredly not for everyone, not even necessarily fans of GTA, but it's good fun for someone who wants to both make fun of GTA and extend the insanity even further. It's a surprisingly faithful retro adaption of GTA, and it's also an amusing, if often ridiculous, parody, full of 80s-90s references. The fact that it's an 8-bit sandbox-type game is pretty rad too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105389309', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1524855686}
