author: {'steamid': '76561198025281907', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1578698336}
review:
[h1] Amazing programming, solid and fun gameplay with lots of 80's and 90's nostalgia. [/h1] 

I got interested in the game because of its development history, it was originally developed as a homebrew game for the NES, which makes it one of the few retro games that could really run on retro hardware. It is only 22 mb large on my system, available for practically all operating systems (I am playing on linux) and all consoles, the dev made even a DOS port. That it is dedication and I think the programming of this game is really really well done.

I finally bought the game because of a discount on steam and found out that the gameplay is also really fun, most things just feel right. There is not as much to do in the open world as in the "real" GTA games. I have rushed through the story missions, which I just finished, so there are still a lot of "challenges" for me to try. The story is fun, does not take itself too serious, but it is not deep, moving or particularly smart. The game is a satire and lives from its parodies of  old school games like Mario, Zelda and such, so it is definetly an advantage if you know those, but if you don't, it is still fun.  Some missions are definitly not easy, but usually doable, at least after a couple of tries, especially because the DX version features in-game tips (thank you dev). However, I would really recommend to play this game with a gamepad, I have not tried the keyboard control yet but I cannot imagine that it would feel as good as a gamepad.

So if you like retro games, cool 8-bit graphics and music and running around an open world shooting everything and if you don't fear an occasional challenge, I am sure you will enjoy this game for about 10 hours at least. I have played it only for 7, but there are still many things I want to do.

However, it is not a game that I will love in the same way as I love for example "Zelda: A Link to The Past" or "Cave Story". The world is not small, but it is also not deep, believable or full of charming characters, same as the flat main characters. A game can be a retro satire AND have a moving story with deep characters, as UNDERTALE proved. If you are looking retro game with a moving story, that might be more for you. However, the gameplay was definetly more fun in RCR, imo. I enjoyed it and will recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078953875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1696060449}

review:
"Good gosh!"

Take the gameplay style of GTA 1 and 2 and add a story involving time travel that throws in pretty much every piece of '80s and '90s nostalgia you could possibly think of. Then add an insanely awesome 8bit soundtrack and sound effects and you have this game.

I've pretty much had a smile on my face the entire time I've played this game. Even repetitive failure is entertaining. 

Plus you can jump and stomp on people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070596856', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1468260524}
review:
I grew up playing GTA 2 on a windows 98 computer, this game reminded me of those times years and years ago and Im really happy with it. The game has constant a flow of action and references about movies and videogames. Great gameplay, great story, great atmosphere, great open world and an excellent game overall. Highly recommended even if sometimes the game crashes randomly. 

PD: In the files of the game, they give you a ms-dos, ms-dos installation floppy and windows 3.1 versions of the game and that is really fucking cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976799778', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1459248259}
review:
Da ich schon die ersten beiden GTA Teile mochte, hatte ich mich schon länger auf Retro City Rampage™ DX gefreut. Das Spiel strotzt nur so von Anspielungen an ältere NES Games sowie neuere Indiegames (z.B: Splosion Man). Daher müsste das Spiel eigentlich ein Instant Hit sein.

Leider ist es das aber nicht. Die Grafik sieht einfach nur furchtbar aus (handwerklich schlecht gemacht). Die sechs kurzen Lieder wechseln sich ständig ab, so dass diese relativ schnell nerven.

Aber das schlimmste ist das Gameplay. Aus meiner Sicht ist die Steuerung einfach nur kaputt. Weder auf einem Gamepad noch auf der Tastatur (schon etwas besser), lässt sich dieses Biest auch nur ansatzweise präzise steuern. Es ist mir in sechs Stunden nicht gelungen ansatzweise durch die Stadt zu tuckern ohne JEDE Ecke mitzunehmen.

Gerade in Kombination mit den unnötigen Zeitlimits, wurden somit einige Stellen echt frustig (vor allem zum Ende hin). So wie das Spiel aktuell ist habe ich aber keine Lust mehr mir die Stadt abseits von der wirren Kampagne anzuschauen.

2/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198131525298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1431304267}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082713718', 'num_games_owned': 1195, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1492345769}
review:
GTA-Retro City(Tiny 8-bit GTA)
这款游戏向许多老游戏致敬，拥有无厘头的剧情与带感的8-bit音乐。键盘操作起来不怎么适应，控制较难。让我重拾当年玩小霸王的记忆。

author: {'steamid': '76561198166620870', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1494360225}
review:
Essentially an 8-bit GTA remixed with 80's and 90's movie and game references. The open-world game we always wanted in the Nes days.

A blast to play with a wide array of gameplay mechanics and styles. From the common top-down classic gta gameplay to metroid style gameplay and other things as well. Loads of weapons, customization and hours of gameplay.

With the 16-bit sequel (Shakedown Hawaii) around the corner, there's even more reason to play this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214702245', 'num_games_owned': 1861, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1458977983}
review:
低像素風格GTA，搶槍、搶車、搶銀行，你不可以錯過。
懷念超級瑪利、MGS、洛克人的亨利博士? 通通都在故事模式裡客串演出。

故事模式值得一玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198141814325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1536343517}
review:
РЕКОМЕНДУЮ ВСЕМ РЕТРО ГЕЙМЕРАМ!
Не пожалеете!
Увидел еще в прошлом году, думал не очень удобно играть наверно...забил..
Через несколкьо месяцев решил всё-таки  скачать. Сначала "не со стима", потом...
моё лицо: "ДА ЭТО ЖЕ ШЕДЕВАР"!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Купил значит (тож не со стима) ОТЛИПНУТЬ НЕ МОГ!!
Подключил старый геймпад, настроил игру под себя.
НУ а теперь оценка:
1000 ГАБЕНОВ из 1000 ГАБЕНОВ!


----------------------------------ПЛЮСЫ:
1.Графика. Всегда хотел пиксельную игру с открытым миром.
НУ ГТА 1 это и так понятно, а тут еще и наркоманский сюжетище!
2. НАркомания. Помимо основного сюжета, который по сути уже и так
наркоманский, во время игры может случится невооброзимое, и
наркомания становится всё больше и больше...
3. ГЕЙМПАД! Вот это важная вещь! Мой старый геймпад для 
PC и PS2. Сначала он определил как обычный стандартный геймпад
для XBOX  и в интерфейсе клавиши буквами высвечивались.
Потом уже определил PS2 и всё супер робит!
4. УПРАВЛЕНИЕ. Удобное)
5. МУЗЫКА. Музыка шикардеющая! Так же как и в ЖТА
можно менять музыку в радио.
6. Огромный мир. Для такой игры мир огромен, это точно!
7. Интерфейс. В настройках меню можно изменить игру под себя,
в том числе и графон.
----------------------------------------------МИНУСЫ:
1.Короткий сюжетик (но это не страшно, т.к. есть аркадный режим, и свободный)
2. Нету русского языка. Хоть и я знаю английский, но тамиспользуется
нецензурная и разговорная брань.
----------------------------
ВООБЩЕМ СУПЕР ЭВАР ГЕЙМ ФОРЕВАР!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198191812887', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1603907823}
review: Retro City Rampage was already a decent game, but the DX version made it even better! Retro City Rampage DX is a GTA-styled game (but with the old school topdown-view), plus all kinds of references from the eighties thrown in to it that you can renember. I'm just 13 years old, but there are quite a lot of refernces that even I know. [spoiler]For example, Bundy's Wedding Chapel is clearly a reference to Al Bundy from Married with Children. Doc Choc and that time traveling-phonebooth are just references to Doc Brown from Back to the Future and Bill & Ted's Phonebooth. [/spoiler] I like the retro graphics, and the fact that you can change the graphics to old monitor settings, like CGA, Monochrome, and EGA. It's not the best game ever, but the game is pretty cool. And, it's just fricking GTA without the violent blood splatters. And I love blood splatters and unnecessary violence! *sarcasm* I would recommend buying the game, though not through Steam itself. If you go to the [url=retrocityrampage.com]official website [/url] you can get the game for 10 bucks, the same price on Steam, but included with (of course!) the Steam-key for Retro City Rampage DX, an DRM-free version of Retro City Rampage DX, plus all of the soundtracks! But, if the game is 75% off, then why bother and just buy it from Steam. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198170691582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1458345754}
review:
This game has a lot going for it. The positives:

80’s and 90’s references are amusing. 
Free roam gameplay is really fun. 
Challenges and sprees are also great (although, getting gold in some of these is too hard).
I absolutely love the retro style. 

However, there are many issues that really drag this game down:

The final boss, I gave up. I’m not going back. The last few levels were horribly designed, and were simply not fun. 
TMNT sewer levels were bad then, and RCR’s reiteration is also bad. 
With regard to the story, don’t ask why, it’s not supposed to make sense. Why should I care about what’s going on, if the game is constantly telling me not to care. 

Performance: no issues playing on PC or through the steam link. Throughout my gameplay I used an XB1 controller, and I did not encounter any issues. 

Overall, this game is a 2 out 5. I purchased this game on sale, and I got enjoyment out of it, but I won’t be coming back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003509214', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1483220758}
review:
Reference City Reference XD is like Troy McClure from the Simpsons. 
You may remember him but that in itself is not amusing.

What you end up with is a classic GTA clone in pixel form, which is fine if you buy it on a platform that does not have access to GTA, such as the 3DS.

Saints Row series does this type of thing far better because it has its own story that sets up the pop culture gags.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037043811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1458109526}
review: Retro City Rampage tries to do the whole GTA/Bethesda game/Ubigame thing of being a big open world that you get familiar with by driving around a hub, and that's a pretty modern convention. It also tries to do this while clumsily weilding about what they will assert is a very retro playstyle. The thing is, this ends up being a worst of both worlds scenario, strung with boring and repetitive combat scenarios spread across a pretty uninteresting city, with little motivating you to follow through with the dozens of side missions that show up on your radar. When I did try to do them, they felt like they were repeating the worst parts of the main campaign, which itself was largely juvenile in tone and design. They throw a million expendable cops, thugs, and soldiers your way, with a hundred invisible checkpoints and an infinite supply of lives so that you die a million times (97 by the end in my case) without losing a lot of progress. And I can't help but feel like that blind jab at "difficulty" is what they believed would make their game justifiable as "Nintendo Hard". RCR is less a game and more a hamfisted, halfhearted, and mostly unfunny collection of cheap references and gags.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108318891', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1464764461}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114221441', 'num_games_owned': 903, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1509265644}
review:
Отличная игра для Ретро ценителей, которые не по наслышке знакомы с играми 80 - 90-ых годов. Так как там очень много отсылок, почти каждую минуту, нам показывают героев из прошлого, иногда не в том виде в котором мы привыкли их видеть, но если знать кто это такие и что эти герои делали в старых играх, то можно сразу догадаться где и кто прогуливается.
Игра очень напоминает первые части GTA (хотя по сюжету, больше напоминает Saints Row), только с более приятной и разнообразной графикой. В ней простое и понятное управление, а так же все происходит достаточно, а иногда даже слишком быстро, от чего не успеваешь даже улыбнуться старому герою которого встретил, как встречаешь уже следующего и следующего, и от этого переизбытка бывает забываешь, а кого вообще видел в этой игре, но и минусом это не назвать, так как играть в нее все равно хочется.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059216394', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1457826504}

author: {'steamid': '76561198132035369', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1458133464}
review:
This game is Awesome!
I'm not really into 8-bit game before, but when i play this game i felt i want more game like this.

The main story is simple, yet entertaining.
Well actually i don't really get some of the side story, maybe because my english is not really good but still this game is fun to play.
And another things that made me like this game is that this game has a lot of easter egg of some famous movie like [spoiler]TMNT, Rambo, Back to the Future, Robocob, and many more[/spoiler]

I would rate this game 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197960337918', 'num_games_owned': 1122, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1460044328}
review:
Retro City Rampage would have been the best game ever in '92.  The title pretty much sums it up what to expect. Game is filled with pop culture references of the 80's and 90's. Some of them are funny but not enough to make you wanna play this game.

Gameplay it self works fine and cars act exactly like they did on Super nintendo. Everything feels retro as intended: sounds, graphics, menus, effects. 

There is nothing new this game offers and nowadays there are much better games like this available. I recomend getting GTA 2 (free game) if you like to play a game like this one.  If you want to re-live the glorious pixel world of the past with all its greatness and flaws, this just might be the game for you. Rest of use who has left the past behind: feel free to skip this title.

10 - Perfect game
9 - Excelent game, best of the genre
8 - Good game, worth your time
[h1]7 - Average game, nothing really special[/h1]
6 - Bad game, avoid
5 - Painful to play, completely waste of time
4 - Failed game, unpayable

author: {'steamid': '76561198263672109', 'num_games_owned': 702, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1457204812}
review:
Se podría resumir que es un grand theft auto pero juego retro pixelado. A los creadores de este juego se la pelaba todo y crearon un juego conforme les dio la gana. Es un juego random con personajes estrambolicos y misiones absurdas. Una misión secundaria es ir recogiendo vagabundos que están durmiendo en la calle y echarlos en el contenedor del camión de basura que has robado... ES LA PUTA HOSTIA!

Esta lleno de referencias a otros juegos y ademas tiene muchos minijuegos con personajes de otros juegos (ej: Super meat boy).
El juego es corto, a mi me ha durado 8 horas consiguiendo 17/20 logros, pero es bueno que sea corto porque así no lo aburres, ademas no te hace ir de una parte a otra del mapa, sino que incluso en una misión te dicen:

-Ves allí
-Pero si eso esta al quinto pino!
-Es verdad, voy a llevarte con un tornado.

Y punto, aparece un tornado y te lleva en un segundo(el tornado es de super mario xD).

No es un juego difícil para nada, es la dificultad moderada exacta para que te diviertas, la historia pase a un ritmo adecuado y no te estreses al jugar.

Es un juego que es de los que valen la pena probarlos. El precio en oferta seguro que es aceptable, pero eso ya de pende de cada uno.

Have fun! ;P

author: {'steamid': '76561198240862168', 'num_games_owned': 3722, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1457658711}
review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title: Retro City Rampage™ DX
Genre: Action, Adventure, Indie, Racing
Developer: Vblank Entertainment, Inc. 
Publisher: Vblank Entertainment, Inc.	
Release Date: 11 Nov, 2014[/b]

[h1]Overview[/h1]
This has to be one of my favourite 8-bit games on steam. So what is this game exactly? Well it's exactly what it says it is. A 8-bit open world with a nostalgia feel to it, it really has a nice feel to the game. If Grand Theft Auto where made into a 8-bit graphic, with top down perspective, and some inapropriate humour then this is what you would expect from this game.

[h1]Game Play[/h1]
I really wasn't expecting this game to be as fun as it was. Although I have a few faults with the game play sid eof this game, overall it's rather impressive. As you would expect in any open world game there are quite a few missions to get through, and then there are side missions that may help you in  the actual missions later on. Some of the side missions are rather quite difficult, and the way that some of them are set out aren't really all that fun to play. After doing a few side missions I kind of just went on with the main story and left them out. They might've helped me in the main missions but I don't really think it would of all that much. As for the main missions, some of them where brutally difficult for me. The final boss wasn't really all what I thought it would be, moving from side to side and dodging whatevere that guy was shooting at you. I did rage a few times but beat it in the end. On a positive note, some of the missions where quite funny and simply just what  guy would do to waste time, for example there was a mission to waste time. So you get a hover suit and just bash people on the head instead of waiting. The characters where a little dull and boring, and the story really isn't ll that much, I basically knew what was going on almost all the time without the game telling me what to do. Get a sevral items for the [spoiler]Time Machine[/spoiler] and then get back. Not really all that fun but kept me entertained with the decent missions to keep me playing. The game took me about 9 hours to complete, I still sometimes go on it just to run people over in a car and mess around.
[b]Score (Out Of 10): 7 - Some difficult missions and a dull story, but some really fun missions to play, general fun messing about in the overworld and some funny humour.[/b]

[h1]Graphics/art style[/h1]
The game (if you haven't already noticed) has a 8-bit styled graphic to it which really works well with everything that happens in the game. Everything looks like you would be able to play it in a old school arcade machine. Although some of the animations are a little lazy, for example the cars don't really have any wheel animation on the ground. This can sometimes make it look like everything is just moving across the road with the wheels not running across the road. I'm not really sure what you could've done to solve that but it was kind of annoying  to see that sometimes for me. Other than that nothing else to complain about the game graphics wise.
[b]Score (Out Of 10): 9 - Really nice 8-bit graphics, but some lazy animations here and there.[/b]

[h1]Music & Sound[/h1]
The music and sound for this game where both really good. The sounds for certain things weren't at all generic and really fit well with the 8-bit style of the game, the music also fits well with certain scenarios in the game. Whether you're killing a bunch of robots in a tower or just chilling along the road smashing everything in your path! The game really sets the music well.
[b]Score (Out Of 10): 10 - Some really fitting music and no generic sound effects throughout the game[/b]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
This is probably one of my favourite 8-bit games on steam. With it's decent overworld map to mess about in, the music and sounds along with the awesome 8-bit graphics make it all feel like a pretty solid game. Do be prepaired though for some difficult missions that you might come across in the game that might leave you playing it for more than you want to. But some great humour and game play implemented into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158482502', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1457698595}
review: It was a pretty decent game, up until the ending levels. The gameplay is fun, but gets repetitive very quickly. The story is pretty interesting and is full of references. I would say "Get this game on sale", but then I got to the final levels. Up until the final levels the game was never "cheap", everything seemed fair and most deaths seemed like they were your fault. But the final levels were so cheap, I quit the game. Instant death traps, tons on enemies all attacking you at once, and a final boss cheaper than fucking air. If the gameplay looks interesting to you, maybe get it on sale, but other than that, I would recommend you avoid this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999938574', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 590, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1470486325}
review:
While mocking the modern games and referencing the old ones, Retro City Rampage doesn't provide much in terms of production values. It has cheesy story and dialogues, eye hurting pixel art, chip tune music, sketchy sfx, top down view and everything else you'd expect from a game made in the early 90s.

But guess what, I played a similar game 20 years ago and I don't really want to repeat the experience. You probably know that game, it's called GTA. And it basically did the same as what Retro City Rampage is trying to do, but in a more elegant way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089380234', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1457164309}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076876790', 'num_games_owned': 817, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1477451584}
review:
Retro City Rampage might be one of the poorest attempts at cloning GTA in a long while. Developed by one man, which is cool admittedly, it's basically a Parody of both GTA and other games released throughout the years, which is its only saving grace. The parodies are funny! Everything from Duke Nukem to TMNT to Back To The Future to even Jean-Claude Van Damne are parodied and each one managed to get either a chuckle or a nice laugh from me at times. But that's the games only saving grace

The rest of the game is clunky, monotonous, and down right boring. It's main issue is that it plays its trap card too early with it's tutorial mission. After that, the game just copies itself to the point where even the jokes are boring. What hampers the game even more are the controls. Now I hate saying that the controls can ruin any game (I'm able to look past bad controls if the game is fun), but WOW! These controls are both bad and clunky! Not only is it a pain to move and aim, but the driving is what REALLY kills the game. I get the point that it's supposed to be emulating the NES in terms of gameplay, but come on! Even the driving games on NES had better controls then this clunker! When it comes to the shooting, it's even worse. There is supposed to be a lock on mechanic, but it's one of the worst ones I dealt with. Whenever you are shooting, you lock on to any near by targets and all your shots go there. The issue is that you STAY locked on when you are shooting and you can't freely aim at other targets without ceasing your fire and then firing again. This is a major hindrance when you are in gun fights when are you want to do is aim at another target but you keep targeting other stuff that AREN'T YOUR TARGETS!

Sadly, I can not recommend this game what so ever. Not only does it fail in trying to be a good GTA clone, but it sadly fails in being a parody at times. It does make me mad though...when I first got this game, I loved it. But now, the more I play it, the less I love it and the more I get frustrated with it. Save your cash and skip this game.

FINAL RATING: SKIP

author: {'steamid': '76561198277011659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1456941859}

author: {'steamid': '76561198153011291', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1490434812}
review:
Tutti dicono che sia una parodia di GTA...non è così, questo gioco è una parodia di Saints Row. Infatti come quest'ultimo, Retro City non è il classico "vai dal punto A al punto B" ma ha qualche minigioco/varietà extra che lo rende meno pesante e più divertente essendo meno monotono. E' ricco di humor e si passano delle ore divertentosi quanto basta per renderlo piacevole. Lo consiglio ma sottolineo di averlo preso in un bundle a pochi euro..tuttavia con un sconto del 50% è assolutamente fattibile.

Everyone say: GTA parody, well for me this is a Saint Row parody. In fact Retro city is not the common game "go from A to B" but have also some funny stuff like minigames who make the game less repetitive. There is also good humor and for sure it will gift you some funny moment.
I reccomend the game but i got it in a bundle for some bucks so...for me -50% is worth

author: {'steamid': '76561197998514099', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1456616827}
review: Retro City Rampage is to video games what a Wayans movie is to film. A constant barrage of references does not equal clever or funny writing, and the feelings of nostalgia they may invoke will only distract you from the fact that you will inevitably grow old and die for so long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066022068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1670182808}
review:
Retro City rampage is lacking in both depth and originality and tries to mask it with a retro theme and 80s pop culture references.

At its heart it's a GTA clone that is quick to pull you in and then quick to fall flat. The pixel graphics and simplistic gameplay are charming at first but grow tiring in a hurry. The missions and challenges are frustratingly frantic and unbalanced. The jokes are mildly amusing at first but just boil down to a series of references. It's like 'the big bang theory: the game'

Just look at the hours played by those who recommended it. Countless positive reviews from those who played 2 hours and then forgot the game existed.

Had this come out in the early 90s it would have been amazing. As is, it's a forgettable and mediocre game that leaves you wanting to put it down to play the classics it constantly references.

review: Ну,  здравствуй брат старой доброй ГТА в которою я играл в школе на уроке информатики и никогда бы не подумал что в своей 5 ипостази она превратится в донатный кал. В этой же игре все по старому, можно поставить 8 битную графику для полного погружения и наслаждаться процессом который такой же угарный и веселый как и много лет назад. Много пасхалок, отсылок и дополнительных миссий, каждая из которых имеет свою фишку...Серьезно, открыл ее как всегда случайно и ничуть не пожалел, вот это игра по мне, спасибо ее авторам)))

author: {'steamid': '76561197994849273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1456666340}
review:
I didn't play the game much (half an hour? A bit more perhaps?) but I hardly think I will play it again for long, if ever: the graphic is very nice, the music does it's job (until now it has been ok, not superb) but the game has some *very* serious issues with rithm and humor.

Humor-wise, it looks like it has been written by a 9 years old, or a bunch of drunken nerds: citations, memes and other stuff *everywhere*, and without style. The authors tried the hardest to stack tons and tons of innuendo, winking at this brand, that superhero, etc, but they did it so just throwing stuff around wihout thought or respite.

There is no single line of text that's not a reference to something (a videogames trope, TV, other titles: you name it) and in the end, the result is just a confusing, boring mess. It's like hearing Jon Stewart in fast forward, without pauses between the jokes to enjoy them. And if you think it's cool, think again.

Same problem goes with sory and rithm: the missions are rushed and everything seems to go way to fast. After the first 10 minutes you already start skiping dialogues (it's the usual bunch of so-so puns, random objectives, etc, so why care?) and after half an hour you find yourself in a grand theft auto city, but wihout much interest in exploring or doing much.

The story jumps from one place to the other without a logic, and the settings are good looking, but logically inconsistent: city -> military base (so far so good) -> underground hi-tech complex (ehm...) -> obstacles run in the same base (wtf?) ). 

Might be funny for nostalgic of for the kind of people that get all excited at *counting* references (loook! The ninja turtles!!! Look! It's robocop! Look! That's the car of the A-Team...). Everyone else: stay clear...

author: {'steamid': '76561198002624036', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1456514229}
review:
Quando si satura un lavoro di citazioni è facile che scada in una brutta copia o in un' accozzaglia di cose, ma Retro City Rampage DX non ci casca.
Il gioco è stato inzuppato negli anni '80 e '90: non solo citazioni di Kong, Mario, Link, Threepod, Metal Slug, Metal Gear, Duckhunt e altri miti dei vg, ma anche Supercar, Hazzard, le tartarughe ninja, robocop, i ghostbusters, e persino Peewee (Tim Burton '85).
Il gameplay è solido: sostanzialmente è uno dei primi gta con sortite in altre vecchie formule, il tutto con un'ottima resa artistica in 8bit, e condito con tanta ironia e scorrettezza, ma anche con uno sguardo lucido alla produzione dei videogiochi (ad ex c'è una conversazione che suona più o meno così: 
G:Diavolo! Mi state facendo fare il fattorino da una parte all'altra della città!
N: Non vuoi forse che il tuo gioco duri 40 ore?! Come credi possiamo farlo se non "annacquandotelo"?)
Nel gioco anche un piccolo e apprezzatissimo tributo a Joe Hisahishi, il compositore delle musiche di Kitano e Miyazaki

author: {'steamid': '76561198203861851', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1456562542}

author: {'steamid': '76561198188076478', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1463555786}
review:
HB1刀包带的，本来是冲着逃生买的，玩了玩这个游戏，没想到给我惊喜最多的是这个游戏。从来没想到8-bit的游戏能做的如此出色，像素版的GTA，除了载具少了几个飞行的，其他的都很棒。
我给10分！

author: {'steamid': '76561198020582582', 'num_games_owned': 1575, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1466404614}
review:
不得不迫不及待的安利了！这款俯视角卷轴开放世界8bit像素游戏《荒野老城DX》素质奇高，借鉴了大量例如赤色要塞，GTA等游戏的元素，细节颇丰，画面怀旧，8bit音乐绝赞！麻雀虽小，五脏俱全！载具，武器，通缉，掩体射击，自定义系统，有趣且胡逼的故事，滑稽搞笑的人物行为（甚至还有类似超级马里奥采蘑菇的攻击方式设定~汗），无数的致敬彩蛋，这游戏太棒了，最重要的是现在HB主包1刀部分就有这货，值的一笔！
PS:目前发现的致敬彩蛋：赤色要塞，GTA，合金装备，回到未来，超级食肉男孩，魂斗罗，青蛙过河，盗火线……
有趣的任务：一个合金装备big boss指导的潜入任务，类魂斗罗纵向关卡，骑大猩猩的关卡，骑自行车送快递，plow down pedestrian to speed up（撞倒行人来获得车辆加速），车辆行驶里程按px（pixel像素点）来算233……待补充
+怀旧的8bit画面
+怀旧且好听的8bit音乐
+完善的开放世界
+有趣胡逼的剧情&挑战
+有趣的任务
+各种致敬
+mods支持
-开车手感不好
-大多任务节奏较快
总评：好玩有趣的8-bit独立佳作，热爱FC，GBA游戏的老玩家可以入手了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198042544617', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1456363613}
review:
Retry City Rampage DX copies the core gameplay loop of classic GTA, with lots of arcade style minigames added, along with references and inside jokes. Some of the gags had me laugh out loud, while many others had me cringe. The main storyline is deliberately bad, bogging down in collecting arbitrary parts for a time machine over and over again.

So while this is not a great game, I can't help but give it thumbs up because I honestly had a good time for the 6 hours it took me to finish. There is enough variety and unexpected challenges at every turn to keep you interested, and the whole look and feel is rather authentic.

This could have been a much better game if the developers had taken the storytelling aspect more serious instead of relying on the audience going crazy over excessive referencing of established franchises and indie games. It's definitely worth the price tag, and if you catch it on sale or in a bundle, I say go for it. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044784523', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1456274766}
review: It's basically a pixel version of Grand Theft Auto. It's certainly playable, but I often feel like games like this are just trying to tug at gamer heartstrings out of some sense of nostalgia. I'm glad I got in in a bundle, because I'm not sure I would have gotten it otherwise. I have no idea what it retails for, but if it's any more than any Grand Theft Auto title, you may as well just get one of those instead.

review: Did I enjoyed this game? Well, I certainly did, in the sense that I think it's good fun, and there is plenty of stuff to do, and overall I think it's a good game. Although missions are varied, but it comes back to "drive from A to B", only to find out that you have to return to A too often, and I didn't particularly enjoyed driving through the city as much as  I thought I would. Also, the controls didn't clicked for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113672014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1692972865}
review: Gioco stupendo, mappa piccola ma piena di cose da fare. Missioni sempre varie e casciarone a livelli allucinanti solo che la difficoltà di queste non è lineare ma comunque sempre divertenti. Storia ignorantissima ma arricchita da dialoghi minimali ma semplicemente fantastici.  Ripetitivo forse verso la fine e le missioni secondarie mi sono sembrate un po' poche anche se capisco il desiderio degli sviluppatori di concentrare l'esperienza di gioco in poche ore (anche se comunque sufficienti per un titolo simile. Lo consiglio a tutti anche se per le prime ore provoca una dipendenza preoccupante ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198107796249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 2259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2166, 'last_played': 1431176580}
review:
[quote=][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/12146432-La-Cruceta-Inquieta/][b]La Cruceta Inquieta[/b][/url], mentor de Steam[/quote]

¿Cómo comenzar el análisis de un juego premeditadamente anacrónico y cuya base argumental no sigue ninguno de los dictados del sentido común? Supongo que, simplemente, puede decirse que Retro City Rampage (RCR) se apoya en el quizá más importante pilar de la "escena indie": la libertad creativa.

RCR no es sino un popurrí de géneros y situaciones recopilados de aquí y de allí para crear un producto que, al mismo tiempo que homenajea una época y su forma de hacer videojuegos, satisface la cantidad mínima recomendada anual de nostalgia de sus potenciales compradores/jugadores. No se trata de que intente ganarnos con la profundidad de su trama o de su jugabilidad, sino que lo intenta (y lo consigue por el mero hecho de captar nuestra nostálgica atención) yendo directo al grano al presentarnos y ponernos en bandeja situaciones, referencias y cameos ochentero-noventeros de películas, series, videojuegos, etc., a cada cual más surrealista y carente de cualquier tipo de conexión con la anterior.

Obviamente, partiendo de tal premisa, poco o nada puede aportar una trama que es una desconexión absoluta en sí misma. Como puede entenderse, el argumento es una excusa para la aparición de "retroreferencias", desarrollándose a lo largo del juego a través de infinitud de acontecimientos, los cuales es mejor que vayamos completando y olvidando para poder pasar inmediatamente (y recalco INMEDIATAMENTE porque RCR no nos concederá tregua alguna) al siguiente en cuestión sin buscarle demasiado sentido al orden de aparición de unos u otros. No obstante, este aspecto aparentemente negativo no lo es cuando sabemos que no se pretende otra cosa que presentarnos un mundo loco, frenético y carente de sentido excepto para ahondar en los recovecos más oscuros de nuestra memoria, aspecto que, de sobra, consigue. 

Gráficamente tampoco pierde el tiempo, presentándonos un mundo de 8 bits que, al igual que ocurre con las referencias argumentales, encantará a los amantes de los videojuegos retro por haber crecido con ellos. Una vez más, ahora de forma visual, RCR apela directamente a la nostalgia del jugador. Así, personajes, escenarios y efectos lucen un aspecto pixelado propio de la era inicial de los videojuegos pero con un acabado completamente actual más acorde con los estándares de la alta definición. El diseño es igualmente retro y colorista, basándose muchas veces en el de las propias fuentes a las que hace referencia, en este caso, el de la época dorada de los videojuegos. También es algo a destacar el hecho de que no sólo el estilo de 8 bits intenta llevarnos a una epoca pasada y ¿mejor?, sino que el nivel de detalle alcanzado en cuanto a diseño nostálgico se refiere llega hasta a haber definido toda una serie de filtros de pantalla que emulan los ordenadores, consolas y recreativas clásicas (¡incluso una emulación 3D completamente funcional de la Virtual Boy!) y distintas perspectivas de visión según la situación: 2D cenital, 2D lateral y 3D.

El sonido no podía sino apoyar el estilo general del juego, apostando por melodías y efectos retro, respectivamente igual de pegadizas y onomatopéyicos que lo eran los originales en su época. No se trata de un aspecto a destacar, sino que se limita a cumplir su función de apoyo al resto de aspectos retro de RCR o, incluso a veces, se magnifica para destacar la exageración efectista, bien por falta de medios o por dejadez, propia de los primeros videojuegos.

Por último, donde también destaca RCR es en su jugabilidad y diseño de niveles. A pesar de ser un juego premeditadamente retro, el hecho de que se haya optado por el tan de actualidad esquema de mundo abierto y por un desarrollo basado en fragmentos de "gameplay" que son casi minijuegos de todo tipo de géneros, hace que el resultado general sea completamente disfrutable en la actualidad y nos aleje de la sensación de estar jugando a algo desfasado. El control, pese a ser un tanto duro y ortopédico al principio (quién sabe si tal vez también de manera premeditada), se tornará sencillo tras unos cuantos intentos, adaptándose bien tanto a los momentos en los que la vista es cenital, como a los de desarrollo lateral o en tres dimensiones. Es esta misma variedad de estilos gráficos la que, junto con la variedad de situaciones, hace que cada momento sea distinto del anterior y que, gracias a la sucesión frenética de los mismos, la jugabilidad sea igualmente variada y nunca deje momentos para el aburrimiento.

Uno de los aspectos negativos de RCR es su corta duración, que se suple en parte gracias a los extras y, aunque suene a consuelo, puede justificarse porque un alargamiento de la misma sólo provocaría una sobresaturación innecesaria de nuestra capacidad de asimilar acontecimientos. También la traducción al castellano deja que desear en determinados momentos, pero este es un aspecto sobre el que tal vez no proceda opinar puesto que es posible que, una vez más, se hayan introducido errores de manera premeditada, emulando lo común que este hecho era en la época de los videojuegos a los que RCR hace referencia. Eso sí, la versión original en inglés no tiene estos errores de traducción, pero claro, siempre puede decirse que en aquella época tampoco existían o no eran tan comunes como en el caso del castellano.

En resumen, RCR es un juego que juega, valga la redundancia, con la nostalgia del público al que principalmente se dirige y que, en concreto, creció con la TV de la década de los ochenta y principios de los noventa, aportando una perspectiva nueva a géneros de todo tipo y condición de una época que, para aquellos, siempre será la época dorada de los videojuegos. Abstenerse nacidos en el nuevo milenio a no ser que se quiera presenciar un espectáculo, ahora sí, completamente surrealista y sin sentido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254019706', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1561808135}
review: Игра сама по себе хорошая, оставляет много приятных впечатлений, да и достаточно любопытная. Ну в первую очередь, это связано с графикой, похожей как у Dendy, это по сути ностальгия по легендарной приставке. Геймплей, фактически как у первой части GTA, точно такой же: вид сверху, такая же графика (еще тех времен) Прямо старые добрые 90 - года! Можно как и в GTA San Andreas, Vice City делать полный беспредел, напрягать копов, бегать, угонять авто и т.д. Управление вообще для чайников, с ним никаких проблем быть не должно, да и игра сама не капризная в плане системных требований. Короче, одобряю!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126229767', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1452777943}
review: Gran juego con una gran cantidad de referencias a clasicazos retro como Duck Hunt y Megaman; y a series y películas tan míticas como Las Tortugas Ninja, Regreso al Futuro y los Cazafantasmas. author: {'steamid': '76561197994530559', 'num_games_owned': 2201, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1626632114}
review:
[list]
[*] GTA-like retro game. You can drive around in various types of vehicles ranging from bicycles to monster truck
[*] On-foot gameplay. You can hide behind covers, shoot with lock-on, shoot in any direction with right analog stick and last, but not least. STOMP your opponents.
[*] References lot of old games/movies. I must admit the these were really funny and done well.
[*] It's crazy how many options are there to tweak color scheme to mimic certain systems or create your own mix.
[/list]

Only thing I have to say was bad is the ending boss. Trying too hard to make it difficult like old games while the whole game is fairly easy :|

author: {'steamid': '76561198106780375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1596817520}
review:
Hours of fun and time spent at breaking past levels that keep you crying. Would have been better if the missions are better designed. Definitely not my type of game. Buy this only if you are interested in the Metrovania theme with retro gaming elements. The game crashes at random points despite updates that have claimed to fix.

10/10 would remove it from steam library

author: {'steamid': '76561198048752110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1450894133}
review:
It's a neat concept, it really is. 
you play as a street thug running around a retro-GTA inspired enviroment and be amused by 80's/early 90's gaming and pop culture references. 

But I think it tries a little too hard with that concept, to the point where the game doesn't exactly feel all that fun to play. Maybe I just feel like the indie-gaming market is a little over saturated with "old school" and "retro" and "pixel graphics" games, and this really shoves that in your face in spades. 

Now, I could've gotten a refund but I do still felt like there was fun to be had here. And it is very clear that the devs had  a real love for the game that they made and homages they were shooting for. And that's great, I support that. But as far as the game itself, I think it's just a little too much of a decent idea, leaving it feeling a little unfocused and not all that fun to physically play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003652892', 'num_games_owned': 2894, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1500167910}
review:
Excellent soundtrack, tons of excellent graphic modes to tailor the gameplay to suit you perfectly, tons of weapons, great characters, witty, cheesy references, awesome cars, the list goes on!

Worth buying for the soundtrack and references alone tbh. Imagine GTA: Vice City and Commando for the NES had a baby together? that baby would be Retro City Rampage <3

I got this game on sale for 69P, the same price as a bottle of soda, Excellent game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198204588892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1531726865}
review:
I saw the video about the optimizations behind this game and that already got my interest. This is the most awesome game done in years in the sense of coding and optimizations. This is what a true retro game looks like and how it is made.

Today I decided to go ahead and try the game. I was amazed at the details hidden in it. All the cool references to the old arcade classics, the different minigames and cool little easter egg type treasures. This is truly a great achievement. I would recommend this game for anyone who has played any 8 bit games and also to anyone who hasn't to see how would the best 8-bit game look and play. Also I would suggest this game to any game developer as there are a lot of things to learn from this masterpiece. Looking forward to next game from these guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014493379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1451429153}
review: This is the most 80's game about the 80's that ever 80'd. I can't think of any 80's phenomenon this game didn't reference. Maybe Alf? The game is a pretty fun 2D gta with minigames and homages to 8 bit classics. Gets pretty tough near the end of the main story, with lots of frantic old school action. There are callbacks to Mario, Mega Man, Contra, Battletoads, even Castlevania. Looking forward to the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060931144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1683018652}
review:
It's a parody of GTA, only with as much 80s/early 90s pop culture references shoved in to appease anyone of that time period. This game's more like a 8 bit recreation of GTA 3 (The Player is clearly modeled after Claude) and it's honestly one of my favorite games of all time. I own it on Vita, 3DS, and Xbox 360 and I really can't get enough of this game. Buy it now if you want some crazy pixelated mayhem! 

Oh, and by the way,

There's a sequel coming soon titled Shakedown Hawaii that seems to be a 16 bit parody of Vice City. I cannot wait.

review: Динамичный пародийный экшен, очень влекущий к себе незабвенным звучанием восьмибитной музыки от великих композиторов игр прошлого и настоящего - Норрина Рада, Вирта и Фрики ДиЭнЭй. Игра прочно вошла в пантеон моих любимых игр на компьютере и завоевала мою любовь. - Не видел ещё игры похожей на неё. Очень эффектная и ностальгичная. Играть можно всем, даже детям., так как жестокость в игре совершенно анимированная и пикселизированная - походит скорее всего на юмор.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996057322', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1377086227}
review:
Retro City Rampage ist ein Topdown-Openworld-Sandbox-Spiel, welches sich an GTA orientiert und viele Anspielungen auf andere Videospiele in sich hat. Die Story ist nicht wirklich vorhanden auch wenn es einen roten Faden verfolgt.

Es kommt nicht an GTA 2 ran, da es sich nicht so lohnt nur Scheiße zu bauen. Die Missionen sind das unterhaltsame hier, vorallem dank vieler wie bereits erwähnter Anspielungen auf Videospielklassiker.

Die Steuerung ist gut, die Grafik passt zum Spiel und die Musik war okay. Wer auf ein GTA2-artiges Spiel Lust hat, sollte zugreifen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070704692', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1401653902}
review:
Grand Theft Auto con visuale dall'alto in stile 8-bit, questo è Retro City Rampage™ DX. 
Catapultati in un mondo anni 80, fra citazioni di film storici quali "Ritorno al futuro, o chiari riferimenti a giochi come PacMan, Frogger,Contra, Tapper, Smash Tv,etc.. e usi e costumi del periodo, vestiremo i panni di un simil "Fonzie" aiutato da uno strano scienziato (Doc). Per le strade di Theftropolis, vivremo le 62 missioni che compongono la campagna principale, e molte altre le missioni secondarie  per una ventina di ore di pur divertimento in stile anni 80.
Altamente consigliato agli amanti del retrogame!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984308710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1445211656}
review: One of the most overhyped games of all time.  Most of the game is 30 second snippets of better games from the 80's.  Until you get to the end of the game when the levels go on FAR too long.  The difficulty balance is off too.  Again, most of the game is a cakewalk, you can ease through it with no effort.  Then you get to the last 10 levels or so (out of 64) and the game just becomes a bull shit sandwich.  The dam level of TMNT, for example, is considered one of the worst of the NES era.  So of course this game makes you do it twice.  Road Blaster is one of my favorite games of all time, but the end of the game forces you to do it 6 times, wrapping up with a boss that you can only beat with luck.  He has a specific pattern, but he "cheats" in that sometimes his missles go where you are going to be, not were you were when he fired them.  Sometimes, but not always.  It's a violation of the boss pattern and had me throwing my controller and screaming profanities by the end of the night.  The graphics are cute for about 5 minutes, then you realize you can't really tell what the hell is going on most of the time.  The chiptunes are pretty good, but once the loop is over, the game won't start a new song unless you trigger a cutscene or get in a car.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983377045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1445029059}
review: I have mixed feelings but overall I enjoyed the few hours I threw into this game. It's not a masterpiece, still it can entertain you for 3-4 evenings. My expectations were really high but in the end it's nothing more than a good ironic 8-bit retro styled rush. Get it only if you love citations to death and want a blast IN the past. Nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039585522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 4837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1580516982}
review: This game absolutely assaults you start to finish with non-stop pop culture references and mechanics from other games, but the thing is it goes so damn hard with it all that it actually comes back around and feels surprisingly fresh and original.  Plus, it really is a stunningly well-executed demake of GTA when you get down to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982259728', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1658354473}
review:
well there is a few things i want to clear up about this one, I played this on my vita for about 254 hours 44 min according to my little play log adding up each things 3-5 hours to 30 min a play session. Playing this one  it is the same thing with same features just not portable to the vita version (makes me wish i didnt give it to my sister who's daughter lost the charging cord) The only thing the steam has for it are the following

more updates (updates * more stuff / awesome sauce = a cookie)
more renames (retro city rampage, retro city rampage DX, you know renameing is good for anyone hehe)
less cost ($9.99 steam store vs $14.99 on playstation store at the time of preorder on play station store)
better control (root of 3 reason never good with joy stick)
mod ablility (square of 3 reasons i got this after the fact)
better screen view (power of 3 reason i dont have good eye sight)

i still recommend it for those that havent played the game but for those that have played the game on another console still get this for a little more bang for your buck and some cheating galore (if you want XD)

author: {'steamid': '76561197982225800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 318, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1441673269}
review:
I think the developers executed exactly the type of game they wanted to make, and I love them for some of the funky stuff they've done, like creating an MS-DOS port and some of their assembly (ASM) stuff out on the web.

Unfortuntately -- and this is a purely subjective & personal beef -- Retro City Rampage DX felt like a power-fantasy for children. I did not enjoy the pacing & easiness of the game, and had to put it down after 0.7 hours - and I haven't had the will to pick it up since.

Hopefully I'll change my mind some day and play it again, and then commit seppuku because my opinion was made in haste. But these days, I value my time a lot more, so I'm not sure if it was wrong to judge it after my short time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031787666', 'num_games_owned': 780, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1579344362}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098011828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2831, 'last_played': 1426338382}
review:
PROS: This game is awesome. It's like a 16 bit version of GTA. You can drive cars, shoot people, hit wit' a bat and it has hours of exploration that will have you playing for a long time. I beat the game and still think about playing. Also, in my opinion the mini games are quite interesting. The story is entertaining and the missions are fun to go on so that you can increase your skill or just have fun.

CONS: After you beat the game the rush of blowing stuff up and regular activities may fade. (Like mini games and missions). Some stages may provide little to no challenge for some, but don't misunderstand me, if you are human, you are bound to make mistakes that will cost you your life.

INCONCLUSION: Retro City Rampage DX is a great game weather on sale or not. This game is for sadists that like breaking the rules and having fun. This game isn't for you if you want a long story.


9.1/10.

review: I can't get enough of this game. It's a love letter to the days of 80s PC gaming, and to the old-school GTA topdown games. If you enjoy either one of those, you're going to love this game, even if you don't the game itself is easy to pick up and play. Hell, the game is ported to nearly every console at this point, including the MS-DOS. This is what I call a well crafted game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024996157', 'num_games_owned': 2679, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1443272263}
review:
A real old school retro top down game unlike any other sticking to 8 bit era style faithfully. Fun variety of weapons and enjoyable story mode spoofing various aspects of gaming/pop culture. Removes a lot of frustration of those games with generous checkpoints and skip able missions. 

Overall  Verdict —  Good for a nostalgic diversion for a couple hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043990017', 'num_games_owned': 1006, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1527199851}
review:
Крайне любопытная игрушка. По сути - геймплей первой GTA с примесью уровней в духе известных игр прошлого. Причина - сама суть проекта, заключающаяся в пародировании продуктов массовой культуры 80-90х годов. Множество отсылок на каждому шагу, а сюжет буквально состоит из стебок на соответствующую тему. Расписывать или упоминать их нет смысла - слишком уж много всего этого веселья в RCR. 

DX-издание вроде как немного навело порядок в балансе. Позже, что примечательно, вышли версии игры для Windows 3.1 и MS-Dos. Последняя работает отлично - прошел RCR:DX на DOSBox (потому не следует смотреть на время в Стиме). Жаль, только, что ачивменты у каждой версии свои.

В распоряжении игрока небольшой, но забитый за отказа всякими мелочами город, и куча оружия для того, чтобы сеять хаос. А еще очень забавная сюжетка и большой набор испытаний и состязаний, для победы в которых нужна известная доля ловкости. Управление простенькое, а геймплей очень разнообразный. И в трубы прыгать будете, и на танке кататься, и мечом рубить. Игра очень увлекает. Благо, она не слишком длинная - за пару-тройку дней сюжетку реально пробежать, не особенно напрягаясь.  

Однозначно стоит порекомендовать тем, кто ностальгирует по временам NES и т.п.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115877721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1444193293}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025041151', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1441635563}
review:
Retro City Rampage is an amazing indie gem that goes way further than a GTA clone should ever go. Epic music, tight controls, funny references, all packed in to one game that doesn't pretend to be anything it's not. It's a great length, never feels boring, and keeps me replaying it every once in a while. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003640818', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1440796720}
review:
Pros:
- Sometimes funny.
- Lots of other game references, so it's fun to see what you can remember.
- Very satisfying to run over lots of pedestrians with a combo chain.
- Variating missions.

Cons:
- God awful controls especially when you try to aim. If you want to use a mouse like a normal person, then you still shoot fews seconds after releasing the buttons also if you are moving, you will be still moving in the same direction you started to move while shooting. Dunno how they screwed up like this.
- Cops who always try to run over you are going to get on your nerves really quickly. It's possible to evade them, but still very annoying,
- Challenges... Oh god... Some are really fun and interesting but there is this stupid thing when devs without thinking or trying themselves give a challenge with idiotic goals. For example sweat bomber challenge. It is a very fun challenge where you are just an exploding person who can propel himself with exploding and travel quickly. Goal for a golden medal - destroy 50 cars in 60s. You have to destroy 1 car every 1.2s. Sounds logical? Especially when cars appear based on rng? Really? 47 cars is my cap. Always at the last 5s cars disappear. It is not hard to destroy those cars, there are not enough cars even when you are flying non-stop.
- Last mission... I was going to give this game a 6-7 out of 10 score but after that mission I am sticking with 4/10. Not going to spoil what stupidity went on there but Jesus... Now every time I remember this game, I want to puke. Yay.

Conclusion:
Don't buy this game. Watch a let's play or walkthrough but don't waste any money on it. After finishing it, you will feel that you wasted ~10h of life for nothing. You will appreciate this game more if you won't be the one playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055676738', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1694073459}
review:
[h1]Heavily resembling an earlier 8-bit game-hence the name-, [i]Retro City Rampage DX[/i] is an open-world top-down self-aware adventure filled with popular culture references from the 1980s. The player takes the roll of a character name Player who resembles a greaser ‘cool kid’ from its said zone of reference. With heavy influence from the [i]Destructoid[/i] crew (back when Jim Sterling was involved), this game features an abundance of weapon types, game and player modifications, and humorous themes. Apart from the content I would like to feature in the exposition of this review, a very noteworthy act by the creators of [i]Retro City Rampage[/i] was the free update involving the Director’s Cut (DX) edition, which was supplemented to each other platform as well as Steam.[/h1]

Here are just a few reasons to give this game a try:

Open World - Similar to the first two [i]Grand Theft Auto[/i] titles, [i]Retro City Rampage DX[/i] utilizes a top-down open-world approach, which permits the exploration of the vast overworld on foot or with one of the game’s many unique vehicles. Within this sandbox are varying side missions, shops, secrets (featured later), a primary story arch, and non-player characters which stride throughout the area with their own agendas. Seeing as though the Player can wreak havoc in many different ways with both a large inventory of weapons and objects as well as utilizing vehicle collisions, police pursue the same principles as they would in early [i]Grand Theft Auto[/i] titles: kill the Player. Apart from this perspective, the actual missions within the world are quite enjoyable; the primary quest-line advances the story and side quests typically give the Player access to unique equipment, vehicles, and services.

Free Roaming Mode - When the Player wishes to experience the sandbox action to [i]Retro City Rampage DX[/i] without having to focus on missions appearing on the mini-map and the loss of money as a death penalty, Free Roaming mode is always available from the Main Menu. Though some of the features are not accessible as they would be through the main game-such as completing various missions-, Free Roam spawns the Player with nearly every weapon available and practically pats you on the head while saying, “Go have fun!” There is absolutely not penalty for death-with a life tracker humorously tracing the Player’s deaths in the negatives-but the same overworld ‘police chase you if you do something bad’ theme still applies.

Humor - [i]Retro City Rampage DX[/i] features references mostly from 1980s popular culture such as [i]Yoshi[/i] from the [i]Super Mario Brothers[/i] and pop icon Michael Jackson, and presents these fairly bluntly throughout the territory. One instance would be a useable Warp Pipe-originally seen in the [i]Super Mario Brothers[/i] franchise-which takes the Player to a run-down sewer system that presents themes from other titles such as [i]Pitfall[/i]. Somewhat subtle remark placements, however, can be viewed in the game, though it does help to know or have heard of at least some icons from the 1980s to understand these.

Secrets - I prefer to allow Players to delve into this item on their own terms, but [i]Retro City Rampage DX[/i] retains its 1980s gaming feel by packing secrets all over the map, with both simple and complex means in which to attain and discover them. There is an array of enjoyable hidden content within this game, from unlockable Player skins to special objects. Keep an eye out! My word of advice: write down those codes; you will know what I mean.

TL:DR - Though simple, [i]Retro City Rampage DX[/i] is a highly enjoyable title that melds traditional themes with a ton of awesome gameplay mechanics. I do apologize for not writing much about this game in comparison to other titles, but I must admit that this one is one of my favorites regardless. I highly recommend giving this game a try; this is not a high-budget AA title, but its charm alone is what makes this game so engaging, with gameplay that entices the Player to continue the trek. Thanks for reading.

Do you feel this review helped in any way? Feel free to visit my Curator Page at [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9793734/]Spearpoint Reviews[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561197978674491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1513475836}
review: It's like GTA before GTA took itself too seriously, with sprinkles of Contra and beat-em-up platforming hybrids. Also, filled with 80's pop culture references. (though almost too many, heh)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1438372706}
review: Imagine an 8-bit Grand Theft Auto clone and you've got Retro City Rampage pretty much thought out. If you took a GTA protagonist and had them take a Forrest Gump-style tour through 80s videogames and cinema, the result would be exactly what you get here: A lot of thievery, swearing, ultra-violence, explosions and generally just a complete mess. But hey, you get the high score. The odd thing about RCR is that it's generally more fun then any of the games that inspired it, and manages to be much more forgiving in difficulty besides. Accompanying its relentlessly entertaining and reference-laden campaign is a series of bonus levels, including rampages that test just how well you can do what a GTA player does best- tear shit up. There's also plenty of unlockables, including a number of extra playable characters, a huge variety of weapons and vehicles, and that chiptuny goodness you expect from one of these retraux titles. If you like virtually ANYTHING from the last, like, 35 years of nerdery, you're likely to find something in Retro City Rampage that makes you smile. I know I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096092988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1547411969}
review:
[h1] Retro City Rampage DX+ [/h1] 

GTA 1 feeling gepaart mit so ziemlich allen Dingen, welche Kinder der 80er & 90er in der heutigen Zeit vermissen. Wer alt genug ist wird durch die Bank weg ständig grinsen und lächeln müssen und dadurch automatisch an "die gute alte Zeit" denken :D
Auch aus aktueller Zeit lassen sich Hier und Da paar Anspielungen finden (Batman Dark Knight). Aber "die Kids von Heute" werden unter Umständen mit einigen Anspielungen nix anfangen können... macht aber nix. Das Spiel ist trotzdem super für zwischendurch auch wenn es stückweit von dem Wissen um bestimmte Anspielungen lebt.

Ob im Angebot oder zum Vollpreis, wer GTA 1 super fand und in den 80ern & 90ern groß geworden ist wird auch hier seine Freude haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063413078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1042, 'last_played': 1438126299}
review:
In una parola: Bellissimo!!
Detto questo, passiamo alla recensione.
Retro City Rampage DX si può paragonare ad un GTA in 8-bit, perchè non solo è un open-world, ma anche di riferimenti alla cultura pop degli anni 80 e 90. Impersoneremo semplicemente il Giocatore che insieme a Doc Choc vanno alla caccia dei pezzi per una macchina del tempo... la storia è ricca di colpi di scena ed anche di cameo.
La grafica è molto bella, perchè si ispira agli 8-bit e come se non bastasse la Vblank Enterteinament ha realizzato una vera versione per MS-DOS di RCR chiamata appunto Retro City Rampage 486 Edition, per dimostrare che realizzare un open-world in una console 8-bit fosse possibile (anche perchè è inclusa la versione ROM Prototipo 100% hardware accurato 8-bit). Il sonoro è pazzesco ed è in puro stile 8-bit, ovvero in chiptune, con le stazioni radio che le adoreremo alla follia. Per il gameplay (esattamente quando l'ho detto all'inizio), è GTA, ma fatto in 8-bit. Possiamo rubare le auto, prendere armi, giocare a tre minigiochi bellissimi e particolari, con le guest star tra cui Meat Boy e CommanderVideo che le potete usare alla modalità libera, potete andare al casinò, scommettere sui cavalli (mi ricorda molto GTA San Andreas), e altro ancora. I riferimenti ne potete trovare a iosa, e in alcuni casi, riderete i gusto.
Posso dire che se amate o meno il genere, provatelo e non ve ne pentirete.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983225082', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1436920281}
review:
I will be honest when I first got this game I enjoyed it but thought it was way to hard. The missions all seemed very hard to complete and I gave up on it. However this new version seems to be a lot easier to play and to enjoy. Also the resolution on the sprites look a lot better. Before they were very hard to see. Its also got a lot of 80's references inside the game that I really enjoy. A fun and so far easy game to enjoy.

Ok so I got to the very end boss... The few levels before meeting the head boss were not up to the level of play I had expected thru the entire game sadly. Most are one hit kill=deaths. Their is an underwater where if you touch a gear you insta killed. Not to be out done on this insta kill. Also just a side note. I am tired of indie developers including insta kills in their games. TIRED OF THIS TREND. 

Their is a mini boss fight inside of a building with gears and some chicks who have rockets that will push you into being insta killed. Then you have the mini boss who can also insta kill you. Sigh.

I did manage to beat the mini boss. So then we come to the last boss. Ugh. Sigh. Head pounding on desk at this point. Your a car with machine guns. This is fine. Why do I have to get carpal tunnel syndrome hitting the fire button for every single shot??????? Thats right no continous fire button you have to press it for each and every shot. Ugh again and of course its not just and the boss on a road. Oh no its you and the boss and other cars and exploding canisters just for more fun. You get 5 chances however pressing the button each and every time to fire( the boss has a life bar that is almost as long as my arm) will cause your to develop carpal syndrome.

I will say I enjoyed the game till the very end levels that still have me scratching my head over these insta kill levels. So their you have it. Is it worth your time? I would say it depends on how much it costs. I would say for the $10 dollars asking price. NO. Its way to expensive for the game price. On sale for under $5 dollars then yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179982978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1435874321}
review:
This game is amazing.  Seriously.  First of all, don't be put off by the 8-bit style.  This is truly an open-world game, with great story missions AND side missions.  The controls are great, and there are also several minigames ou can play if you're bored of the main missions.  Since the game has old-fashioned graphics, lots of lower-end computers can handle it, and mine runs it very well, no frame rate drops.  The setting itself is awesome, and I love finding the 80's and 90's references throughout the game, they  really give a nice atmosphere.  Honestly, no game is perfect, but this one is pretty darn fun.  And that's what video games are supposed to be, fun.


8/10-  An enjoyable experience.

review:
Davvero carino questo titolo. Per gli amati del retrogaming e di cio che riguarda gli anni 80 è un must. 
Prima di prenderlo lessi delle recensioni e devo dire che la gente è incontentabile.
C'è chi ha detto che è bello solo le prime missioni perchè ci sono tante citazioni ma che poi va sminuendosi.
Il gioco è tutto citazioni e lo trovo divertente, forse un po troppo iperveloce però davvero spassoso. 
Dai 3 euro in giu secondo me è un affare per gli amanti del genere.
